name: Tetrade
description: Tetrade is a three dimensional boardgame on a triangular board with six holes on each side. Players put spheres in alternate turns and try to occupy the four corners of a tetrahedron with the size of 2,3,4,5 or 6 elements. Three spheres of lower level carry one sphere of higher level. A player succeeding in forming a tetrahedron receives a sphere from the hand of the opponent, so that this player is stalemated at the end of the game.

name: Quarks
description: Quarks is played on a 7x7-grid with one player ruling the transparent pieces and the other the solid ones. Both players try to form a column containing all elementary colors with one captured piece at the bottom and two friendly ones in the remaining colors. The first player who forms three of those Quarks wins the game.

name: Sixon
description: Sixon is played on a hexagonal board with five elements on each side, both players trying to reduce the hostile side to less than three. A piece is captured when standing on a cell threatened by three enemy pieces forming a triangle. Pieces may move over the edges of the board when turning their direction in an acute-angled way.

name: Triade
description:
Triade is a positional game played on a hexagonal board with four
elements on each side. Players try to form triangles of any size which reduces the hostile sides position. Pieces may move overboard when changing their direction.

name: Jok-Lob
description: This is a simulation of a tennis game. Player throws special dice to serve, then his opponent directly hit the ball back if he is in the right place, or else uses a card to see if he can reach the shot, and so on.

name: Sinyavino 1942
description:
From the designer's website:

Sinyavino Offensive covers the "crossfire" offensive conducted by the Soviet forces in August, 1942. Crossfire, for it was a daring offensive from two opposite directions focused on a single objective: to free the isolated forces and people of Leningrad before the Germans conducted their own operation to seize the city! The bottleneck area held by German forces was no more than a few miles wide and defended by no more than three divisions. From the East, the Soviets would toss a total of 14 divisions and 100 tanks to smash the Nazi. From the West, across the Neva River, another 2-3 divisions and a tank brigade would conduct an amphibious assault. The battle would last over 30 days and desperate for both sides. At first, Red forces seriously broke through, forcing Hitler to cancel his own offensive to seize Leningrad and divert General Mainstein's forces to save the impending disaster. The battle was also the debut for Germany's new AFV, the Tiger tank!

Contains:
• 11" x 17" map
• 280 counters
• 11 page rules
• 2 page Player aid
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Super Heat Surf Card Game
description:
For two to six people, all ages. Experience the thrill of competitive surf action any time, anywhere! Compete for the most points to win. Easy to learn. Great to trade and collect.

Each 104 card deck has six character cards and 12 manoeuvre cards for each player, plus bonus point and penalty cards.

name: Score Dr. J. Basketball Game
description: Score Dr. J Basketball Game is an action game that features pictures of Julius Erving on the cover. The game has a shooting device that allows you to try and score baskets from anyplace on the court. The degree of difficulty of the shot determines what value is attached to the basket.

name: Stymie
description: Stymie is one of the games in the "Quickles" set produced by Ashburn Industries in the late 1970s. Using a modified standard deck - cards numbered 1-12 in four suits, plus six wild cards - players add to a central sum, trying to avoid pushing it over 100. Players then score points, with the objective of the players also being to avoid going over 100 (or reaching 0, from an initial score of 50).

name: Hexad
description: Hexad is one of the games in the "Quickles" set produced by Ashburn Industries in the late 1970s. Using a modified standard deck - cards numbered 1-12 in four suits, plus six wild cards - players attempt to reach the total given in the center first by using addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and the numbers in their hands. An advanced variant is offered wherein 2s can be used for square roots, 3s for cube roots, and so on.

name: Stock Market
description:
Stock Market game simulating the real stock market.

Parts:

One game board
6 markers - in the shape of small ticker tape machines
1 pair of dice
16 Good Tip cards
16 Bad Tip cards
16 Good News cards
16 Bad News cards
32 stock certificates for made up companies
Paper money totaling $1 billion

Winning the Game: To be the first player to gain outright and complete ownership of all the certificates in 4 different companies.

name: Vaeva
description:
Contents: a 20×20 board, 9 squared orange pawns and 9 squared yellow pawns, a rectangular platform 4×2.

The platform is set in the centre of the board, and the players try to access it. Pawns can move aside diagonally or jump over others. Some moves depend of the number of pawns upon the platform, which can also be moved. He who have put 5 pawns upon the platform wins the game.

name: New Parlor Game: The Path to Matrimony
description:
Game board has decoration of a maze with arrows which either allow players to move backward or forward. Considering the age of the game, a spinner was most likely used for movement. The center of the board one lands on "The Alter."

W.J. Morgan & Co. operated in Cleveland Ohio from 1871-1908. It was a lithography firm that produced trade cards and advertising posters for sewing machines, stoves, medicines and petroleum.

name: Go On or The Run for the Stake
description: Game board is in a circular pattern where a person goes from circle to circle trying to get to the "Stake" first. Board does not have a maker's mark, but it is similar to McLoughlin Brothers boards. The date on it is copyright Jan. 1884. Wonderful printing lithographed colors.

name: Stepping Stones of Life
description:
Game where players strive to become the President of a business. Pitfalls along the way include a late train, missed street car, arrested, late for work etc. Four corners of the board have a Home, Hotel, Hospital and Court.

Pieces include:

gameboard
4 different colored metal figures
game spinner showing how many spaces to move

The games purpose is to promote good work habits and characteristics which lead to success

name: The Game of Bamboozle or the Enchanted Isle
description: This was one of the first large folding board games produced by Milton Bradley. Game board has a wonderfully lithographed fantasy land where one takes paths to get to the Enchanted Isle. The center of the board has two castle, woods, bears, a tent, a windmill and a church. The paths weave along the outside and into the center. The paths along the outside represent water and has pictures of a steamboat, canoeist, serpent, and whale. The four corners of board are one city scene, one house scene, one mermaid and one lighthouse. This particular version, with a plain box (likely considered "deluxe" at that time) is later than the first 1876 version, which probably featured a more decorative printed image on the box cover. This version probably dates from around 1900.

name: GameVault 2050
description:
Players take the role of computer hackers, wandering the board in an attempt to download game designs and smuggle them off the network.
The game was published August 13, 2004 in Pyramid Magazine. Because of the restructuring of Pyramid, it is no longer available.
Sample:
http://www.sjgames.com/pyramid/sample.html?id=4904
publishers: (Web published), Pyramid Magazine, Steve Jackson Games

name: Five Card Baseball
description:
From the publisher's website:

"Real baseball situations are implemented into the game to make it as real as it can get. The game is for one or two players Ages 8 and up. Five Card Baseball is played with a 60 card deck. Flip the cards and watch the game unfold like magic. Witness your opponent walk to first base, steal second and score on a single as you watch helplessly. Defeat your opponent in a realistic 9 inning game. Five Card Baseball can also be played with two or more decks for a more interesting experience."

The game is for one or two players and involves revealing cards to simulate situations in a baseball game.

name: Sandbox Hill
description:
Sandbox hill is a miniatures wargame that uses plastic army men as soldiers and die-cast metal cars as tanks and can be played in about any location.

The game requires you supply:

Soldiers: at least 60 army men preferably in two colors
Tanks: at least 6 die cast metal cars (hot-wheels, matchbox, etc)
Artillery: several hundred large rubber bands
Mines: a hand full of quarters (or equivalent coins)
The Injurator: One large pair of scissors
The Mauler: One large hammer
The Moverator: A piece of string twelve inches long.
The Rangefinder: A standard twelve inch ruler.
The Iron Dice: One or two six-sided dice.
Eye Preserver: Two pairs of safety goggles


In the game players take turns activating 5 soldiers or tanks, most can move and shoot on turn but there are a variety of different troop types with some special abilities modifying this. Dexterity based rubber band flicks are used for ranged combat and die rolling for close combat. Damage is represented by either a die roll that tells what part of the infantry figure to cut off with The Injurator (large scissor) or for tanks a blow with The Mauler (large hammer)

The game rules are available for free download as a full color PDF from http://www.animalball.com/games.html
categories: Action / Dexterity, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: American Pie
description:
American Pie is a simple card game for 3-5 players, excellent for family play. Each player is a cook trying to make good cakes (there 6 different types of cakes in the basic game) and earn more victory points than opponents. To do so, he have to make a good recipe, an excellent bakery and avoid harm coming from Bears, Kittens and Best Friend'd Phone Call.
The final judge is grandma, so beware of what you cook!!

Around 90 full colour cards

Available as print & Play download through www.wargamedownloads.com
and www.arima.it

name: oh no
description: 1967 Twister variant with movable tiles instead of a static mat. Also a card deck. The game can be played in teams or as individuals.

name: Don't Bite the Pavement
description:
Don't Bite the Pavement is a game of quick-action reflexes and split second timing. The object of the game is to navigate one challenging obstacle after another until you reach the top of the obstacle course! See who can beat the course faster!

Two different rule variations.

name: Staxx
description:
Staxx is part of Ashburn Industries' "The Quickles" series of card games.

Staxx uses a modified standard deck of cards, with two letters on each card and 6 wilds (effectively the jokers and kings). Staxx combines a standard Rummy game with a word game; players score the most for runs and sets that form words, but can meld just words or sets/runs.

name: Ella Cinders
description: This roll-and-move dice game was based upon a United Feature Syndicate comic strip that ran between 1925 and 1961. (There was also a 1926 silent movie based on the story.) As the name implies, the comic strip was based upon the tale of Cinderella. The game is considered to be very difficult to find.

name: SToCKBRoKER
description: A game about playing the stock market involving cards, game spaces, stock purchases, and fluctuating stock valuations. Built on a highly detailed and involved board.

name: Lettra
description:
This is a promotional game not freely available. It was given to customers of UBS (Big Swiss Bank).
Players form words with as many letters possible from their hands. Afterwards they fill up their hands with cards from their Stock. The game itself is kind of similar to "Scrabble Cardgame" except in this game you are allowed to exchange letters in existing words. The game ends when a player has used up his stock of 30 cards.

name: Burger Wars
description:
From the Game Box:

"This is a unique and imaginative game. A battle of wits, strategy and nerves. The Burger Franchise Managers of Mr. Jones take one those of Mr. Megabux for World domination of the Burger business. This game is easy to learn yet there is an infinite variety of strategies and moves."

name: Lord of the Abyss
description:
"The players take the role of a Demon Lord, vying for control of the infernal realm of Hell. They marshal their forces and march forth to conquer and subjugate all opposition."

The object of the game is to eliminate all enemies or establish control over five levels of hell.

Components include a map depicting the nine layers of hell, a deck of Action Cards, and a set of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.

name: Doom Trooper Empires
description:
"Doom Trooper Theme. Various races fight for control of the planet Mars."

The players take control of one of seven Factions: Capitol, Imperial, Bauhaus, Mishima, Cybertronic, Brotherhood, and Dark Legion. Each faction has a unique set of units. The object of the game is to control all of the cities on Mars.

Components include an area movement map of Terraformed Mars, a deck of Action Cards tailored to the theme, and sets of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.

name: Federation
description:
A game of galactic conflict based on the Star Trek universe.

The players control one of six powers: United Federation of Planets, Klingon Empire, Romulan Star Empire, Ferengi Alliance, Cardassian Union, or Borg Collective. The object of the game is to control over 60% of the planetary systems on the map.

Components include an area-movement space map, a deck of Action Cards tailored to the theme, and sets of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Conquest of Demara
description:
A game of battles and conquest involving fantasy realms.

The object of the game is to control eight of the nineteen realms, or to destroy all opposing forces.

Components include a map of the continent of Demara and the surrounding seas, a deck of Action Cards tailored to the theme, and unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.

name: Middle Earth Empires
description:
A game of fantasy conflict and conquest between the forces of good and evil, based on the Lord of the Rings.

One player controls the Free Peoples and the other player controls the forces of Sauron. The winner is the player who controls more territories after twenty turns. Either side wins automatically if all opposing units are destroyed.

Components required to play include a map of Middle Earth, a deck of Action Cards tailored to the theme, and sets of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Empires of Mystara
description:
A game of fantasy conquest involving armies of conflicting alignments. Inspired by the Mystara campaign setting of Dungeons and Dragons.

Players must choose to play as Lawful, Neutral, or Chaotic empires. The winner is the side that destroys all opposing units.

Components required to play include a map divided into the individual territories of the fourteen nations of Mystara, a deck of Action Cards tailored to the theme, and unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.

name: Warp Hammer Empires
description:
A game of fantasy conflict and conquest involving Warhammer armies.

The players take control of one of eleven Armies: Dwarf, Ork, Empire, Skaven, Dark Elf, High Elf, Goblin, Chaos Dwarf, Wood Elf, Bretonnian, or Undead. Each army has a unique set of units. The object of the game is to eliminate all opposing units.

Components include an area movement map, a deck of Action Cards tailored to the theme, and sets of unit counters.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Doctor Who: Eye Spy
description:
"The Doctor and Sabbath are both looking for the scattered remnants of the Elementals, the Lords of Time who never existed. Chief among these artifacts is a black sun, the EYE."

"He who controls the EYE controls the new dynasty of Time Lords for the universe. But while the Eighth Doctor has looked without for the Eye, he has not tried to first look WITHIN."

"The TARDIS was once infinite, but now only a small part of its interior is accessible. And Fitz is hearing strange sounds behind the unusual walls that have partitioned the TARDIS' interior. And now a door to the mysterious cloister room has opened. Could the EYE have been in their all the while? But one challenge stands in the Doctor's way of
exploring the cloister room and unveiling its secrets: SABBATH!"

"One Player plays the Doctor. His goal is to move from the CONSOLE ROOM to the CLOISTER ROOM. The other plays Sabbath.
His goal is to prevent the Doctor from reaching the cloister room."
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Doctor Who: The Sabbath Days
description:
"The eighth doctor has lost his memory. He has a whole new band of enemies. One player plays Sabbath. The other is the good doctor."

"There are three decks: One for the doctor, one for Sabbath and an 'elemental' artifact deck."

The winner is the player who obtains the most elemental artifact cards.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Doctor Who: The Keys of Chronos
description:
"The old Time Lords are gone, and many races are competing to take their place as the Lords of Time. In order to forge a new Gallifrey and a new order of the Lords of Time, the Eighth Doctor must scour time and space to recover the six keys of Chronos. This will insure the new Gallifrey protection from its rivals, and bring order to all time and space."

At the start of the game, each player is dealt six Mission Cards. The six cards identify the six keys that the player is searching for. The first player to obtain all six keys named on his Mission Cards wins the game.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Doctor Who: The Lords of Time
description:
"Gallifrey has been removed from space and time, but nature abhors a vacuum. It is up to the inheritors of their legacy to forge a new Gallifrey and a new order of the Lords of Time."

"Up to four players may play this game. There are four sides: The Eighth Doctor from Earth, Sabbath from the Moon, and Empress Miranda from the Throne World of the Universal Empire, and the cyborg Silver who has escaped exile from the Planet A2756."

The first player to reach the New Gallifrey space in the center of the board by exact count wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Doctor Who: Remnant of the Daleks
description:
"The last of the Daleks have invaded the TARDIS Console Room. And it’s up to the Eighth Doctor, Romana and K9 to stop them from taking over the TARDIS. Whoever controls the TARDIS controls all of Causality."

Each player has three units. The Doctor player has the Eighth Doctor, Romana, and K9. The Dalek player has three Daleks.

The conflict takes place in four TARDIS areas: the Console Room, Library, Clock Garden, and Altar Room. Each player has a card deck which is used to randomly determine movement between the four areas. The cards are also used to resolve combat.

The object of the game is to defeat all opposing units.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: SMART Gaming
description:
SMART stands for Simple Miniatures Adventures Rules and Tactics.

"These miniature rules may be used for fantasy or medieval miniature war gaming, but can easily be adapted to any genre. These rules were inspired from Little Armies by H. G. Wells and Kreigspiel."

The rules are described as being suitable for any scale from 100:1 to 1:1.

name: Lensman
description:
A science fiction card game based on the Lensman stories. It is an expansion designed to be used with the Rebel Space rules.

The game pits the Galactic Patrol of the First Galaxy (Milky Way) against the Baskonian Pirates of the Second Galaxy (Andromeda). The Galactic Patrol player has a deck of 65 cards and the Baskonian player has a deck of 63 cards. The object of the game is to reduce the opponent's deck to zero cards.

Expands:

Rebel Space
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Rebel Space
description:
A science fiction card game of the Rebels versus the Imperials. Despite the generic card descriptions, it is clear that this game is inspired by the original Star Wars saga. Thus you have cards like the Smuggler, Converted Freighter, and Alien Companion, as well as the Young Protagonist, Wise Mentor, Princess, and Robot Sidekick.

Each side starts with a unique deck of 65 cards. The object of the game is to reduce the opponent's deck to zero cards.

Expanded by:

Lensman
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Meks & Mercs
description:
A game of battling giant robots (Meks) and the pilots who ride in them (Mercs).

The rules describe nine pre-designed Meks. Players can also design their own Meks using the chassis, weapon, and other Mek systems specifications given in the rules. Mek pilots are individually rated for experience and skills.

The game is played on a 3x3 grid. Each square is marked with a terrain type as specified by scenario. The game comes with six scenarios.

name: Warmeister 2: The Battle of Plentymore Field
description:
"This is an expansion for Warmeister, not a game in itself. You need Warmeister to use these rules."

This expansion adds approximately 180 cards to the Warmeister deck. There are new cards for Attacks, Castles, Armies, Holdings, and Events. The rules also define three new card traits.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Warmeister
description:
"A fantasy warfare card game for 2-6 players"

The object of the game is to capture the Territory Tokens of the other players, representing conquest of their lands.

The game uses a custom deck of 130 cards. Each player starts with five Territory Tokens. Tokens may be won and lost as a result of battles battles out through card play.

name: Get Castro!
description:
The players represent various elements of the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) seeking to assassinate Fidel Castro back in the fifties and sixties.

The game uses a custom deck of 57 cards. There are seven types of cards: Method, Conspiracy, Location, Save, Event, Propaganda, and Spy.

The players attempt to play melds of cards of the same type. Once you have three melds in play (one each for Method, Conspiracy, and Location), you may make an Assassination Attempt die roll to see if you kill Castro. If the roll is not successful, you lose some or all of your melds and the game continues.

Save and Event cards can be used to require an opponent to discard a meld. Propaganda cards allow a player to draw additional cards. Spy cards allow you to look at an opponent's cards and steal one.

"Winning: Be the first player to Assassinate Castro. If Castro is not killed after the players have gone through the deck twice then Castro survives and all the players lose."

name: Warcraft Empires
description:
Grand battles between fantasy forces based on the Warcraft game system. Control an army of Humans, Orcs, Night Elves, or the Undead. Enhance your army with Mercenaries and Magic Items. The object of the game is to establish control over half the territories on the continent or eliminate all of the other players.

This game is a module for the Warp Empires system, the core rules are required for play.

name: Real Time Carnage
description:
A simple game of individual combat with firearms, in the style of first-person shooter computer games.

"The objective of the game is to blow the bajesus out of your enemies. You take turns moving and shooting. Each turn, you get two actions. Actions are usually either moving, shooting, aiming or reloading. Each of these usually cost one action."

name: The Great Machine
description:
"The Evil Mad Scientist Doctor Herr Guffin has left his assistants (Igor, Igor, Igor and lest we forget, Igor) in charge of his experiments while he goes to a convention on 'Evil Inventions and the Applications in Modern Society'."

"The experiment in particular is a machine he designed to breed a better rat (because the kids these days had gone and invented a better mousetrap). It is a mixture of mechanical and electronic feeder/torturing device."

"The object of the player (called Igor) is to have his favourite rat the biggest by the time the master returns."

"This involves making sure that toggles tilt the pipes in the machine such that the food pellets go to the player's rat - and avoiding/rotating the shocking motor such that the other rats are shocked (which causes them to lose food pellets, probably through vomiting)."

"There are event cards as well (things like Cardiac Arrest - fattest rat gets a chronic heart attack and dies)."

name: Lighter Than Air Warfare
description: "Imagine if Orville and Wilbur Wright did not successfully fly their powered airplane in 1903, but instead ten years later. In such an alternate history there would be no effective combat airplanes. Commitments in military research and industrial production might have instead, focused on the Zeppelin as a weapon carrier. This game provides a tactical simulation of such Zeppelin warfare."
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I

name: Metamorph
description:
"Shapeshifting wizards duel to the death, fight over magical artifacts or seek certain objectives."

"Every player starts with one Wizard. Each wizard is a Human with a pool of 50 Mana. Mana is used to cast spells, change shape, and activate special abilities of the shape the wizard is currently using. Mana can only be recovered in Human form, once per turn."

The game includes three scenarios:

"Dueling Wizards - Two age old rivals meet for a final showdown. "

"Wizard War - Rival kingdoms at war send their court mages to take care of the competition before invasion."

"The Key of Soloman - An artifact of power has been unearthed, the magical emanations in the ether have attracted treasure seeking wizards."

name: Thief
description:
"Concept: A primarily two player game. One player is the owner of the mansion, the other is the thief. The owner spends resources to set up the mansion, and the thief tries to steal the treasured item. The behaviour of the guards in the mansion are mostly automated responses. If more than two players - then the additional players are additional thieves."

"Setting: The world of Thief is a steampunk setting. There are gas, coal, steam and some electrical powered machines. There is also some magic."

"Inspired by the various Thief games from Looking Glass Studios that have been part of my favourite computer games of all time."

name: Mayan Gold
description:
"Much like the Incan Gold game (Incan Gold), it's a game of pushing your luck and knowing when to betray the other players to get away with as much gold as possible. Every turn a player decides whether to play a card to continue journeying into the caves, or to retreat with their current gains. The chances of dying and not making any money increases as players move further into the caves."

"The difference between this game and the original is that it uses normal playing cards, and there are more choices for the players involved."

The rules are available on the author's website

name: Opus Magnum, The Philosopher's Stone
description:
"Card Game for 2 or more players. Players are 17th century alchemists, competing for the creation of the Philosophers Stone."

The game uses a custom deck containing three types of cards: Elements, Procedures, and Substances. Elements and Procedures must be combined to create Substances, which in turn can be combined with Elements, Procedures, or other Substances to create more complex Substances.

"The first player who creates the 'Resurrected Lapis Philosophorum' wins."

name: Warp Dungeons
description:
"This is a modifiable dungeon-crawling game for 2-4 players."

One player takes on the role of the Dungeon Master. The other players each control a Hero who is exploring the dungeon. The game uses three to five custom card decks: a DM Deck (60 cards), a Dungeon Deck (30 cards), and a Hero Deck for each Hero player (60 cards.)

The Dungeon Deck consists of cards specifying rooms and passages which are used to randomly create the dungeon. A Hero Deck consists of cards for various actions and treasures. The DM Deck consists primarily of cards representing monsters and traps.

The Hero players win if the Objective room card is located and resolved. The DM player wins if all of the Heroes are killed before they resolve the Objective room.

name: Temples & Swords
description:
"This game simulates the growth of ancient empires. Each player leads a young empire and controls its growth through its development. The units used to represent people are populations and monetary units are measured in gold points."

"Use a piece of hex paper and color equal numbers of squares green for grassland and yellow for desert. Each player chooses a starting grassland hex and puts a city and 3 population points on that hex. No two starting hexes may be closer than three hexes from each other."

The players build their empires by constructing cities, roads, temples, walls, marketplaces, and libraries. There are also three types of military forces available to attack opposing empires: Soldiers, Swordsmen, and Horsemen. The game also covers concepts such as disasters, technological advances, taxes, and population migration.

"Victory occurs when, at the end of his turn, a player has 20 victory points or has destroyed or captured all enemy cities, armies and populations." Victory Points are scored for cities, temples, and technological advances.

name: Solo Crusade
description:
"Solo Crusade is a simple set of rules to play a solo adventure with your favourite RPG. The underlying idea is very simple: one or more pools of 'tiles' are used to represent the map, the encounters, the events and in general every possible obstacle/help during your quest."

"Using a pool of tiles rather than simply roll some dices to create the adventure has a some major of advantages"

"• Visual representation of your travel: the tiles played on the table are much more " satisfactory" than a never-ending sequence of dice rolls."

"• Better control of the random factor: you can have tiles that can be drawn only once, tiles that are replaced when played."

This set of rules allows you to play out solo RPG adventures on the tabletop, similar to games such as DeathMaze: Heroic Adventure in the Corridors of Doom and the Metagaming MicroQuests series. The rules include tables and instructions for four sample adventures: The Wilderness, Hobgoblin Forest, Hunt for the Tribe, and the Black Pit.

name: Hurdle Race
description:
An antique spin-and-move board game themed around a hurdle race.

The components include a spinner, four different colored wooden pawns, and the box (which has the board mounted inside the bottom and the rules printed inside the lid.) In the race around the board, the players must clear three hurdles, two water jumps, and avoid a marauding bull.

Publication date is approximate.


Lid text includes "It Is Great Sport/Milton Bradley Co. Springfield, Mass."
Milton Bradley inhouse art depicting Buster and Tige, Foxy Grandpa, one of Katzenjammer Kids on lid.
Inside board has animals and humans w/recognizable characters of Buster, Katzenjammer, Foxy Grandpa, Happy Hooligan and Gloomy Gus, Black character likely representing Pore Lil' Mose and four human or animal characters inspired by Swinnerton.
Instructions on inside lid w/© 1905.
3.25 x 3.25" spinner

name: Ninja Clan Wars
description:
A card game of warring Ninja clans in Feudal Japan. The object of the game is to be the last surviving clan, or to have the highest ranking Ninja when there are no cards left in the deck.

The game uses a custom card deck which is composed of two types of cards - Ninja Cards and Event Cards. A player must recruit Ninjas and then send them on missions against opposing villages and Ninjas.

name: East Front Sniper
description:
"Each player takes the role of a Soviet Sniper during WWII."

"Each player has 3 stats: Shoot, Hunt, and Evade. Shoot is needed to kill Targets. Hunt is needed to find Targets. Evade is used to survive Danger. Players start with a score of 5 in each Stat."

"Players share a common deck. The Deck has 4 types of Cards: Targets, Danger, Aid, and Nothing cards."

"The Game ends when all but one player has been killed, or the Deck has been completely used up. The player with the most Kill Stars at the end of the game wins."
categories: Card Game, Fighting, World War II

name: New World Empires
description:
"Card & Record Keeping Game for 2-4+ players. Each player is a European Imperial Power circa 1500-1750."

The players seek to conquer 40 territories spread across five regions: the Caribbean, South America, Central America, North America, and Canada. Rather than relying on a map board, each territory is represented by a card in the Exploration Deck.

Players can gain control of territories through colonization or military conquest. The capability to do so depends on successful production and trade efforts, which provide the resources required to raise armies, build ships, and hire workers. The players must also be ready to cope with random events, such as piracy, storms, and revolutions.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Exploration, Fighting, Industry / Manufacturing, Renaissance

name: Occult WWII
description:
"Card Game for 2 players. WII with Wonder Weapons and the Occult as the main determinants of victory."

"One players is the Allies. The other is the Germans."

"Players have scores in 9 Stats. These stats are increased/decreased during play. Players begin with scores in each stat as listed on the Starting Stat Chart."

The nine Stats are: Intelligence, Attack, Occult, Research, Propaganda, Morale, Force, Economy, and Defense. The Allied Player and the German Player start the game with specified Stat scores.

"You win if you reduce your opponent to zero Morale or zero Force."
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Science Fiction, World War II

name: Zulu Blow Gun Game
description:
Description extrapolated from TheBigGameHunter.com:

ZULU BLOW GUN GAME (1925, Zulu Game Co., Battle Creek, Michigan) comes from a category of games no longer available: the "projectile" game. Safety requirements have virtually eliminated all sharp, pointed projectiles from games (other than DARTS), and although the packaging on the ZULU BLOW GUN GAME states "harmless," the game's bamboo dart, when made airborne from the blowgun, could pierce many things, including body parts. Object was to score points by hitting different valued targets using the blowgun and bamboo darts.

name: Animal Talk
description: Childs game which features animal sounds which must be matched to the animal pictures in order to score points.

name: Defenders of the Earth Giant Card Game
description: Children's card game featuring the actions of Superheroes as they try to defend Earth from invading aliens. The object of the game is to collect 10 or more Hero points before collecting 10 villian points. There are Power Of Evil cards that may be used to cancel out the point value of any one Hero Card diplayed by an opponent. If you accumulate 10 Villian Points you are immediately out of the game.

name: The Chisholm Trail from Texas to Dodge City
description: The object of the game is for each player to get his herd of 1,000 head of Texas Longhorn cattle up the "The Chisholm Trail" to Dodge City, Kansas. The game comes with a game board, a spinner, 4 metal longhorn tokens, 6 blue cards, 6 red cards, a pad of tally sheets, & a rule book

name: The Wide Track Game
description: You try to circle Wide Track Drive in Pontiac, Michigan in this game created to promote the host city of Superbowl XVI. The game was created by I&I Game Inventors of Pontiac, MI. and is copyrighted - 1981. The object of the game is to be the first player to circle Wide Track Drive, the main road in Pontiac, while being sidetracked along the journey by drawing instruction cards directing you to various venues of the city such as the mall, Church's lumber, Lupe's restaurant, Pontiac police station, Pontiac High school, the Silverdome etc.

name: Rules of the Road: Seamanship Cards
description: This card game was (from info on the box) put out by Noble and Noble and prepared by Lt. Comdr. W.D. Kipp. Object of the game is to navigate your ship by making use of correct whistle and fog cards and also by making correct use of International, Inland and Pilot Rules to safely complete your trip.

name: Pedro for President Game
description:
"Card game for 2-4+ players. Napoleon Dynamite School Election Theme. Each player has a 'Nerdy' candidate that is running for school president."

Each player tracks three statistics: Time, Money, and Votes. Card play can add to your stats and cause an opponent's stats to decrease. In addition, some cards require that the play incur a time or money loss in order to be played.

"The game ends at the end of the turn in which the last card has been drawn from the deck. The player with the most votes at the end of the game wins."
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Political

name: Alternardo
description:
Alternardo is a horse racing game that comes with a folding board and six horse cards. The players each choose a card and lay it on the right place on the board, then follow the instructions which move the horses around the track by differing amounts.

Re-implemented by:
Also Ran

name: Meltdown
description: Object of the game is to be the first to build a 1000 Megawatt Nuclear Reactor. Players move around a foldable, washable polyester "board" laid out in a Monopoly style format. Money and Generating Capacity are tracked by moving tokens on the side of the board. Game includes 25 Hazard and Scram cards. Players roll two dice (three for expert players) but move only the amount of one die at a time.

name: Big Kahuna
description: Messengers must reach the king's palace. There are Kahuna cards, Messengers, Tributes, Tiki cards, Aina cards. Board game shows the islands of Hawaii. Points accumulated determine the winner. Advanced variation of the game involves a battle in which chiefs gain land on the islands.

name: Po Stopach Izenyru Hanzelky a Zykmunda z Prahy do Kapskeho  mesta Osmickou Tatrou
description:
Name of the game is really that long, it means translated:
"Following the paths of the engineers Hanzelka and Zykmund from Prague to Capetown with the 8-cylinder Tatra".

The engineers were employees of the Tatra Motor Works in Czecho then, and in times when car driving was still an adventure, especially in Africa, they made this journey to demonstrate the durability of their famous streamline car, the Tatra 87.

The journey lasted from 1947 to 1949, and was full of incidents.

Even some books about it were published, and this game followed.

The game is extremely scarce, and what makes it special is that the wooden game pawns are shaped like the abovementioned streamline car.

The rest is pure nostalgia, roll-and-move and some card-drafting.

Box and gameboard are extremely large: Box measures 20 x 15 inches, the board is 4 times as large !!!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Arte of Siege
description:
This set of rules supports ancients, medievals and fantasy campaigns with 15mm and 25mm miniatures. The sections on Logistics and Disease make you think more like an actual field commander. Your troops cannot fight well if they don't have any food or get sick. Your lines of supply suddenly become more important, and you cannot cram your fortress with too many men.

Rules sections include: Introduction; Scales; Movement; Siege Engines; Other Weapons; Mining; Protective Devices; Engineering; Defenders - Attackers; Magic; Logistics; The Last Resort
categories: Ancient, Book, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Chipsmore Action Cards Game
description:
This is a very simple collectible card game that comes with Chipsmore cookies sold in Malaysia. A pack of Chipsmore cookies comes with 3 different random cards, which are in both English and Malay.

The objective of the game is to play all your cards. All players start with the same number of cards. There is no limit, except for the minimum of 6 cards. The core game is in the Action Cards, which you use to ask your opponents to do various physical actions, e.g. hopping on one foot. There are also Booster Cards, Mirror Cards, Counter Cards and Magical Cards, each with different powers.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Collectible Components

name: Heineken Spin-sation! Game
description:
The Heineken Spin-sation! Game was used as a premium gift in a marketing campaign by Heineken in Singapore during the Christmas season (17 Nov to 21 Dec) in 2007. People who bought Heineken beer gained points and these points could be exchanged for premiums like T-shirts, bags, sound speakers, calendars and this game.

The game itself is completely random. Players spin a cardboard wheel affixed to a board; the board also has spaces to place 4 stacks of cards. Depending on which segment on the wheel ends up next to where the picture of the beer bottle is pointing, the player who spun the wheel draws a chance card, which gives the player positive or negative points. The card may also have instructions or forfeits for the player to follow.

The four types of cards are:

1) Let's celebrate cards
These all give the player +40 points. There's also a date of some festival on the card with some advice for the player.

E.g. +40 points. February 5th (2008) Mardi Gras, New Orleans. Don't come back without some beach.

2) Oops! cards
These all give the player -10 points and have an action for the player to carry out.

E.g. -10 points. Collect an Oops! card from every girl.

3) Spin-sation! cards
These all give the player =10 points and have a forfeit for the player to perform.

E.g. -10 points. Tell a joke that no one in the room has heard before.

4) Heineken cards
These all give the player +20 points and have an action for the player to carry out (always a good thing).

E.g. +20 points. Take 3 Heineken cards from the player on your right.

The game ends whenever any stack of cards on the board is used up. Players then tally their nett scores and the player with the most points wins. The player with the least number of points has to perform the Ultimate Forfeit (sic), which the winner decides.

name: Blood
description:
A bloody game. Your goal is to be absolutely awesome. Jump through windows with a sword in one hand and a trash can in the other... Throw it at your enemy and watch one of his arms fall off, but wait pick that up to and beat your next opponent with! So long as blood is being spilled and baddies are dying it doesn't matter.

Blood is a stylized tongue and cheek cinematic action game.
categories: Dice, Humor, Mature / Adult, Print & Play

name: Rochambeau Twist
description:
From the publisher's website:

Rochambeau Twist is three games in one. Three sets of rules and one set of components to play three fiendish twists on your favorite childhood games: Chess, Checkers, and Tic-Tac-Toe; all with a Rock-Paper-Scissors theme. Each one is easy to play, but hard to master. Rochambeau Twist comes with 32 wooden discs, custom labels, a polypropylene board, and rules for 3 games all packaged in a plastic box.

name: Box of Rox
description: Box of Rox is a plastic boxed set containing over 100 acrylic gaming stones, half in blue and half in red. Also included are a polypropylene board and rules to let you play two abstract strategy games with the included pieces: Link Stones and Crosshairs.

name: Colossus: Great Sieges of History
description: Colossus will be a 2 player wargame simulation covering four historically important sieges in the Ancient Mediterranean world. Syracuse in 414 BC during the Peloponnesian War, Rhodes in 304 BC when it was besieged by Demetrius I of Macedon, Jerusalem in 70 BC as part of the First Jewish-Roman War and the siege of Antioch in 1097 during the First Crusades. The game will use a new unique system to deal with such important factors as morale, supply and disease for both sides.

name: It's Happy Bunny Checkers
description:
It's Happy Bunny Checkers is a "classic game with that sarcastic bunny twist!" and features big plastic checkers with snarky comments on the bottom.

Examples:

"Hi, loser."

"Remove one of your opponent's checkers."

Includes a colorful board (with snide comments printed along the edges) and 24 irreverent checkers.

ICUP, Inc. Item #00933

name: Flying Coffins
description: Another Helen of Toy game that consisted of plastic toys and a plastic mat. According to the ad, you also got exploding tanks.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I

name: Rollerbrawl
description:
From the back cover:
Rollerbrawl is a simple and easy combat game for role players and the psychopathic who love sports and man to man combat.

From the inside:
Rollerbrawl is a fast game of tactical sports mayhem in the near future. Players set up and play a team of variable abilities, and try to score points by putting an unbalanced, 8-inch ball of foam coated with hard rubber through one of two concentric hoops. If they're lucky most will survive the game...

"New and Improved" Second Edition was published in 1984
publishers: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

name: B辰ren-H旦r-Memo
description:
While there are probably thousands of variations of the standard "memory" game, this one distinguishes itself because the matches are made by sound rather than visually. The game includes 20 identical-looking bears, but there are 10 different sounds when shaking them based on the material inside the bear. The bears are placed on the board, and in turn players shake on bear and then must find its match. Like other memory games, if they get a match they keep going, otherwise the turn passes to the next player. The bears are nicely made and the some of the sound differences are subtle enough that it requires concentration as well as memory to get the pairings correct.

The title means simply "Bear Hearing Memory"

name: BIRDING! At Point Pelee National Park
description:
From the box cover:

"The Field Mark Identification Game

The most innovative bird watching aid since the invention of the pocket field guide--a simulation of a spring day at one of North America's best birding spots.

Designed by naturalists to teach you behavior and flight recognition, plumage and vocalization identification, use of field guides and checklists, and more, without using flash cards or trivia.

BIRDING!...will help you to improve all the skills used in the field."

Every player moves their pawn on the map of Point Pelee. Then the dealer reads the description of a bird species from the top card of the deck. Everyone occupying the habitat type given on the card is, in turn, eligible to guess the species. If you're right, tick its box on your checklist of 292 possible species. Per the rules, "The player (or team) with the most species identified on the Checklist at the at the end of the game wins."

name: UP2U
description:
UP2U is a strategy stacking game that pits players against each other in a tower-building contest. A roll of the dice determines how many pieces you must stack or whether you must take a penalty from another player. The closer you get to the goal the harder it gets.

Home Page: http://www.up2ugames.com.

name: Pontiac Safety Drive Game
description:
1938 Pontiac "Premium" promotional board game entitled "The Pontiac Safety Drive Game".

"This game reproduces all of the problems encountered in driving an automobile through the congested streets of a typical city. The board portrays a street map, with traffic signals, sixteen objective points (golf course, fair grounds, etc.) and obstacles (Jail, Hospital, etc.) Rules and penalties are based on actual traffic regulations. [The] OBJECT OF THE GAME is to acquire the most money by being [the] first player to reach the various objectives with least loss though fines or damages." This is a truly entertaining and well thought-out game, which manages to combine education, advertising, and fun.

The game was printed in the USA.

name: Party Quiz
description: Noma's new and entertaining party pep'er-upper! Loads of educational quiz-fun for young and old alike. Anybody can play this fascinating new game. Questions on every subject under the Sun ... Sports, Geography, Movies, History, Literature, etc. (from box cover)

name: Hot Dog Hooligans
description:
This game comes from that lovable crew that brought you Pirates Versus Ninjas. This game however, has neither Pirates nor Ninjas. It involves a hot dog eating contest where the contestants are the players.

Rounds begin with the first player flipping over a hot dog to attempt to eat. The hot dog has stats that match the five tastes (sweet, sour, spicy, salty, bitter). Play proceeds to the left with the next player playing a topping card on the hot dog to attempt to make the first player lose their lunch. Toppings include everything from lemons to fish heads. Play proceeds until all of the opponents have had a chance to play a topping or pass. Then the initial player has a chance to play negative toppings such as pepto or antacid to make the hot dog edible. If they can't (the hot dog has a higher level than the character in at least one state), they lose their lunch. Play proceeds to the next player who then flips over a hot dog to eat.

Play continues until a player has earned the specified number of points to win. Each hot dog eaten also offers a bonus to stamina and points toward victory.

By the way, did I forget to mention it has BARF cards? When played as a topping, the player automatically loses their lunch!!!

Hot Dog Hooligans is now available at www.gurkengames.com.

name: The Anger Control Game
description:
Game as psychological therapy tool for "teaching cognitive skills necessary for effective anger control". Participants roll-and-move around the board, occasionally stopping to respond to hypothetical situations in six categories of "cognitive-behavioral deficits". Chips are awarded for giving a good response to the card. Winner of the game is the player with the most chips at game end.

The game must be guided by a counselor or therapist. This authority-as-game-master not only chooses from which card category players must respond to, but also acts as sole judge in determining whether a participant's answer is good enough to warrant an award of victory chips.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Couple Links
description:
In the game of Couple Links what you don’t know about your partner could land you in the doghouse. Compete with coupled friends on a fun-filled, often comical, journey through the Honeymoon, Reality and Golden stages of your relationships. Use your knowledge for to answer real-life questions about your partner. Get it right and you advance a step. Get it wrong and you might advance to the doghouse.

You’ve got 2 minutes to get out of the doghouse! What can you do in 2 minutes to please your partner?? Find out as you and your friends race through pitfalls and peaks to be the first couple to reach the end of the “Golden Stage” and live “Happily Ever After”.

Honeymoon Stage: When you are crazy about each other
Reality Stage: When you drive each other crazy
Golden Stage: When you love stays strong in spite of the insanity

name: Bawanki
description: Bawanki is a simply game for 2 to 4 players. In game players are trying to make the biggest snowman.

name: Die Kleinen Leckerm辰ulchen
description:
Die Kleinen Leckermäulchen (the small, sweeth-toothed critters) uses a three-dimensional board that shows a flowery garden. The board can be constructed for each game and collapsed easily for storage. The standing part of the board has 18 holes, and at the beginning of the game eight different wooden fruits, each on a string, are each placed into one of the holes. The strings lay on the flat part of the board.

The game includes a set of animal tiles, and each animal has a favorite food. On a turn, players pick a card and then must pull up the fruit that the animal likes to eat. Of course, all they can see are the strings that all look the same, or remember where they last saw the fruit. If they pull up the right fruit, they keep the tile. Otherwise, they must return the tile. The player who collects the most tiles wins.

name: Snap It Up! Money
description: The object of Snap It Up! Money is to add or subtract the coins using the 3 coin cards and match the amount shown on the value card. A correctly completed match is a set - collect 3 sets to win. It helps kids understand the value of money. It is in a family of educational games with a similar mechanic.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Economic, Educational, Math

name: Global Player
description:
Global Player is a promotional family game developed by Spieltrieb for the Schott Glas company. According to the company's motto "around the world - around the clock", players simulate the company's worldwide activities in researching, developing, producing, and shipping various goods as fast and efficiently as possible.

There was a limited run of 400 produced games, which were given out by Schott to valued customers (most of them in Asia and in the US).

Note that the game is 100% bilingual (German/English).

name: Fitzelfood
description:
Fitzelfood is game that teaches children to match good foods with good exercise, and at the same time teaches about common foods from Germany, Sweden, France, and Italy.

The goal of the game is to be the first to collect the nine peices of the puzzle for the country you represent (one of the four above). In order to get the pieces, you must be able to react quickly to find matches of good foods with good exercises. There are two decks of cards, and during the "Squeaker Round" one card from each is placed face up. If the two cards are a match, meaning both good for their respective decks, the first player to hit the Squeaker gets to see if they guessed correctly. The cards are placed next to each other, and depending on how the gray bands on the cards match, the cards are either both good, one is good and one is bad, or both are bad. If both are good, the player gets to draw two puzzle pieces from a bag. Other actions let players exchange pieces, and the first to collect all none of their pieces wins. Through the game, children learn about which foods are healthy and which are not, and which activities lead to a healthy lifestyle versus those that don't.

name: Wer zieht was?
description: A matching game for children Ages 2.5 to 5, each picture is divided into a left and right half. Each picture is cut slightly differently so only the correct halves will line up correctly.

name: Eigil310
description:
Eigil310 is a game of strategy that combines shapes, colors and numbers to allow you to lay cards on the board and pick up your opponent's cards (made of plastic not cardboard). The object of the game is to line up 3 shapes, 3 colors or a count of 10, if you do this you may pick up the cards and it is your opponent's turn. Sounds easy but is hard to master.

From the back of the box:

"In Eigil310 the objective is to run your opponent out of cards. To win the game you must line up the cards to match, (in a straight line, horizontally, or diagonally) any 3 of the same card colours, or any 3 of the same card symbols or any combination of cards with the numbers adding up to a total count of exactly 10. When any of these parameters are met, that player removes the card combination, and the cards become theirs to use."
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Educational, Math, Number

name: Stalin's Stash
description:
Stalin is dying in the hospital. Quickly! Steal his money!

Designed around the concept of shadenfreude (enjoyment in the misfortune of others) and Sociopolitical Economics, Stalin's Stash pits up to 4 players against each other in a vie for Stalin's secret treasure. Players build tunnels under Moscow while stealing each other's money, collapsing the tunnels with Molotov Cocktails to earn bonuses and stall other players, all while paying union dues and managing equal worker's salaries.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Justice
description: The object of the game is to match your wits with the authors (Charles Boswell and Lewis Thompson, winners of the Mystery Writers of America Edgar Allen Poe award for excellence in fact-crime writing) of six case histories based on actual crimes. Based on an early TV show, as the game says, "Direct from television to you". An early example of marketing a TV show to a home audience using a game. Uses an actual METAL "scales of justice" to evaluate and track a case's progress.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: Blood & Chivalry
description:
Blood & Chivalry is a set of miniatures rules designed especially for the Western European medieval period, approximately from the Dark Ages through the end of the Wars of the Roses.

The author notes that 1000 point armies (approximately 100-120 figures) per side are manageable for a single player. Figures can be based individually (a la Warhammer) or based on stands (a la DBx).

Movement is done using command points: each commander throws a four-sided dice for command points, which can be used to change orders of units within the leader's command radius. Combat is conducted by throwing a ten-sided dice per figure with a "10" causing a casualty.

The following scenarios are included: "Supply Convoy Ambush" (Hundred Years War French attacking an English baggage train), "Relief of the Castle" (Hundred Years War French attacking an English force besieging a castle), "Breaking the Shieldwall, the Battle of Brunanburh" (English vs. Scotts and Welsh), and "Grandson" (Burgundians vs. Swiss).

name: The Great Toy Race
description:
The Great Toy Race Game

Designed for Ages 4 - 11.

(c)1992

Model No. 744

Excitement galore as the players race through the toy store. The goodies are on the shelf and the kids must grab the most toys to win.

Includes a colorful board, "teddy bear" dice tower assembly, plastic toy tokens, boy and girl player tokens, dice, illustrated storage insert, dice, and shelf displays.

name: Zit-Zingo
description:
"Zit-Zingo: The Travel Game

Directions: Game is played like Bingo. Players watch for objects along the road and cross them off on cards. First player to mark five objects in a row is winner.

When younger children play, change rules so that first object seen by all players goes to first player; second object to second; etc.

Players may try for Double-Zingo (two lines of five in a row, Triple-Zingo, or even Grand-Zingo - entire card filled

A variation of the game for two players is for each player to be assigned one side of the road - players place a check mark on their card as objects are seen. Time or mileage limit is set and player having most check marks on his card is the winner."

name: Love Game
description:
Taken from the game box:

A passionate game for two players.

The love journey you have long been wishing for. A very humorous and educational game that everyone will enjoy completely!

A great game for two people who are newly in love:
If you still have butterflies in your bellies this is a real love exploration where you get to know everything about each other. You will enter a surprising and wonderful spiral of love.
Play the game and enjoy each other!

A surprising game for experienced couples:
Even though you already have long history of love behind you this game is still a true love discovery.
Enjoy it because no matter if you have known each other for 2, 10 or maybe 40 years you must not miss this creative impulse of love.

The funniest love game for singles:
Don't forget the singles among you, for you too this is a fantastic start on a new romance. Many new relationships start with fun and testing of each other. This game will make sure you will get rid of all the expensive trips to the city to eat and go to the disco, hour long conversations on the phone etc.
Play this game and your wildest dreams will be fulfilled in just one night.

name: The "Roll" of the Missionary
description:
The "Roll" of the Missionary is a short Roll and Move game designed to help the player prepare for an LDS Mission. The players first get baptized as a member of the LDS Church through a series of die rolls. Once that is achieved, the players become missionaries and race to convert as many other people as possible along the track. The game ends with a shake-off to roll each unique symbol at the chapel.

The six dice sides are:
Seek for Truth
Pray
Study the Scriptures
Repent
Warn Your Neighbor
Being Baptized
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hyborian Gates Empires
description:
"Board Game of Dimensional Conquest for 2-6 players. Based on the card game Hyborian Gates."

"There are 6 Dimensions: Atlantis, Hyboria, Asgard, Chaos, Gaea, Osiris. The Dimensions are not directly connected. The only way to get from one dimension to another is by the use of Gates."

"Each dimension is represented by a separate 7 x 7 Grid Board. In the center square of each dimension is a Pyramid."

The first player to control three Pyramids wins the game (except in a two player game, in which four Pyramids must be controlled to win the game.)

name: Hellboy Hands
description:
"Card game for 2+ players. Theme: Hellboy. Each player is trying to help Hellboy complete Quests on their own turn and preventing their opponents from completing quests on their turns."

The object of the game is to acquire Quest Tokens. A player is awarded a Quest Token each time the player completes a meld. The first player to acquire six Quest Tokens wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Duck Fever
description:
• Roll the dice to determine where you will start your hunt.
• After reaching your hunting destination, begin your hunt by drawing a card.
• Each card will tell you what you have to roll to hit your duck.
• Ducks move around the board as "shots" are made, so hunt where the ducks are!
• Win the game by reaching the limit of 10 ducks!

2-6 players, Ages 8 and up! Hunting for the Entire Family!


http://www.huntingfevergames.com/listcategories.php?cid=243
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Environmental, Sports
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Super Marchew
description:
Super Marchew is a simple game for children. Game can be played by 2-4 players. The goal is to catch the carrot, which is inside the board.
All materials (rules, board, and tokens) are on this website:
http://adam.wcsw.net/folko/index.php?option=com_content&;view=article&id=55:supermarchew&catid=35:grygotowe&Itemid=63

name: Silver Surfer
description: A card game based on the comic book character Silver Surfer. The players must play melds of cards describing an encounter with a foe or villain. Each meld scores Plot Points equal to the point total of the cards played in the meld. The player with the most Plot Points when the deck runs out wins the game.

name: Sherwood
description:
"One player is Robin Hood, stealing from the rich to give to the poor. The other player is the most evil Sheriff of Nottingham."

The game uses three custom decks: the Robin Hood Deck, the Sherwood Sheriff Deck, and the Prize Deck. "Object: Accumulate the most victory points by acquiring cards from the Prize Deck."

name: See the World
description: This is essentially a memory game and has three different variations. Mystery hand, a variation for two players, and Regular Memory. It varies from memory because the draw card will be the one being matched and players describe what is in their hand at the beginning.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Lucky Ladybug
description:
Each player moves their playing piece around the board and the first player to move their playing piece completely around the path of ladybugs and return to the house of their color on the game sheet wins.

After an initial spin on the spinner players move according to the number of spots on the ladybug they are on. If they land on a flower the spinner is used again.

name: Samurai Quest
description:
"Board game for 2+ players. Each player controls a Samurai adventuring in the countryside." Set in a fantasy version of old Japan.

"The Board is a circular track divided into 36 spaces. Every sixth space is a Fortress." The game also uses two decks of cards, an Encounter Deck and a Spell Deck.

The players travel around the board, locating companions and items, and encountering foes. Defeating a foe results in an award of Honor Points. The first player to accumulate twenty Honor Points wins.

name: Hogwarts
description:
A card game based on characters and events from the Harry Potter tales.

The game uses two custom decks, the Common Deck and the Challenge Deck. Each player also receives three character cards representing Harry, Hermione, and Ron.

The players use the characters to attempt to overcome challenges from the Harry Potter stories through card play, thus winning Challenge Cards. The winner is the player whose Challenge Cards have the highest total point value.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: Slimed
description:
A Backgammon style game of Ghostbusters versus Ghosts.

The Ghostbuster player only has five pieces representing the team of Ghostbusters. The Ghost player has twenty pieces representing ghosts. The game board is the same as a standard Backgammon board. However, pieces never exit the end of the board, they just keep going around.

The Ghost player wins by capturing (landing and remaining on) all five Ghostbusters, rendering them "slimed." The Ghostbuster player wins by capturing all the Ghosts and placing them in a Containment Field (by landing on them and sending them to the bar.)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Speed Racer
description:
“Go Speed Racer! Go! Pick your Driver, Car, Modifications, and go!”

The game is played with five custom decks: Driver, Car, Equipment, Action, and Episode. Each player begins with one driver and car and three pieces of equipment. The players try to acquire Speed Points as quickly as possible by overcoming Villain, Foe, and Obstacle Cards.

“Victory: It takes 50 Speed Points to cross the Finish line. Determine 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place.”


Microbadges:
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: The Last Starfighter Skirmish
description:
"Board & card game for 2 players. Battle between ships of the Star League & the Kodan Armada takes place in the Last Starfighter Universe. Each figure represents a single Station, Gunship or Squad of Fighters."

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Miniatures or counters are used to represent the ships. The Star League player has eight ships and the Kodan Armada player has fourteen ships. Card play determines when units may move, attack, and defend.

The object of the game is to destroy all enemy ships.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Magus
description:
A game of conflict between fantasy armies.

The game is played on a 13x13 grid. The square at each corner of the board holds a tower. To win the game you must have an army on all four tower spaces.

The players travel around the board recruiting fighting units. Units are recruited by landing on an empty space and drawing a card from the colored card deck (of the five) which correlates to the color of the space. Each card describes a unit by name, Force value, and number of spells. Separate card decks describe for magic spells and artifacts.

name: Magic Encounters
description:
"Fantasy Strategy Wargame for 2 or more players. Lead your
race and their allies to ultimate victory."

The game is played on a 5x5 grid. Each space is marked with one of five territory types: Plains, Mountains, Swamps, Water, or Forest.

Each player has an army of 40 tokens in a unique color. The players start with one stack of 10 tokens, placed in opposite corners.

"Victory: Eliminate all enemy Tokens from Play."

name: Japanese Swords
description:
A board game of warfare in Feudal Japan. The components include a map, a set of counters for each player, and a card deck of approximately 100 cards.

The game is played on a 10x10 grid marked with seven terrain types (Clear, Fortress, Keep, Difficult, Covered, Treacherous, and Impassable). Each set of counters includes four different types: Armies, Gold, Honor, and Control Markers. Each player starts with one Fortress and two Armies.

The object of the game is to capture the fortresses of your opponents.

name: Mass Warfare
description:
"WWII Technology. Generic countries. Production and strategic combat."

"Each player should begin by controlling a corner of the map that contains several cities (Population of around 15) and enough agricultural land to feed them. They should also have access to nearby mines & oil fields. Each player starts with reserves of 30 oil and 30 metal. Each side starts with 1 Factory and 5 Infantry units positioned adjacent to the city hexes."

The object of the game is to control all of the cities on the map.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Jugger
description:
"Fantasy tactical rule system. Juggers or Jugs are giant war machines constructed with medieval technology." Juggers are not only used in warfare, but also for a sport called Juggerball which is played with a very large ball.

Jugger is played on a hex map. That map can represent playing fields, racing traps, mazes, or battlefields depending on the scenario." Statistics are given for over thirty Juggers used by various armies.

Each Jugger is rated for four traits: Size class, acceleration rate, deceleration rate, and turn rate.

name: Supercritter Slugfest
description:
"Combat rules for cute animae mini monsters." An expansion for Superhero Slugfest, the quick and dirty tactical rules for superhero combat.

The game is played on a hex map with spaces large enough to accommodate miniature figures.

Supercritters are rated for Attack, Damage, Defend, Hits, Speed, and Range (hand to hand). Each Supercritter also has ten super powers. Stats are included for three Supercritter teams. Evolution rules provide for Supercritter experience and advancement.

"Basic scenario objectives: Each side picks or creates a team. Combat may be one on one or a free for all. Match Locations: Critter Combat Arena, The Mall, School yard, etc."
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Mutog
description:
"Wargame for 2+ players. Players control bands of warriors in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Eclectic unit types with a wide range of technologies."

"Victory: Wipe your enemies off the face of whats left of the earth. Or capture all the Towns or kill all enemy Heroes."

name: Sea Battles
description:
"Abstract WWII Naval Strategy Game."

The pieces represent seven types of ships: PT Boat, Submarine, Destroyer, Frigate, Cruiser, Battleship, and Carrier. Each unit is individually rated for hits, movement, range, damage, and number of attacks.

"Use an 8 x 8 or larger square or hex map. All ships can move and shoot vertical and horizontal but not diagonal. Each side starts with 1 of each ship and 2 destroyers for a total of 8 ships."

"On the Sea map mark several spaces as land obstacles. Ships cannot move over land but they can shoot over it. Torpedo attacks cannot be made over land."

"Objective: Completely destroy all enemy ships."

name: Troy
description:
"Card game for 2 players. One player is the Achaeans (Greeks). The other player is the Trojans."

Each player uses a unique deck of cards. There are ten types of cards: Hero, Companion, God, Warrior, Strategy, Arms, Event, Trait, Honor and Defenses. Each card is marked with a Force value from 1 to 15. The cards represent specific elements of the Trojan War.

The players attempt to play the highest ranking card combination each hand. The first player to win seven hands wins the game.

name: The Mystic Warriors of the Plains
description:
"Each player takes the role of an (American) Indian Brave (Young Warrior). Players compete to accumulate prestige by their deeds."

The game uses a custom deck of cards. There are nine types of cards in the deck: Tribe, Weapon, Dress, Approach, Coup, Hunt/Trade, Luck, Spirit, and Trade. The cards are used to engage in various activities.

Players collect Eagle Feathers by participating in raids, which come in four different types: Horse Raids, War Parties, Revenge Raids, and Pipeholder Raids. Players may also hunt, hold tribal gatherings, and trade.

"Victory: The first player to accumulate 28 Eagle Feathers has enough to make his Warbonnet and wins the game."
categories: American Indian Wars, Card Game, Fighting

name: Kingdoms and Crowns
description: Kingdoms and Crowns is a board game in the tradition of games such as Talisman. The game is set in a fantasy world of elves and dragons. The premise of the game is that the rule of the realm has died and many parties are now maneuvering their candidates to take the throne. However, absolute power will be difficult to achieve. To become rule of the realm you must have the backing of the most influential powers in the land, but you should also have support form the Otherworld. There is one way to become the undisputed ruler of the realm, and that is to recover a legendary crown that once belonged to the most powerful rule to have ever ruled the land. Legend has it that the crown was stolen and is now somewhere on the Planes of Damnation. Only a hero of great power and skill could ever hope to enter those lands and return. Alternatively it be just simpler to remove the competition.

name: Viborg Spillet
description:
The game of buying and selling industries in the danish town Viborg. Each player controls a car, and opts to buy the best businesses in Viborg to charge fees from the other players. The last player with all the money is the winner.

The game plays very similar to Monopoly.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Bees!
description: Bees! is a two-player game played on a hexagonal board. The objective of the game is to capture your opponent's queen, using warriors, drones, and your own queen.

name: Time Twist The Board Game
description:
Time Twist is a print and play game of plotting, stealing and time travel, for 2 to 4 players.

Sunday, November 5th 1899

“When their father, an eccentric scientist, passed away, the four brothers were eager to find out which of them would inherit the family heirloom; a rare collection of antique coins. They were disappointed to discover that their father, knowing how much they all enjoyed games, planned to have his servants hide the coins around the house for a bizarre family treasure hunt.
On Saturday morning the servants hid the antique coins in various locations around the mansion and then the four sons spent the day searching every nook and cranny, desperate to be the one to find the most coins.
By Saturday night one of the sons, much to the annoyance his brothers, had won the game and, having found the most coins, gained a considerable inheritance.

Desperate to get their hands on the inheritance, each of the brothers had the same idea; use their time machines to change the outcome of the game. Based on their father’s prototype, their small time travel devices could enable them to travel back no further than a couple of days. Even the winner of the contest, suspicious of his scheming brothers, realised that he should also travel back to make sure that he was still victorious.

The plan was to ask the servants where the coins had been hidden, as it was now Sunday they would be happy to divulge that information. Armed with this knowledge the brothers would then travel back to Saturday morning and claim a coin from its hiding place.”

Taking on the role of one of the brothers, you will gain a clue card and then travel back to Saturday to claim a coin. You will have to then return to Sunday to acquire another clue card.
Other players can use game cards to steal coins from you. Stealing can be blocked by using a trap (a Time Twist) which you set up on Friday – you must of course remember to travel back to Friday to set that trap up or it will never happen!
Avoid being lost in space and time as you manipulate time and use every low down trick you can think of to claim your rightful inheritance.

The necessary game files can be purchased from http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=739&;pics=
Players will need to provide a 6 sided die, 14 plastic stands (these are optional).
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Rhyme Dominoes
description: This is a domino game where words are used instead of pips. Each domino is divided into two colors: white and purple. Each side has a word on the top part of the domino and a shape on the bottom. Dominoes are played from a players hand against other dominoes that rhyme. The shapes on the bottom are used to determine whether the words rhyme and the object of the game is to exhaust your hand of dominoes. The dominoes in the box are larger than ordinary dominoes and are made from very thick card stock.

name: Trivia New Mexico
description: Trivia New Mexico is a trivia game based on New Mexico facts, history, entertainment and current events. Players move around a board representative of businesses and companies in New Mexico as of 1994 (some of these companies do not exist anymore). Different areas have special effects on players (ala Monopoly) and will require participants to answer questions to from a total of five categories. These answers are used to complete a score card and the first person or team to cross the finish line with a complete score card wins.

name: Mythos Miniatures
description:
Mythos Miniatures is a self-published skirmish game set in Lovecraft's Cthulhu Mythos universe. The mechanics are based on Graeme Dawson's DWMG engine. It is a character driven system more akin to RPGs like Trail of Cthulhu and Call of Cthulhu than wargames.

Miniatures must be bought separately from other companies, such as eM-4 Miniatures, RAFM, Hasslefree and Shadowforge (or any of the licenced Call of Cthulhu Miniatures ranges).
