"A Game of submarine combat"

From the box: Exciting WWII submarine wolfpack versus convoy action. Can the wolfpack sink or turn back the convoy? Can the convoy's escort ships thwart the attacking submarines and get the convoy to safety with needed supplies? Seawolf features a tactical playing board, with full sized hex pattern, cut counters, rules booklet and printed score sheets.

name: Succe$$ Quest
description:
(From the box cover)

Game Concept:

A game designed to allow Players to learn or teach business concepts and strategies in an enjoyable, competitive environment.

Players match wits with the business logic of the game's creators. While discussions of questions and disagreements can ensue, the creators provide the logic behind their answers.

Players may have to "agree to disagree" to win - but no one "loses" if they enjoy learning the realities of the business world that have worked for the game's creators.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Manifesto Destiny
description:
A historically refined revision of the game Manifesto.

The game is played on a map of the world divided into twenty regions. The components also include a custom deck of cards, consisting of Conflict Cards and Influence Cards.

If there are four or fewer players, the players choose to play one of the four standard ideologies: Communism, Fascism, Socialism, and Revolutionary Capitalism. If there are more than four players, three additional ideologies are available: Fundamentalism, Anarcho-Syndicalism, and Nipponism.

The players represent ideologies in conflict in the 20th century. The game begins in 1925 and ends in 2025. Twenty rounds are played, each representing five years. The winner is the player who controls the most countries at the end of the game.

name: Battle Dice: Quests & Artifacts
description:
An expansion for the game Battle Dice.

Each turn a players has the option of sending their Infantry, Archer, and Mage dice on a quest. If the questing forces survive by destroying or routing the units they encounter, the questing player receives a random artifact.

There are twenty types of artifacts, ranging from simple caches of gold (used for hiring units) to magic wands, orbs, scrolls, and weapons.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Long Hop
description:
Long Hop is a betting/dog racing game.
It consists of a large, colourful canvas playing mat, an ordinary deck of 52 cards and 4 cardboard greyhound dogs wearing the card colours heart, spade, diamond and club.

The dogs are moved via a clever card drafting/setting system which is also enhanced by special orders depicted on the race track. These are triggered when the dog(s) pass the spaces.

Game ends after 6 races, richest player wins.

name: Holiday
description:
Object of this game is to accumulate sightseeing points.
1st player to earn 2500 is the winner, each world tour is valued a certain number of points.
Players gain or lose points on tours, enjoy opportunities or encounter adventures.
The action is transfered from the globe right to 8 different tour tracks.
Other game components are:
-4 Passports
-5 different kinds of Money in different denominations
-30 Adventure Cards
-4 Landmark tokens
-1 Currency converter
-1 High-Quality dial Spinner
-1 Distance and Travel Cost Computer

Although Replogle's Holiday is in fact a simple Roll-and-Move-Game it's still fun for the family, as you have to funnel out your routes with the "Travel Computer" and to wheel and deal with your different currencies.

The colourful 1950ies artwork of the components add to the atmosphere of gameplay.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Sense-Ation
description:
From the box:
Can you correctly identify a candy by taste? An onion by smell? An egg by feel? Too easy? Try identifying the sound of a person walking without shoes by hearing? Estimate within one inch the height of someone by sight? Or guess the content of a picture by ESP? Wait until you try the Wild Cards, which give you a chance to invent your own challenge to stump your opponent.

The object is to collect points to advance to the 'Finish' block on the game board. Points are collected by correctly identifying objects using the senses if sight, hearing, touch, taste, smell and the 'sixth' sense, ESP.
publishers: Ajjava L.L.C., McJay Game Company, Inc.

name: Port 'N Starboard
description:
From online description:

Simple, yet realistic, fun board game that employs the principles of sailing and sailboat racing. Visualize sailing into the windward mark on a starboard tack, calling for right-a-way at the mark, or getting a big puff downwind to slip past several boats. Play by yourself or with up to eight players. Play your own boat by starting behind an imaginary line sailing to windward, tacking to avoid the head wind, rounding the mark, reaching to the second mark and on to the downwind leg of the course. The basic strategy involves port and starboard tacking and staying clear of the competition. Fun and instructive for the new sailor and a challenge for the experienced skipper. The whole family will love to play as there are no complicated wind changes and the game moves along at a pace that will keep everyone interested. Game is boxed and includes a playing board, eight pewter boats, chance cards and dice.

name: Padok
description:
objective: To gain points by placing the pieces on certain formations.

Players throw the dice and can place a piece on the sector of the same color. Points are granted if certain figures are formed. The Padok name refers to the central square.
publishers: Padok Games Ltd, Skirrid Company of Great Britain, Ltd.

name: Cloudburst
description:
From the Game Box:

"An exciting and unusual colour-matching game which encourages sharing and co-operation."

This jigsaw/game includes two sets of rules, one for a cooperative game and one for competitive play.

Players take turns rolling a die which either adds pieces to their house (player mat) or to a central 'cloudburst' mat.

The object of the game is to complete your house before the cloud bursts!

name: Grace A Dice Play 21
description:
Grace A Dice Play 21

From the rulebook:

This is an enjoyable, easy to play game for children and adults at home, school, churches, parks, casinos and sports fields.

Even teams of up to 6 people are formed. Plus a 'director' manages one or two teams. A die is rolled to indicate the movement of the player. The player is moved on a board AND around the seating of the table.

Play alternates until one team returns the the original seating.

name: Office Space: The Party Game
description:
The Office Space Party Game allows four teams to compete at a variety of activities in an attempt to rule the "cube farm" at Initech. Throughout the game, each team earns Office Cards for completing party activities (Drawing, Charades, Word Hint, and Fill-in-the-Blank). If at least one team has 10 or more Office Cards at the end of any round, the team with the most Office Cards wins!

From the back of the box:

"Unable to endure another mind-numbing day at the office? Office Space, the party game based on the cult film, is a sure cure for a case of the Mondays. 2 - 4 teams compete at a variety of fun activities in an attempt to rule the 'cube farm' at Initech. Teams frequently change their position in the office hierarchy, taking turns abusing their authority."
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Don't Call us...We'll Call You
description:
"Don't Call Us..." is an exciting peek into the complexities of the world of entertainment. You compete with one or more players to be the first to win the five "points" of the Game Star, OR to earn $1,000,000 as an actor. You prepare for jobs in the industry by taking lessons, getting 8x10 glossy pictures, joining the Screen Actors Guild, finding an Agent, and so forth.

Box measures about 6 1/4" x 4 3/4" x 2 1/2"
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Tanegashima Sandman
description:
"Samurai Combat Rules. The excitement and action of 16th Century Japan. You are a daimyo leading your personal army against your rivals. Armed with spearmen, ninja, gunners and your elite Samurai warriors, your forces bring the battle to the enemy!"

"These simple rules make for a fast, fun game with plenty of action. Play on the beach, in the backyard or living room. Adaptable to almost any scale, from HO to 12" action figures."

Figures are divided into four classes: Light Spearmen, Medium Armored Troops, Samurai, and Ninja. Weapons are divided into seven classes: pole-arms, small arms, samurai swords, thrown weapons, archery, muskets, and lances. The game includes rules for hand to hand combat, missile combat, terrain effects, armor effects, sieges, and campaigns.

One of the Jersey Shore Battle Games, available for free online

name: Treasure of Sandheap
description:
"Pirate Adventure Game. These is a very simple game for play on beach or in backyard, with plastic toy soldiers. The focus is on a fast-action game, easy to learn and easy to play. Our game is for small battles, only - with forces of 100 men or less on each side."

There are fourteen types of characters specified in the rules. These include pirates ("the heroes of our game"), tow militia, the Navy, Marines, Moors, Conquistadors, Privateers, Indians, South Pacific Natives, and Samurai.

There are seven types of ranged weapons specified in the rules: Long Rifle, Pistol, Musket, Bow, Cannon, Light Cannon, and thrown weapons (spear, hatchet, tomahawk, marlinspike, etc.) Each weapon is rated for range, damage, and rate of fire.

Concepts covered in the rules include boarding, prisoners, ports, treasure, and the effect of tides and wind on boats. Campaign suggestions are also included.

One of the Jersey Shore Battle Games, available for free online

name: Planetary Sand
description:
You command a task force of galactic troopers against enemy forces on distant planet. Your Planetary Infantry, supported by Space tanks and all-atmosphere personnel carriers, take on the opposition on desolate asteroids, bizarre planets and far-off space stations. Your troops are armed with the latest particle bean cannons, ray guns and zap rifles in their quest to make the Universe safe for Humanity

A simple, fun game for kids of all ages. Play it on the beach, in the backyard or the living room rug!

Three battle scenarios are presented: an open field battle with two forces facing off across No Man's Land, an assault on a defended position, and a battle in which each side is attempting to capture and hold an objective on the opponent's side of the field.

Units are rated for movement, attack range, and damage (at close, medium, and long range). Range and damage ratings vary based on whether the battle is located in a vacuum ("Space Atmosphere") or in a "Half-Earth" setting.

The rules also cover missiles, grenades, terrain effects, defensive armor, air supply and robots (divided into seven types). Advanced rules add spacecraft, planetary facilities, communications, and leadership. The advanced rules also prsent more distinctions between vehicles (wheeled, tracked, hovercraft, etc.)

name: Sandarticus
description:
A game which pits Roman legionnaires against a variety of adversaries. Sandarticus is a simple, fast-paced game of small-unit action in the Roman Empire. Roman soldiers defend the Empire against enemies from without and within. Fun, exciting, easy to play, for all ages.

Several different troop types are defined in the rules: Roman Legionnaires, Roman Cavalry, Roman Auxiliaries, Greek Hoplites, Greek Light Infantry, Gladiator Revolutionaries, Revolutionary Auxiliaries, Gauls, South Germans, and North Germans. Units are ranked for speed and armor.
Twelve types of personal weapons and three siege engines are described and ranked for damage and range. Advantages and limitations of certain weapons are also specified. Other concepts covered in the rules include leadership, formation fighting, and mercenaries.

name: Castle Cracker
description:
"Medieval and Ancient Warfare. A simple, basic game based on warfare in ancient times. Easy to learn, easy to use, for backyard, beach or living room. Uses almost any size or type figures, from plastic toy soldiers to collectible miniatures."

The figures are divided into a variety of classes: Infantry (with distinctions based on level of armor), Cavalry (light and heavy), Charioteers, War Wagons, Siege Crews, Archers, and Hakenbuschers (including Arquebusiers and Musketeers).

Each type of figure is rated for movement and each type of weapon is rated for range, rate of fire, and impact (at short, medium, and long range).

Basic castle siege rules are included. Advanced rules cover formations and morale, as well as offering further distinction to various historical units and projectile weapons.

name: Operation Sandtrap
description:
Rules for Toy Army Soldiers. This is a simple, easy game for play in the backyard or on the beach. Our goal is to make it fast, fun, enjoyable and cheap.

The players must supply at least thirty toy soldiers per side and any heavy weapons or vehicles (tanks, APCs, half tracks, artillery, etc.)

Each type of weapon (rifles, mortars, grenades, flamethrowers, etc.) is rated for range (long, medium, and short), shots per round, and damage. Explosive weapons are rated for their damage radius. Vehicles are rated for armor (front, side, and rear) and speed (road, off road, and steep/rough ground).

The rules also cover terrain effects and scenario types.

Advanced rules add leaders, radiomen, minesweepers, obstacles, bridges, morale, and concealed movement.
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, World War II

name: Jersey Shore Battle Games
description:
"The Jersey Shore Battle Games [previously known as the Sandy Hook Battle Games] are a group of simple, easy-to-play miniature battle games developed for one purpose: FUN! Unlike conventional board and miniature games, Jersey Shore Battle Games dispense with complexities altogether. Our goal is to provide a game that can be set up and played spontaneously, without studying complicated rules or spending extra money for expensive miniatures. Everything has to be commonly available."

The components required for play are kite string, two six-sided dice, a sand pail, a cup, a disk segmented into quarters (i.e. lines marked on a paper plate), and the appropriate toy figures.

The basic system rules are available for free.

The following games use the Jersey Shore Battle Games rules system:


Castle Cracker
Muskets and Sandpiles
Operation Sandtrap
Planetary Sand
Sahara Sandstorm
Sandarticus
Sandpit Showdown
Tanegashima Sandman
Treasure of Sandheap

name: Rabbidgerbal's Colonials -vs- Martians Steampunk Miniature Game
description:
"The great behemoth landships with coal fires stoked and steam boilers at full pressure chub their mighty pistons, sending vibrations of fear shaking the ground and hearts of men."

"Landships are the tanks of H. G. Wells imagination and the main figures in this game, One per side along with 4 (5-10) man infantry squads, Gatling gun, and a cannon crew of two men, or limits of your imagination... as you experiment with more squads and/or landships in larger battles."

"The enemy of our Victorian Era heroes armed with steam and black powder? Martians! These are Martian's not of -war of the worlds- level tech, but who grasp ‘like’ ability weapons they may have a co2 powered bolt weapon or Martian water pistols (to be cool) but just use 'musket' stats."

name: Rabbidgerbal's Biplane Dogfight Game
description:
A miniatures air combat game based around the author's rudimentary homemade biplane miniatures which use a plastic soda bottle-cap as a base.

Movement is measured in inches, with the distance moved based on the roll of one to four six sided dice. The basic planes move 2d6 inches each turn. The number of dice or distance rolled will be modified if the aircraft dives, turns, or performs special maneuvers (stall, climb, barrel roll, or loop).

Combat is resolved by the attacker rolling machine gun dice and the defender rolling maneuverability dice. For the basic planes, each player rolls 3d6, with a hit being scored if the attacker rolls a higher total. A plane is shot down after taking six hits.

Advanced rules cover gun jams, sun position, rear gunners, custom planes, pilot skill levels, and damage effects.

Variant rules suggestions are included for Star Wars dogfights.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War I

name: Sandpit Showdown
description:
"Rules for Wild West and Civil War. These is a very simple wargame for play on beach or in backyard, with plastic toy soldiers. The focus is on a fast-action game, easy to learn and easy to play. Our game is for small battles, only - with armies of 100 men or less on each side."

The players must supply the appropriate Cowboy and Indian or Civil War toy soldiers. The rules divide the figures into four types: Infantry (foot soldiers), Cavalry (mounted soldiers), Artillery (gun crewmen and cannon), and Indians (who fight as infantry or cavalry).

Each type of figure is rated or movement, as are wagons and caissons. Each of the weapons commonly carried by these types of figures is rated for range, damage, and rate of fire.

Other concepts covered in the rules include terrain effects, hand-to-hand combat, walls/bunkers, forts, prisoners and escapes. Scenario suggestions are given for open field battles, defense of forts, and relief of besieged forts.

One of the Jersey Shore Battle Games, available for free online
categories: American Civil War, American Indian Wars, American West, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Spider
description:
Spider uses a system of movement and jumping similar to that of Chinese Checkers, but with a twist.

The first playing piece (or 'fly') to cross the "Goal Line" at the other side of the board becomes the Spider and is placed in the center of the board. On subsequent turns, the Spider player may move the Spider in addition to their normal move.

Once the spider has collected a number of flies equal to the number of opposing players, the Spider is returned to its place at the opposite Goal and another player may become the spider simply by being first to move a fly into the center of the board. Captured flied are returned to their starting spaces when the current Spider 'retires'.

Another difference is that movement (and jumping) around the Spider's lair in the center of the board may be made in either direction.

Play continues until one player succeeds in moving all of their flies past the opposing Goal.

This odd game was published in Ocean Beach - a community of San Diego, California.

name: The Future Art of War
description:
The Future Art of War is a science fiction wargame, self-published by Leonard J. Meloche.

The game map consists of 26 planets (one starting with each letter of the alphabet).

Players start with one planet, and a small force of ships. They occupy/conquer planets, collect and trade resources, build ships, supply their planets and attempt to discover Battleship technology.

Players are eliminated when their home planet is conquered, and victory is achieved through the elimination of all other players.

The Future Art of War includes a creative movement mechanic which adds to the "fog of war" effect. Ships travel from planet to planet via "hyperspace", and a chart indicates the number of turns (1-6) required to travel between each pair of planets. When a ship departs for a planet, the controlling player secretly writes the first letter of the planet and the number of turns required on the bottom of the ship counter, and places it on the first space in the hyperspace track. Each turn, all ships in the hyperspace track move one space further down the track, and, when a ship has reached the appropriate space, the controlling player reveals the ship's destination. Therefore, while players know how many ships their opponents have in hyperspace, they do not know the ships' destinations, or when they will arrive.

The components of this game are quite good for a self-published game. The map is poster-quality, and the cards, reference sheets, and money are comparable to many commercially published games. The one component that clearly identifies the game as "self-published" is the ship counters, which are cut rectangles of flat plastic. These, however, with a whiteboard marker, serve the "hyperspace" mechanic very well. The game is packed in a large tube.
categories: Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Motorcade
description:
"Card Game for 2 players. One player is an armored caravan transporting a VIP. The other player is a group of Terrorists attacking the Motorcade."

Each player uses a unique deck of cards. A set of Travel Tokens is used to track the distance between the motorcade and the terrorists.

"Victory: The Terrorists win if the VIP (The Package) is killed. The Motorcade wins if it accumulates 20+ Travel Tokens."
categories: Card Game, Modern Warfare, Print & Play

name: Starfighter Combat
description:
Starfighter Combat is a mass combat game.
A game of tactics and intuition, players strive to out-maneuver and out think their opponents in Star fighter
combat. The players may control single Star fighters or entire squadrons. The rules are flexible enough for multi-player combat and more detailed scenarios.

In this game each Star fighter has attributes:
Max Speed, Speed, Impetus, Armor and Shields.

You use cards to control your ships movement.

The game includes ship building rules, and many different ships already made.


Free from:
http://www.geocities.com/shaungamer88/sfc.htm

name: Das 80er Jahre Quiz
description:
You remember Walkman, E.T., Nena, Maggie Thatcher or the musical Cats?
Then you are the right one for this Quiz.
Over 4.400 Questions and Answers waiting to transport you to the final Question.
Be a 80s expert!!!

name: Auf dem Weg zum Million辰r: Die 80er Jahre
description:
Traveling Game with more than 1.000 Questions concerning the 80s.
MUSIC-LIFESTYLE-HAPPENINGS-TV and CINEMA-SPORTS-CULTURE

name: GOES/POES Wild World of Weather Adventure Game
description:
Be the first the pilot your weather airship from San Francisco, CA all the way around the world and back across the USA to Miami, while earning at least 35 Adventure Chips.

You need the game board which you will move around, and you also have 3 different sets of question cards (easy, medium, and hard) which you will answer to gain Adventure Chips.

This is a roll and move game with some education questions thrown.

Get the game free from:
http://spaceplace.nasa.gov/en/educators/posters/#wwa

name: Our Town
description: OUR TOWN by M. Flint Productions, Grand Central Station, New York, NY. The object of OUR TOWN is to be the first player to complete all five Apple Adventures. This is done by first completing all four red apple adventures (Sites & events, Broadway, Fiscal Crisis, and Central Park) and thus qualifing for entrance into the Golden Apple. Completion of the Golden Apple adventure wins the game.

name: Black Path Game
description:
This elegant little game is playable on a rectangular grid with square Trax-like tiles, each of which has 2 black lines connecting pairs of sides (either opposite pairs of sides, or adjacent pairs of sides). Players alternate placing tiles, each tile extending the black path from a designated start arrow at the side of the board. If a player connects the path to the edge of the board, they lose.

The game is analyzed and solved in the combinatorial game theory book Winning Ways for Your Mathematical Plays (pages 746-747, volume 3 of A K Peters 2003 edition). The first player can win if the grid has an even number squares, and the second player can win if the grid has an odd number of squares.

name: DOMES
description:
DOMES is a free downloadable game from Gen1400 Gaming. You can download DOMES from the website www.gen1400.com.

You control a group of Domians trying to survive constant alien attacks. Each Domian can perform one action per turn. You decide whether to gather food, fuel, materials, or to repair your DOME. After the action phase the aliens will fire their lasers trying to destroy your DOME and all of your Domians.

Can you survive 15 turns?

name: DOMES 2: The Domians Fight Back
description:
This is the second game in the DOMES serious. In DOMES 2: The Domians Fight Back, the Domians have returned to out live the alien invaders. This time they come armed with the ability to build a laser to defeat the aliens.

DOMES 2 is played just like DOMES only this time you work on building and then firing your laser to destroy the aliens. Whoever destroys the alien spaceship wins the game.

DOMES 2 is a free downloadable game from Gen1400 Gaming. Visit www.gen1400.com to download your free copy today.

name: Arithmechips Multiplication Game
description:
Arithmechips Multiplication Game

(c)2004 Creative Toys Ltd.

"Plan the pathway to jump over the most chips, solve the multiplication exercises, and win the game!"

This educational math game teaches students Ages 7 and up about multiplication. Players solve math problems and "jump" score chips as in a game of checkers.

Includes a colorful puzzle-cut game board, 208 sturdy chips, practice pages, scoreboard, plastic storage tray, and instructions.

Designed for 2 to 4 players.

name: Mississippi Run
description:
"Card game for 2-4+ players. Theme: Commerce on the Mississippi River Basin using Riverboats in the early 19th Century."

The game uses a custom deck composed of four types of cards: Cargo, Tributary, Boat, and Event Cards. The players score points by playing melds of Boat, Tributary, and Cargo Cards. The number of points scored for playing a meld varies from 1 to 7, based on the number of Cargo Cards the meld contains.

The first player to reach twenty-five points wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Nautical, Transportation

name: Primary Pups
description:
From the Publisher:

PRIMARY PUPS--The HOME GAME incorporates the 1st-3rd grade curriculum. All players answer all questions; 300 multiple choice informational cards in 6 subjects--math, science, grammar, history, geography and health.

name: Probability Poker
description:
Produced in 1966 by the TALCRAN Co. of Olympia, Washington state, USA. The components consist of a long & somewhat deep box, a bi-folding game board that is 19-inches by 19-&-3/16ths-inches, a scoring pad, a deck of regular playing cards, a pencil, the tri-folded single paper sheet of rules, and a smaller paper sheet addendum with the "Casino A" version for this.

From the instructions:
The object of the game is to obtain the highest score in each turn by:

1. Keeping the three poker hands dealt, or
2. Improving any or all of the poker hands by drawing new cards from the supply of DRAW CARDS.

Play of Game:
A. Determination of Discards.

B. Improving the Poker Hands.

C. Scoring of Turn:
After the play of cards, the score for each turn is determined by comparing the poker hands obtained with the scoring table in the lower right hand corner of the playing board. The scoring table is reproduced in Figure *[5]

Winner of the Game:
The person having the highest number of points after ten turns is the winner of the game. These scores my be compared with those calculated for several classes of players as shown in Figure *[6]


NB (those are denoted in the Rules as well with upon the game's board).
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil

name: super loto
description:
Contents : 2 set of cards : one with red figures (for drawing), one with blue figures (allowing you to attempt to realize the same arrangement that your drawing). 100 tokens numbered as follows: 20 of value 100, 40 of value 50, 40 of value 10.

Your goal is to be the first to complete the lottery arrangement of your card.

name: Kalzure Zakuza
description:
A game about war and futuristic mecha's fighting over land. The game consist of multiple land boards 1 1d4 die 3 1d6 dice and 1 20 sided die. And the mecha character sheets featuring unbelievable artillery such as rocket launchers hand rockets. Jet boots and more the objective is to destroy all opposing mecha enemies and take there land.

When all land is yours you win the game this game is played a lot like Risk and Gundam mixed together. It is a new idea and hopefully one that will make it to stores.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Dice, Electronic, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: WW I Aerial Combat (1914-1918 AD)
description:
“It was during World War I that the airplane became an important weapon of war. At the start of the war the planes were unarmed and were used for scouting. Soon the pilots were taking weapons with them on their flights. These early efforts were crude, but Dutch inventor Anthony Fokker eventually succeeded in synchronizing a machine gun with an engine so the weapon could fire through the propeller. This led to the ‘Fokker scourge’ as the Germans used the new invention to dominate the skies. The Allies soon followed suit and battled the Germans for control of the skies over no man's land. Successful ‘aces’, like the Red Baron, were lionized by the press and became living legends. By the end of the war the airplane's role in combat had expanded to include reconnaissance, artillery spotting, trench strafing, and bombing.”

A simple historical miniatures air combat game designed for classroom use in grades 6-8. The game may be played by eight players using 1/72 scale models on a Battle Masters mat (4x4 feet with five inch hexes).

Each player uses an aircraft model (Allied or German) on a stand, a deck of maneuver cards, a laminated record card (for tracking damage and victories with a dry erase marker), and 5 six-sided dice. Each record card includes the name and picture of a World War One ace, his victory total, and brief biographical information.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Medieval Castle Siege
description:
“A well-built castle could control the surrounding countryside and was very difficult to capture. If you couldn't take it by trickery or treachery your best option was to wait for disease and starvation to force the garrison to surrender."

"If the castle was well provisioned, or the attackers were in a hurry, then a direct assault might be attempted. The tactics used were basically unchanged since ancient times. Moats could be filled, a ram could bash in the gate, and catapults and trebuchets could knock down the walls. Ladders or a siege tower could also surmount the walls. Another popular (and dangerous) tactic was to undermine the walls with a tunnel.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted one per stand. Free print-and-play paper miniature soldiers and siege engines are also provided for use with the rules, as is a paper castle.

The siege weaponry and implements portrayed in the game includes the ballista, boiling oil, catapult, covered ram, siege tower, mantlet, and bombard.

To win the game, the attackers must take control of the castle.

name: Dig that Dinosaur
description:
It's the adventure filled game where you go on an excavation and try to be the first player to find all six parts of your dinosaur's skeleton. Select the board of the dinosaur you wish to dig for and the fun begins. Using the excavation tool, turn up any two cards on the game board. Now peek at the cards that are underneath. If a card shows bones to your dinosaur, place it on your board. If not, cover it back up for the other players to find. Finding a ruby give you an extra turn but uncovering a snake might help your opponent.

In addition to sharpening memory skills Dig that Dinosaur features real dinosaur facts. It's a great way to have fun and learn about these great prehistoric creatures.

Published for the Smithsonian Institution.

name: The Liverpool Football Club Game
description:
The Liverpool Football Club Game

This game consists of scoring points and goals gained by moving a token around the board using the throw of a dice. You also play Playing the Tackle, Infringement, Appeal, Yellow and Red Referee Cards and finally you answer questions about the scores, events, personalities of your favorite football club along with some general knowledge questions about football.

The Winner is the player with the most goals and points at the end of the game.

Ages 9 and up

Contents of the game include -
1 Playing Board.
1 Pack of Question/Answer Cards.
1 Pack of Tackle Cards.
1 Pack of Appeal Cards.
1 Pack of Infringement Cards.
Yellow and Red Cards.
6 Playing Pieces.
1 Die.
1 Set of Rules.

name: Gun Law
description:
Gun Law Game by Bell Toys and Games - 1958.

"A Stirring..Exciting British Game - From the Famous TV Program GUNSMOKE Starring James Arness as Marshal Matt Dillon.

For Up to 4 Players.

Yellow Tree Ranch is about to be attacked by rustlers.
A small band of cowboys is trying to hold the rustlers at bay until help is obtained. The cowboys are trying to get one of their men through the badlands in order to enlist the help of Marshal Dillon and his deputies.

The object of the game is for the cowboys to get one man through the badlands to Dodge City or to capture all the rustlers. The object for the rustlers to get six men into Yellow Tree Ranch or capture all the cowboys.

Contents
1 Playing Plan.
1 Spinner.
10 Cowboys.
12 Rustlers.
4 Stand Up Stockades.
1 Set of Rules.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: It's Cricket
description:
It's Cricket
By 4 Games

Ages 6 and up

"Played According to the Official M.C.C. Laws of Cricket."

"Keep Your Own Records - Individual Batting and Bowling Averages,Score Cards and Match Records."

Description

The Game is played just like the real thing scoring wise.
Fill in the score sheet and make the toss.

The Ball(Counter) is placed on the Pitch (Marked B).
The Counter is then pushed or flicked toward's the far wicket.

If the Batsmen is not out he plays the ball to score runs in the same manner. Extras are awarded if the counter covers half,or more than half of squares marked NB, W, LB or BY.

The Batsmen attempts to flick the counter on to the squares or part cover them to score his runs - No runs if the counter is flicked off the board.

A batsman can be caught, stumped, run out etc. depending on where the counter lands!!

Six balls per over then change ends.

Play Limited or Test Cricket! The choice is your's.

Game comes with

1 Game Board.
1 Score Pad.
3 Counter's.
1 Rules Sheet.

name: Overland Cross Country Race
description:
Overland Cross Country Race Game


The Game is a "Race Game" around Britain stopping at 12 towns from London and Back.

Players take two balls each.

One ball is placed on the "Runway" and close to parallel. This allows the ball to run up and down the runway as it is raised or lowered.

When the all is over the desired town the runway is allowed to spring open to drop the ball to score.

Aim at each town in order using the two balls alternating until the player fails to score - The last scored ball remains in the board.

The next player then sets out. When he catches up with the other ball he can skip that town.

The first person to return to London is the winner.
Contents

1 Playing Board with Metal Runway.
3 Balls.
Rules are Printed on the Inner Box Lid.

name: Grocery Cart
description:
Its time to go grocery shopping! Learn to do what wise shoppers do — scout ads for best buys! Grocery Cart involves players in four important life skills: comparing grocery ads, making correct payment for purchases, keeping accurate financial records, and reconciling cash on hand with shopping records. The winner is the player who makes the best purchases, makes correct payments, and keeps accurate records.

Two levels of play allow players in grades 4 and up to benefit. Eight grocery ads are included. Players are encouraged to substitute local ads to further increase realism.

name: Making Change Octominoes
description: Making Change Octominoes provides playful practice in counting money and making change! It also builds fluency in addition and subtraction. In Coin Values, players match the stated number of cents with a set of coins. In Making Change, players figure the correct change for a dollar and find a matching set of coins. Amazingly, both games are self-checking! The unique octagonal starting board offers eight positions for placing dominoes, intensifying learning. Additional games provide options for meeting specific needs.

name: Coins Count!
description:
"It’s fun to earn money for the food bank!”
Coins Count! is a valuable first experience in earning money for a charity, making small purchases, and handling change. Players become familiar with pennies, nickels, dimes, quarters, and dollar bills. The winner is the player who is the first to donate five dollars to the food bank. This rich instructional package also includes activities for use with an entire class: self-correcting lessons on making correct change and suggestions for interesting investigations.

name: Decisions: A Stock Market Game
description: “Shall I buy or sell? Am I a risk-taker or conservative investor?” What future earner will want to avoid investing in the stock market? Decisions is a money management game played in the context of the stock market. Players attempt to increase their wealth through strategic decision-making in buying and selling stocks. They rely, in part, on their sense of probability. The emphasis is on accurate computation and record-keeping. Players build communication skills as they explain the reasons for every move. The winner is the player with the highest net worth.

name: GeoGems Polygons
description: Discover the gems in geometry! Players develop fluency in naming and identifying the properties of six types of triangles, seven classes of quadrilaterals, pentagons, hexagons, and octagons. Builds geometric literacy through the use of words such as congruent, parallel, perpendicular, obtuse, acute, isosceles, equilateral, etc. Two name card sets and four property card sets offer progressive levels of play. Unique game board and moves multiply interest. Covers much of 2-D geometry content in state and national standards.

name: KFAT Gilroy Garlic Game
description:
From the back:

"Welcome to KFAT country. That great and wonderful expanse that stretches south from San Francisco to Salinas, possibly even King City. Where the U.S.A. comes out of the Pacific and across to the mountains that make San Joaquin a valley.

"A land of virtually everything that could be wanted (except good snow). A place to raise the spirits of man, perhaps his income.

"A land of farmers, ranchers, fishermen, electronic engineers, country people, suburbanites, cowboys, etc., etc.

"A mini-world offering a great variety of terrains and activities. All this within the grasp of one centrally located city. Gilroy! Yes, Sir! It's all within 50 miles of the Garlic Capital of the World.

"This is the game that plays over the area and enables you to pit your investment skills against others in a race to return big dollars.

"Players will be buying and selling agri-commodities and learning all about the necessity of cash flow.

"No need to worry, it's not complicated just business as usual with a KFAT twist.

"They're all real businesses that exist in the area, encompassed by San Jose, Santa Cruz, Salinas, Hollister and "all the rest of them there towns down there". So welcome to the heart of it all, Friendly Gilroy."

name: El Juego del Capitalismo
description:
"El Juego del Capitalismo" Is a Colombian boardgame designed by two economists.

The objective of the game is to learn how to manage your money.

There are several roles/professions in the game (Construction Worker, Lawyer, etc...). At the beggining of the game each player select a profession, each profession has a monthly income and outcome and the board represents the life of a person in an abstract form.

The players roll a dice advance that number of spaces and take the correspondent card. Some cards are oportunities other are unexpected events and expenses and so on...

The game ends when the first player obtains his/her profession goal.

As said nobody looses, nobody wins. The goal of the game is to learn how to manage your money.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Ne engedj a negyvennyolcb坦l!
description:
On March 15, 1848, mass demonstrations in Pest and Buda enabled Hungarian reformists to push through a list of 12 demands. Faced with revolution both at home and in Vienna, Austria first had to accept Hungarian demands. Later, under governor Lajos Kossuth and the first Prime minister, Lajos Batthyány, the House of Habsburg was dethroned and the form of government was changed to create the first Republic of Hungary. Initially, the Hungarian forces (Honvédség) defeated Austrian armies. To counter the successes of the Hungarian revolutionary army, Franz Joseph asked for help from the "Gendarme of Europe," Czar Nicholas I, whose Russian armies invaded Hungary. The huge army of the Russian Empire and the remnants of the Austrian forces proved too powerful for the Hungarian army, and General Artúr Görgey surrendered in August 1849.

Ne engedj a negyvennyolcból! is a card game based on the theme of political unrest and the Hungarian freedom fighters during this turbulent time in Hungarian history.

name: Peg Top
description:
All children find great amusement with a SPINNING TOP of any character, together with the use of PEGS in recording scores in games. This novelty has been prepared with this in mind. First, the Top is Spun and when "dead" the handle points to one of four numbers. A Peg is then inserted in a Hole at one side of the board to register the player's score and the first player having PEGGED IN over his course of 30 HOLES WINS.

(From the instructions. All capitalizations are as they appear in the rules.)

The game is very basic. It has a shallow metal cup in the middle of the board. You spin the top in the cup and when the it stops, the player the top's peg is pointing towards gets a point.

name: The Red Book of Nal
description: Magic in the Acqittaine series by Carl Smith. Provides rules for use in the " Sword and Shield" series.

name: Asphodel Inn
description: " A complete fantasy adventure set in the world of Acqutaine". For use with the rules "Sword and Shield".

name: Fire the Cannons!
description:
Fire the Cannons! is a tile laying game where players compete to build the largest castle, while strategically using cannon fire to ruins their opponents' castles. Its a Euro-style game, no die rolling for mechanic resolution. Playing the tiles builds your castle, situates the cannons, and when a sufficient number of flag-tiles are played, fires the cannons.

Starting with the player holding the cannon and proceeding clockwise, each player should take one territory
tile from the face-up pile in the center of the board and add it next to another tile in their kingdom.
The tile may be rotated when being placed.
Only when an area is completely enclosed by walls, however, is it considered “secured”. If an area has one or more gaps, it is considered “under siege” until all of the gaps are filled.
Each tile will generally have one or more special symbols on the tile. Adding three commander (red flag) symbols to one’s kingdom will trigger a round of attack. The player will score during this time as well.
At the end of the round, refill the center play area with new tiles from the territory tile stack
The player with the highest score when no tiles remain in the center of the play area wins.

Is freely available from http://www.vbasementgames.com/ after you create an account.
categories: City Building, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: Henchmen
description:
Congratulations! As the new franchise owner of a Henchman Unlimited agency, you provide the needed help for many of the world’s most discriminating major villains as they implement their evil plans. Survivors often claim that the experience is quite rewarding! But beware those doomsday plans…

You have to complete missions set by the major villains. The first player picks the plan the villain wants accomplished, and then the players play henchmen to try to complete the mission. They commit henchman to resolve the evil plan. Players take one henchman card from their hand and commit it face down. These henchmen form the mission pool.
All Players Simultaneously Reveal Henchmen in the Mission Pool. All the better to determine which henchmen to undermine … er … help… during subterfuge. Players Play Subterfuge Cards. These cards can help and hinder in the efforts. Then you see whether the plan worked. If the plan succeeded, then the highest unique number on the henchmen will count for points (be promoted to the back office).
You repeat till 3 rounds or a doomsday plan has been completed. If a doomsday plan was enacted, then the player whose henchman made it succeed is ineligible for victory.
Each eligible player totals up the henchman value for all henchmen promoted to the back office. The player with the highest total is the winner. Players may tie for victory.

Available from: http://www.vbasementgames.com/
You have to create an account to download the game.
2014-05-23 update: The website vbasementgames.com no longer available

name: Hide-N-Seek Under the Sea
description: Welcome to Hide-N-Seek Under the Sea. It's a race to find all your fish friends and get back to your home before your opponent does. Sounds easy, right? Well, all you have to do is make it past Cranky Crab, Mrs. Jellyfish and by all means - stay away from the fist nets!! So let's play Hide-N-Seek Under the Sea.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: lan Deluxe
description:
Elan Deluxe is the latest version of Phillip A. Jones' tactical Napoleonic miniatures wargaming rules. Elan is designed to have each player controlling roughly an augmented division of troops.
Élan Deluxe is the latest and final evolution of these tactical-level Napoleonic wargame rules designed for 15-25 mm miniatures.

The Deluxe version also includes campaign rules Etat-Major, new optional rules, and also included in the rules are extensive unit ratings for over twenty nations and over 40 Army lists for every nation that took part in the conflict including multiple theatres.

Élan is a flowing game that accurately reflects historical tactics. Players are placed "on the table" and granted wide historical latitude to control their units.

The rules sequence features both simultaneous and alternate actions, resulting in an intuitive and balanced game that captures the feel of the period strongly. Individual units represented are the battalion and regiment and players can do sub-unit actions such as company and squadron actions. Players can use any basing system and the default scale is 1:50, but players can use any ratio such as 1:20 or 1:60.

It is a game that replicates the tactics of the period and enables gamers to play the period and not get bogged down in complex rules! The game can also be adapted for other Horse and Musket periods from the SYW to the Crimea War.

The game will appeal to players who enjoy tactical nuance and want a game that grows with them in subtlety and tactical complexity. Élan is written in a clear, concise style. The rules are well indexed, logically laid out and easy to comprehend. The PDF file also has bookmarks for ease of navigation and players can print out just the sections that interest them.

name: Number Detectives
description:
4 games in one:

1. The Plus-detectives
Whoever is savvy and has lots of luck will collect the
most number cards.

2. Quick Plus-detectives
Play according to the rules of Plus detectives, except for the players calculate all at once.

3. The ten times table detectives
Whoever is savvy and has lots of luck will collect the most
number cards.

4. The speedy ten times table detectives
The same rules apply as in the “Ten times table detectives”,
except all players calculate simultaneously.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Number

name: The Game of Oppression
description:
While college campuses are becoming increasingly diverse, many students still find it difficult to step outside of what is familiar and interact with students of different races, religions, classes, abilities or sexual orientations. Students may pass each other on campus and attend classes together, but few develop meaningful relationships with others from different backgrounds. The Game of Oppression is designed to encourage and challenge individuals from different backgrounds and experiences to engage in authentic dialogue.

The Game of Oppression Diversity Education Kit includes:

The game board

Facilitator Guide

Instruction Booklet (with Reflection Journal and Observation Worksheet)

Six decks of cards

10 colored pawns

One die

How it works:

The Game of Oppression is designed to be played by 10 to 20 players at a time, with half playing as active participants and the other half as observers. The optimum amount of time allotted to play is four hours to ensure proper facilitation and personal engagement, but the game can be played in a minimum of three hours. The goal is to achieve "enlightenment." To do this, the active participants move their pawns around the game board and respond to statements on the playing cards. After a set period of time, the two groups switch roles. At the end of the game, all players participate in a reflection and group discussion period to synthesize the game experience for each participant.

More information can be found here: https://www.naspa.org/publications/books/the-game-of-oppress...

name: Fare p奪 ferde
description:
(Translated from the box - in Norwegian)

Fare på ferde... a preventive game from Røde Kors (Red Cross).

The game that teaches.

Fare på ferde is a fun and entertaining family game that should teach the players common sense regarding both bathing and walking in the mountains in a new and exiting way.

The game takes place on a journey through the Nordic countries. The various routes will give unexpected experiences. In this way you learn what dangers nature may offer and how you should behave.

Fare på ferde is a different game, both informative and preventive. The game gathers players in all ages for entertainment about a serious theme.

Bon voyage

name: Redmond Trivia
description: Localized trivia game about Redmond, Oregon. Roll and move your way around Redmond answering questions about its rich heritage.

name: El Presidente
description:
El Presidente is a game of forming a Military Junta to run a fictional country. Players use their military power to vote for their preferred El Presidente who then allocates all the other offices in the Junta to the other players. El Presidente then allocates the yearly budget to all the players which they use to purchase armies by auction. However if El Presidente does not keep everybody happy there is likely to be a Coup de Etat.

Required for this game:
Event Deck
Money Deck
Army Deck
Office Cards (reminder rules only)
6 different hats for the government offices
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Political

name: Robo Rumble
description: Robo Rumble is a card game for up to six players. The cards are used to construct your robot champion, first by setting down a Bot Chassis card, and then by adding on Gears 'n Circuit cards. After the players have constructed their robots, the game board is constructed with another set of cards in a 4x6 rectangular layout. The game from there is movement and fire. The game also used Action Cards and Teleport Cards to give robots combat advantages . The game is played until a player gets at least 20 points, at which time they may call it. 20 points does not assure victory, since the other players get one last turn. After all player have finished with their turns, the player with the most points wins.

name: BANDthology: Ultimate Canadian Edition
description:
Love Canadian music? This is YOUR MUSIC. This is YOUR GAME.

600 questions celebrating Canadian music and milestones in the Canadian music industry.

Shuffle the cards into your existing BANDthology board game or play it on the long trip ahead.

name: BANDthology: Touring Edition Volume 1
description:
Long trip ahead? Play BANDthology to help pass the time. Play solo or with a group.

Travel edition of the BANDthology board game.

name: Rescue Races
description:
Part art project and part game, Rescue Races comes with markers, stamps and an ink pad for children to decorate the board, card and tokens. The board folds out to 2 feet long and features pop-up buildings.

During game play, players move along the track collecting badges for rescuing people. The player who has the most badges when s/he reaches the Rescue Headquarters wins.

name: For President 2008
description:
· For President 2008 The 2008 elections are a turning point in American history. The era of President George W. Bush will soon be over. Will Barack Obama bring “Change we can believe in”? Or will John McCain bring “Change we need”? Both similar sounding slogans stand for completely different concepts deciding which turn America’s policy will take in the future.
· The Democrats and Republicans are divided by a deep gap of controversial political concepts. The economy, the war in Iraq, America’s dependence on oil imports, alternative energy concepts, and other major events which shaped the actual campaign are represented in a card driven game system.
· In For President 2008 you take the role of Team Obama or Team McCain. The contest is fought out on an electoral map of the United States as it stands in 2008.
· Preview Map: Both the candidates and their VP use markers in the game for their campaigns. Both teams can campaign in each state or make federal campaigns affecting national opinion. For President 2008 puts an emphasis on the battleground states that may decide the outcome of the elections. As with the real election, the challenge is to adapt your campaign strategy as the ground shifts beneath your feet. There are never enough resources and time is too short to do everything that needs to be done. You will have to make priority decisions about where to expend your efforts to propel yourself into the White House.
· For President 2008 will also offer “What if” options. What if Hillary Clinton would be the Democrat Nominee? What if Hillary Clinton would be the Democrat VP and more…
· For President 2008 will give YOU the opportunity to rewrite history or recreate it.

Components:
Mounted Map
Box
Die cut counters
110 playing cards
Dice
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Ddakji
description:
Ddak-ji is a popular Korean childrens game played using specially made cardboard disks. The disks resemble Pogs but are perhaps thinner and slightly curved. Unlike the games played using Pogs, Ddak-ji uses no 'slammer' piece. Only the ddakji themselves are used.

In the basic version of the game the throwing player is chosen by 'Rock, Paper, Scissors' and the losing player places their disk on the table. The active player throws their disk down on it in an attempt to make the inactive player's disk flip over. The curvature of the disks makes finesse an important part of the technique. If a disk is flipped, the player who flipped it gets to keep it. Variants of this play style exist.

The modern disks are decorated with pictures of characters from popular culture (TV, animation and video game characters are extremely popular).

Modern ddakji is the descendant of an older game that was adopted from Japanese culture. In Japan special illustrated cards (Cf. 'menko'), similar to modern sports cards, were thrown down in an attempt to flip and claim the cards. The old Korean version that descended from this was played with handmade folded paper or pasteboard squares.

The early history of Ddak-ji in Korea is briefly mentioned in Lee E-Wha's History of Korea, Vol. 14:

"in addition to these games, there was a slap-match (ddakji chigi) which came from Japan in the nineteenth century. The goal of this game was to flip the pasteboard card (ddakji) on the ground by slapping it with another pasteboard card."

name: Sleepy Hollow
description:
Just outside the limits of the Dutch settlement of Tarrytown, New York, an old Church stands in view of a burying ground surrounded by humble homes, a school and a covered bridge. The year is 1792, and only a decade earlier this secluded glen was the scene of a grisly battle during the American Revolution where a Hessian soldier lost his head to a stray cannonball. Since that fateful day the residents of Sleepy Hollow live in fear of nightfall when the Headless Horseman returns and ‘rides forth to the scene of battle in a nightly quest of his head.’

Sleepy Hollow is based on the legendary tale of Sleepy Hollow as penned by Washington Irving in 1820. During the game players control residents of Sleepy Hollow, recently shaken by the disappearance of Ichabod Crane, now living in fear that the Headless Horseman will come for them. Game play is divided into the 10 days leading up to All Hallows Eve, each separated into day and night. During the day, the residents move freely about the glen, finding a safe place to hide before nightfall. At night, the Horseman makes rounds in the village killing residents where they hide.

Each building gives players distinct benefits, but also distinct criterion dictating who is killed if targeted by the Horseman. Sometimes it is wisest to risk leaving yourself exposed, other times it is safer to stay hidden. By the time the sun rises on All Hallows Day, the player with the most points and fewest fatalities wins.

name: Ego
description:
Ego is a very simple to learn yet challenging to play abstract strategy game in which the goal is to jump the opposing player's large pawn (the "EGO") with one of your own small pawns (an "EGOT").

From the game's instruction sheet: "The objective of the game is for one player to jump the EGO of the other player. The EGO is representative of the players’ skill, ingenuity, and adaptiveness as displayed through the players’ defensiveness, problem solving ability or progressiveness through the use of the players' EGOTS."

Game contents:
-1 wood board with 92 holes, 2 of which are surrounded by a gold ring to mark where the EGO pawns are placed
-36 small black "EGOT" pawns
-1 large black "EGO" pawn
-36 small white "EGOT" pawns
-1 large white "EGO" pawn
-1 sheet containing English instructions on one side and French instructions on the other

This is a purely strategic game with no luck involved, which means that the loser is sure to be left with a bruised ego!

name: Fiume di Parole
description:
Game for teams - designed for schools - with a basic "watery" theme: the Italian name means literally "river of words".
The targets are Ages 7 - 12 students, but the game is also playable by families.

A player should be the game master: a teacher, or a member of the family.
The goal for each team is to score enough points to reach the final case of a "scoring river" with a marker.
To gain points, each team must find a word which contains the syllable indicated by game master, gaining more points for longer words.
If the word is related to water, or better to potable water and its saving, points scored will be doubled.
It's possible to use opponents' position on the "scoring river" to jump over them, and there are also some special bonus cases.

Basically, it's a roll and move game, but the "roll" is replaced by inventive and knowledge of a language.
You can also choose different "themes" or languages to make the players learn something different or think about a different environmental-social problem.

Available in Italian and English.

name: Balonmesa
description:
English Intro:
This football game is both intellectually stimulating and exciting. Every movement of the pieces entirely obeys the dictates of the intelligence: there is no luck involved.
No age limit - children, adolescents, adults -, will all make progressive use of their mental faculties. Analysis, logic, tactics, self control...
And after the initial games you will immediately discover an unexpected wealth of sensations and emotions as exciting as footbal itself.

Intro en Español:
Es el juego/deporte, tan científico como emotivo, que representa un partido de fútbol.
Cada movimiento de piezas obedece por completo a la inteligencia; no interviene el azar.
Sin limitación de edad -niño, joven, adulto-, ejercitará progresivamente sus aptitudes mentales. Análisis, lógica, tácticas, autocontrol...
Y enseguida, con las primeras jugadas descubrirá un mundo insospechado de sensaciones y emociones tan apasionantes como el mismo fútbol.

name: Frontier Marshal / Star of India
description:
Two games are included in the box: Frontier Marshal and Star of India, both of which use a different side of the game board.

Frontier Marshal is a standard roll-and-move game where players move their pawns and carry out whatever action is printed on the space they land on. The game is themed as "deputies chasing a bandit" - one player is the bandit, the remainder are deputies. The game ends when the bandit is either captured or becomes trapped (by certain spaces on the board).

Star of India is also roll-and-move, with players this time attempting to secure the precious "Star of India" ruby from the House of Gems and return it to the Maharaja. The game features a cardboard ring that the player can hang around their pawn's neck to show ring ownership - the winner is the first player to return home with the ring. Alarm spaces and thefts from other players add some complications.

name: Het Albert Heijn Smurfen spel
description: All the smurfs start in Gargamel's cage and have to escape to one of the smurf houses. Every player chooses a smurf house at the beginning of the game. Everybody can move every smurf, just roll the die and move one of the smurfs. A smurf that enters a smurf house is safe and cannot be moved anymore. Minimum number of smurfs to play is 4 but it's better with more.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cortella the American Game
description: Made in 1913 by Atkins and Company of Philadelphia. Players use dice to move their pieces to the goal by traveling through the courts and the King's Castle.

name: Drop Swap & Roll: The Game Of Reuse & Recycling
description:
Drop Swap & Roll: The Game Of Reuse & Recycling

1998

U.S. Environmental Protection Agency

EPA530-E-98-003

A board game designed to educate kids in grades 4 to 6 about recycling, composting, and reuse.

Four players (or four teams of players) ages 10 and older reduce their trash flow by taking it to the proper recycling locations in the neighborhood.

Includes a colorful board, tokens, cards, rules, several educational booklets, and a large poster.

name: World - o - Fun
description:
World-o-Fun is a game compendium which is contained in a book of 85 pages.
There is a total of 11 games to be played with any globe (preferably one from the Replogle Company).
Their names are:
-The hidden Planets Game
-The World Crossword Puzzle
-Size up these Islands
-Then and Now
-The great Circle Game
-The Question and Answer Game
-The early Bird
-The lost Picture
-Scrambles
-Find the lost Cities
-These Countries want to be named

They are of different complexity and suitable for children as well as for adults, with playing time between 5 and 30 minutes.
mechanics: Area Movement, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Team-Based Game

name: Stukas greifen an
description:
A propaganda game from Germany in 1940. It's a variation on Chinese Checkers where you have to move your pieces from one side of the board to the other and back avoiding the enemy's spotlights and flak. The players take turns to roll and move. Enemy pieces may be captured by jumping over them to a free space behind them. The player who brings the most pieces home wins the game.

As noted by permission from Randall L. Bytwerk, "the object of the game is to move one's pieces to the other side of the board (the enemy airbase) and back, avoiding enemy searchlights (in yellow) and flak (in red) along the way."
categories: Abstract Strategy, Aviation / Flight, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Race, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Children of the World
description:
Your Passport to Places Near and Far

This children's game is really three different games using a common set of components.
There is a variation of Concentration in which the players try to complete their set of 12 cards on their own board. Each player's color also has an ethnicity attached to it. They are American (NYC), Japanese, African, and Eskimos.

There is a very simple matching game for children 3 or 4 years old.

There is a roll-and-move variation in which the players place cards on their board as they move around based on dice rolls. The first player whose board is filled wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Speed Racer: Race Mountain
description:
Speed Racer: Race Mountain is a game meant to recreate the feel of a race from the classic 60's animated series. This is a relatively simple childrens' game and movement and race track conditions are determined by roll of the die. First player across the finish line wins!

The game includes a nice looking 3D molded mountain game board, 4 player pieces representing characters from the show, such as Speed and Racer X, one die, instructions, and sticker sheet.


Microbadges:
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Math Smart Card Game
description:
The Math Smart Card Game consists of 90 cards. There are four different versions one for Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, and Division. The sets can be mixed and stacked in any way to allow players to focus on particulars or go for breadth.

Each card has an equation on one side and an answer to a different equation on the other. The rules make for a tile placement game where players attempt to identify which answers match equations in their hand. First player to lay all their cards wins.

There is also a cooperative or solitaire variant in which players work together and attempt to correctly chain all the cards together. This is an inexpensive card game that lets you and your kids practice math feeling more like you are playing game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Arcanity
description:
A Card Game of Magical Duels-

Can you master the magical arts? In a duel between mages, you will have to use fire, ice, nature, shadow and arcane magic to overcome your opponents. Break their shields and score points to win the title of master mage!

The winner of the last duel leads a card, and then players must play cards of that same "school" of magic. The winner then takes the cards. But the 6 and the 7 cards have special abilities. If they are in the hand, they have positive or negative effects for the next round.

This is a free PnP Card Game.

name: Ruin Runner
description:
The goal of the game is to collect more valuable resources from an ancient alien ruin than your opponents.

The first phase is Discovering the Ruins.
Each turn you put a tile on the board. The tiles must match the other tiles on the placement you choose.

After the tiles are placed, you move on to Looting the Ruins. You move your looter 1 tile and may take a resource from that tile. There are also special tiles that affect movement.

Scoring
You score points based on how many resources you have. If they match your cards you score more points. Not surprisingly, the person with the most points wins after this.

Free from:
http://www.zeroradiusgames.com/downloads.html
mechanics: Area Movement, Commodity Speculation, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: UFO Interception: Rhineland 1945
description:
UFO Interception: Rhineland 1945 allows two to four players to battle for control of the skies over Germany towards the end of WWII.

The game focuses on the plight of a US night-fighter crew on a routine mission that goes wrong over the Rhineland. Players can choose to control the P-61A Black Widow armed with four 20mm cannons and four 50 cal. machine guns in a turret, or three Foo Fighters armed with Ignition-Disrupters. This is the second game released in their "UFO Interception" series.

The boxed set includes; UFO Interception: Rhineland 1945 Rulebook (45 pages), a P-61A Black Widow w/base (1/285 scale pewter model), 3 Foo Fighters (fluorescent red 3D acrylic balls) w/bases, 2 Reference Sheets, 1 Scenario Sheet, 2 Data Cards, 1 Template Sheet, 5x D10 Dice (2 White and 3 Black), and a Decal Sheet.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Nanji wa chou-ichimi nariya!
description:
A japanese home-brew, a "Negima!" version of Werewolf.

To activate the "Forced Magic Recognition Spell" in order to eradicate all unhappiness in the world… that is the true goal for Chao Ling-sheng. But that cannot be allowed. You must crush her plans, together with the other students with magical powers!
But take heed, for the Chao team is after you. Each time the World Tree is activated, the Forced Time Jump Bullets rain down on the Negi team!
The keys to victory in this battle where magic and technology meet, are the students who don't know anything about magic. The last event on the Mahora festival is also the stage for the last battle.
Who will be victorious? Will it be the Chao team, burning for its conviction?
Or will it be the Negi team, believing in friendship?
categories: Bluffing, Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Booya
description:
Booya is a very unique strategy game. It has similarities to GO, Goblet and Connect Four. What’s unique about Booya is the BOOYA!, which is a rule, that allows you to replace your opponents, move.

Your goal is to get 7 sets of three before your opponent or after all the pegs are used, have the most sets.
Sets can share the same peg and they are connected horizontal, vertical or diagonal.

Booya has a very aesthetic design with its rubberized block, laser engraved rules and logo and the anodized aluminum pegs.

Overall, Booya is a very fun abstract strategy that is simple to learn but challenging to master!

name: Pacific 1942 SunRise
description:
Pacific 1942 SunRise is the first extension of the Pacific 1942 Admiral game.

Watch out! The Pacific 1942 SunRise extension cannot be played without the basic version of the game.

It adds new elements to the basic game and thus makes the game more varied.

To play the Pacific 1942 SunRise extension, it is necessary to know the rules of the basic version.

Contents of the extension:
- Five randomly selected hexagon sextets (i.e. tiles)
- Three extra battalions of the marines, three bomber squadrons and three fighter squadrons
- Six extra prisms, which, in the Pacific 1942 Admiral game, stand for the power and speed of ships. In Pacific 1942 SunRise extension, you will have also another use for them.
- Eight completely new island tiles
- 21 risk cards
- A typhoon triplet consisting of three tiles
- A night card

What does Pacific 1942 SunRise change?

Firstly, there is a new goal. To win the basic version, you had to seize four islands in the Pacific. Now, the task becomes even more demanding: You have to push your enemy out of all islands.
In the basic version, a player could seize an island and that was it. In Pacific 1942 SunRise, some islands can be turned into powerful bases. (See more below.)
Apart from the new island tiles, the risk cards represent another extremely important novelty. At the end of his or her turn, every player can decide to take a risk card instead of producing a new battle unit. (The use of these cards is specified below.)

Eight new island tiles

Eight new island tiles comprise two sets of four tiles. Every player receives a set of four tiles. The new island tiles are of the following types:
- A tile with a trench.
- A tile with an airfield.
- A tile with a harbour.
- A tile with a fortress.

Risk cards
There are 16 types of risk cards in the game. Before every game, they have to be thoroughly shuffled and placed with their face down. At the end of each turn, instead of production, a player can take one risk card. You can encounter the following risk cards:
1.Minesweeper
2.Rudder hit
3.Typhoon
4.Submarine
5.Paratroopers
6.False token
7.Extra production
8.New ship
9.Lifeboat
10.Reconnaissance
11.Fleet
12.SunRise
13.Open Card
14.Waves
15.Night
16.Last moment

Expands:

Pacific 1942 Admiral
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Scorpion Championship Snowmobile Derby
description:
(from the rules)

In the 1920's a new concept of snow travel was invented in Canada! The Snowmobile! Since that time the snowmobile has developed from a large, bulky commercial type machine to the sleek personal machine it is today.

The snowmobile is a recreational vehicle that can be enjoyed by the whole family, but is also a vehicle for those who are competitive and like to participate in that fastest growing of winter sports, snowmobile racing.

There are three basic types of snowmobile racing: oval track; drag; and cross country. Of the three, cross country demands the most from both rider and machine. Burton Cole developed and designed the Scorpion Championship Snowmobile Derby game to give you all the excitement and challenge that normally occurs in an actual cross country race.

name: Bullshot
description:
BULLSHOT is a skill-action, fast-paced game.
In it, you spin the bull at your oppponents' matadors. You must knock them down, before yours get knocked down.
You can perform spins and tricks by applying different amounts of backspin and speed.
In the game you get a folding gameboard, and 9 matadors, along with the BullShot.

name: Rush
description:
RUSH is a game of the drug culture. The players each become a drug addict on the street. The goal is to reach nirvana without killing yourself. Needless to say this is not easy and dead players are eliminated from the game. Along the way you must support yourself [and your habit] any way you can.

Find the game here:
http://www.rich-and-sharon.org/al/rush.htm

name: Monster Madness Game
description:
From the back of the box:

How many monsters can you catch?

Set up the tiles, spin the spinner, move your monster marker, collect monster tiles - catch the most monsters to win.

Watch out for Monster Munch, or you'll be lunch!

15 - 30 minutes to play

Two ways to play for twice as much fun. Basic game or challenge game - either way, it's fun with Monster Madness!

A simple game children can play on their own.
- Teaches color recognition
- Helps children learn to count and see directional moves of play
- Little reading required to play
- Reinforces the lesson of taking turns

Ages 4 and up
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Samsara Tsemo
description:
A game developed by Buddhists to explain to young children the beliefs and ideas of karma and rebirth. The goal of each player is to (1) become a Bodhisattva and then (2) assist the other players and in doing so, become a Buddha. This is achieved through roll and move mechanics.

Contents of box: rules and explanation booklet, game-board, 1 dice, 5 player markers.

name: Vegas Vacation
description:
Vegas Vacation

(c)1992 Carousel Games

In this travel, gambling, and wagering game players move along a representation of the Vegas strip as they play Blackjack and Roulette.

Includes a colorful board, cards, play money, six plastic cars, dice, chips, rules, and a working Roulette wheel!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gladiators of Rome
description:
Gladiators of Rome is a simple solitaire game depicting gladiator fights in ancient Rome. You are the gladiator and the system controls your opponents. Rules, combat tables, gladiator counters and ratings are provided but you must supply two dice and scrap paper. The game is played without a map and the object is to reduce your opponents' endurance to zero or below before it happens to you.

Game published in Panzer Digest #4.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: QUEST for the Wish-fulfulling Gems
description:
The Wish-fulfilling game challenges you to pursue your own unique quests in life. As in life, it can be played on many levels. Fulfill your aspirations before your opponents do and win.

The general idea of the game is to see who plays his or her life the best. i the game you spend time--years of your life--in making your wishes come true. The wishes you spend time on give you points to keep track of who is ahead.

name: Up & add'em!
description:
Played on a 9x9 grid, each player has nine chips: each with a 2, 3 or 4 printed on it. They begin the game adjacent to the play area set in any order the player desires.

Players take turns moving one of their chips a number of spaces equal to the printed number -- turning as often as the player likes and even moving over other chips. The chips are never removed from the board, but they are swallowed by stacks. Stacks can be 2-4 chips high and the number on each chip must be equal to or greater than that on the chip below.

The game ends when all chips are in stacks and no more captures can be made. At this point, all stacks are taken by the player of the color of the top-most chip. All chips from stacks thus taken are then added up and the player with the highest total has won.

name: Liberty Island
description:
Liberty Island is all about the early days of the 20th century when people came from all lands, escaping turmoil and poverty,religious tyranny and governmental brutality. They came from all corners of the world past the Lady holding the torch of freedom to Ellis Island. People came to NYC forming segregated sections like Chinatown and Little Italy. As years passed and the country grew, the city became one and we all became Americans in the Land we call the Melting Pot.
Liberty Island is quite simple. A player chooses a ship and a bag of deeds naming them the nationality of their choice, like Irish or Italian. They must move these ships to obtain as many rows of city squares as possible(a row consists of 3 horizontal city squares). The nationality with the most rows(12 rows in all) at the end of the game wins.

name: Gulp 'n Giggle
