description: As players move around the board, they roll dice and move that number of spaces. They must then do what is indicated on the square(i.e. Red add a block and take a gulp, the red player must place a block onto the center of the board). The first player to stack all his blocks wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mardi Gras 3000
description:
Mardi Gras 3000 is a new CCG with a haunting atmosphere and lush, intelligent back story. Players strategically build a modular game board from randomly selected Terrain cards. Once the board is set, players move their customized character stacks to do battle, capture the Grail, and harness its power in a Cathedral.

Operating on the innovative Stacked system that allows players to build their characters from interchangeable, self-regulating, interactive cards, Mardi Gras 3000 has nearly endless variations in play; Neither the board nor the characters are ever the same. The cards have holes in them and when stacked, allow, or disallow abilities to be in play.

Players can choose to be a Terrapyre (children of fallen angels) or Celestial (four dimensional being) both fighting for the Holy Grail during the Neutral Hour on Earth.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board

name: Beigoma
description:
Beigoma is a very old Japanese game using metal spinning tops.

A playing surface is made by placing a sheet of canvas over a small barrel or bucket, or may be improvised using a large bowl or the rimmed bottom of a bucket. The tops are wound with a string and then launched into the play area. The winner is the player whose top forces the other top out of the playing area.

The game

Regional variants exist in other parts of Asia, notably Singapore and Korea.

(Cf. Spinjas, battletops)

name: Isla Chupita
description:
At the beginning of the game, take a pawn, 25 Chupitos and a token of each bar.

Launch the dice and move in the direction you want the number of boxes indicated by the dice trying to enter a bar.

If you go into a bar where you were not ever been:


Drink a drink
Discard the token of that bar
Draw a card from the deck Movida
Pay 5 Chupitos, unless you have cards (including the one just caught) that let you not to do so.


If you go into a bar where you were already been:


Drink a drink
Pay 5 Chupitos for consumption, unless you have cards that let you not to do so.


WARNING: Any time in the game are asked to "drink a drink", you must drink it REALLY!

The player who discards first his last bar token is the winner.

name: Robot vs Alien
description: Robot vs Alien is a rummy-style game where 2 players try to complete sets of either Robots or Aliens, depending on what they draw to start the game. Players alternate drawing cards but can only use the card if they can play it in order. A bomb card makes this much more difficult than it would first appear. A card game by comic zine maker Jim Coon.

name: NavTac 1914
description:
Detailed miniatures game of naval tactical (NavTac) game of ship vs ship combat in the first year of the Great War. Turns represent three to four minutes of real time, one inch represents 500 yards, and ships fire by individual main and secondary turret.

Published in Panzer Digest #4.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Rubberneckers Jr.
description: Remember those family road trips you took as a kid when old-fashioned game playing filled the long hours? The creators of the wildly successful Rubberneckers remember and have followed up with a smart new game designed specifically for the very youngest travelers. Players score points by spotting fun-to-find objects pictured on the cards and engaging passengers in other vehicles. With a combination of simple shapes, words and numbers, Rubberneckers Jr. is a terrific learning tool that will keep preschoolers engaged on car trips long and short.

name: Play & Learn Math Game: Shapes
description: The games comes with a board, a spinner and player counters. Players spin and then move their piece to the next object/picture that matches the shape (triangle, square, rectangle, circle) on the spinner.

name: Play & Learn Math Game: Number Recognition
description:
Contents: board, spinner, player counters

Players spin then move to the next numeral that matches the number of animals on the space of the spinner. Numerals 1-5. getting to the end of the board first is how to win.

name: Three Primary Math Games
description:
Three game box set

Sum Buddies-
Contents: Simple addition cards & six sided dice
Players roll a die and must find an addition problem where the number on the dice is the answer.

Time out-
Contents: Clock cards and time cards
Players flip over a time card and must find a matching clock face.

Minus Maze-
Contents: Board, dice, simple subtraction problem cards, player movement counters
Players roll and move around the board. Players must answer subtraction problems when they land on certain spaces.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Extreme Programming Playing Cards
description:
The game contains a deck of 100 cards. There are Problem, Solution, and Value cards. Oh, and a Joker card, of course. The intention of these cards is to help people to understand the methodology behind Extreme Programming and
improve the way they practice XP.

There are 4 game suggestions for this deck of cards on the publisher website:

Explanations: http://www.industriallogic.com/games/explanations.html

XP War: http://www.industriallogic.com/games/xpwar.html

Retrospective Roulette: http://www.industriallogic.com/games/roulette.html

Value Squares: http://www.industriallogic.com/games/valuesquares.html

More information about the game:

http://www.industriallogic.com/games/eppc.html

name: Jungle Skirmish
description:
“Two Player Board & Card Game of Modern Infantry Combat.” One player controls the Rebel Troops and the other player controls the Government Troops.

The game is played on a chessboard or any other 8x8 grid. Squares are marked for terrain type and three squares are marked as Objectives. Each player starts with six Squads which are represented by miniatures or counters.

A custom deck of cards is central to the play of the game. The players draw hands of cards from the common deck. Card play determines when units may move, attack, or use defensive fire.

The object of the game is to destroy or rout all enemy squads or to take and hold three Objectives.

name: Chicks Battle the Dudes Card Game
description:
A Face-Off to see which is the smarter sex!

Which has more "pull" - the women or the men? Chicks Battle the Dudes™ is an entertaining and fun party game that invites men and women to show off their smarts on sports, fashion, cooking and careers.

Women are asked questions that most men can answer, and the men are asked questions that most women can answer. But hilarity abounds when the gender gap shows its face.

To win, be the first player or team to answer consecutively four questions correctly.

Includes 144 questions.

For 2 or more players, Ages 12 and up.

name: Night of the Bloodsuckers 2nd Edition
description:
The Night of the Bloodsuckers 2nd Edition ‘Print and Play’ Game has improved graphics and new game mechanics; which include allowing players choose which of 2 locations they visit each turn!

“Players take on the role of a resident of Hope County, a small American community which is being terrorized by a deadly, blood sucking, Vampire.
They will visit various locations in the town collecting an array of items to aid their survival as they strive to avoid the head Vampire and still be alive when dawn comes!

Please note that you will need to provide 4 x 6 sided dice per player (Maximum of 20 dice)

name: Dice Horse Racing Game
description:
The aim of the game is to make the most money by betting on one of the horses that are racing.

Each horse is randomly assigned odds at the start and then each player may wager on any horse(not just the one that they will move). The odds of the horse dictate which dice are rolled for that horse's movement.

Landing on darker squares means that the horse must miss a turn. The first horse round the course is the winner and bets are paid out.

name: 10-4 Mr. Truck Driver
description:
10-4 Mr. Truck Driver -- The Truck Driving Game

"In dedication to the truck drivers of America"

(c)1991 Max Cohen

This unusual economics and transportation game is packaged in a long tube and features a huge 24" 36" laminated map of the USA. Players represent truck drivers as they move freight across the country. The first driver to own five trucks and have $10,000 in cash is the winner.

Includes the map, cards, play money, plastic tokens, labels, dice, and rules.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pumpkin Patch Phonics
description: Pumpkin Patch Phonics is a simple children's game that teaches players phonics. Players spin a spinner, and move their token to the nearest picture that starts with the letter that the spinner is pointing to. There are five special spaces on the board, where a player can slide up or down the track - similar to Chutes and Ladders. There is an alternative version included (the other side of the spinner) where players can use the ending sound of a word, rather than the starting sound.

name: Command Crew
description:
From the rules:

"Tonight's episode: With another dangerous voyage in front of them, the remaining starship officers fall back on their well-honed skills of treachery, sabotage and insubordination. Only one will emerge as captain, the one who can somehow get the other officers to follow orders."

The goal of the game is to get other players to carry out the missions you assign so that you accumulate 10 pips worth of missions completed. Missions are worth between 2 and 4 pips. Every other player can refuse, so you need to be able to convince them it's in their best interest. Thankfully, the missions are easy, but it requires someone to actually perform them.

Of course, if the missions don't get performed, things go wrong, terribly wrong ....

Winner of the 2003 PolyCon Independent Game Design Prize for best Board/Card Game.

name: Robot Siege
description: Reminiscent of Stratego, Robot Siege requires two players to secretly deploy their army of robots to battle. All robots in the game look the same, until they battle and their secret powers are revealed. The first player to destroy their opponent's "Master Power Source" is the winner!

name: Republic & Empire
description:
Subtitled: Rules for Miniatures Wargames of the 19th Century.

Appears to be self published, and is noted as a revision of the 1994 Cold Wars version.

The Introduction states: "These rules are intended to be used for any land conflict from the Napoleonic Wars through the Second Anglo-Boer War. Encompassing both colonial actions and conflicts between technologically advanced powers, they are intended for those who wish to recreate the lesser-known conflicts of the period, for which specifically tailored rules sets are often not available. They are designed as a framework that is easily modified to fit the specific situation being recreated. Alternately, these rules are good for those who wish to play battalion-level games that move quickly...Toward this end, any consistent basing system can be used, with the number of figures on a base left to the individual."

System focuses on fatigue instead of casualties as has measurements intended for 15mm games.

name: Fish Frenzy Toss
description: This game is for 2-4 players. Components include folding game board, and many different colorful fishes. The game board represents a body of water with a sleeping fisherman floating in his boat and several scoring zones worth differing amounts. The object is to toss or flick your fish to hit the highest scoring zones (or knock opponents fish off of them!) while avoiding the fisherman.

name: Dream World A Fantasy Game
description: This is a game for 2 to 4 players. The game includes 4 cardboard pawns representing cartoony little girls, a foldable gameboard, cards, and item tokens. The object of the game is to move your pawn around the board and collect the items (things little girls would want), by following card instructions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing

name: Grande Bataille, Grande Victoire
description:
Subtitle: European Land Warfare from 1853-1871

From the Introduction: "This rules set has been written for the wargamers who enjoy a good "afternoon match," and not for those who like to get "bogged down" in rules minutiae. This is not to say that the historical integrity of this era in warfare has been compromised, It has not."

The rules are designed for 15mm miniatures, but has general conversion notes for 5mm and 25mm. Turns equal 15 minutes of real time, with castings representing approx. 60 individual troops. Units are rated with Quality Points (QP) and have a typical number of castings (marked as lost as combat occurs). It has a basic "orders" system and units fatigue if given too many attack orders in a row. Unit types have a set number of performable functions in a turn for movement, formation changes and other actions.

The rulebook itself is 32 pages, including eight pages of general troop listings for the major conflicts of the period. There is also a four page discussion of unit organizations and tactics for the armies listed.

name: South Carolina 1788
description:
South Carolina 1788: The South Carolina History Game.

This educational trivia game is played on a long track shaped like the border of the U.S. state of South Carolina. The question and answer cards contain 500 different questions about the history of the state. Up to four may play. Produced shortly before the state's bicentennial.

Components include: game board, cards, four pawns, and instructions.

name: Bulls and Bears
description: Bulls and Bears is to stocks what Monopoly is to real estate, or so says the box. This game has the classic square Monopoly-like board with spinners in the center of the board that create the movement in stock prices. The game also includes an audio cassette with a rules explanation.

name: Mathfacts Game
description:
This is an older Milton Bradley title, cover art and MB logo appear to be from the 1970's. It's designed to help kids learn math through board gaming.

The box cover claims to be "Self Checking, Self Instructional"

Game includes game board and four pyramidal pawns.

name: Bomber Raid & Evade
description:
The Game is all about A Lancaster Bomber Raid, and evading the German Fighters in a WW2 setting. you record damage and fuel, and may also parachute if hit.

You will recognize straight away how it feels like a boardgame, and will be playing it within 2-5 mins.

The game is in Electronic form for downloading via the net, it can be resized or split to fit on A4 sheets of paper as its simple in principal.
The game is suitable for electronic play in Avalomhilly boardgame host and will probably easy be converted to Vassal and cyberboard.

name: Letter Recognition Game
description: Shaped bright-looking letters are matche to the corresponding self-correcting cut-outs. Designed for solitaire play or in competition for up to four children to get the most matched letters.

name: Animal Spelling Game
description: Charming animal drawings are put together and then matched to special die cut letter cards fitting into self-correcting slots to spell out their names. Designed for solitaire play or in competition for up to four children to get the most words. #603 in the series

name: Number Recognition Game
description: Colorful number cards 1-10 with matching concept cards and heavy plastic markers for sel-correcting games to learn numbers and counting. Designed for solitaire play or in competition for up to four children to get the most corectly matched numbers to concept.

name: Number Fishing Game
description: A set of colorful cut-out numbered fish with colorful matching cards. The Children fish for the right numbers and stock up their fish ponds (the matching cards). Essentially, it's like most fishing games except that you have toget the numbers on your pond card. First one to get the numbers on his or her card wins.

name: Find and Read Game
description: Action words are matched to illustrations of the things children do every day, giving exciting motivation for speaking and word recognition activities. OK, exciting is a bit of a stretch (just using Ed-U--Cards advert speak... :p). Essentially 1-4 children race to get more matches than the others; the one with the most matches wins.

name: Swing Swang
description: There is a ball on a string that you have to get into cups on the board, worth different points. The player holds one end of the string and swings the ball, then uses the string to attempt to get the ball to drop in the cup they want. The winner is the person with the most points.

name: Left & Right
description:
The gameboard is a circle divided into four areas. Each player has one area where he tries to achieve certain combinations of stones while avoiding others.
Each round you put two stones in your hand. Stones in your left hand will turn the gameboard (so you can "steal" areas from your opponent), stones on the right hand will be put on the board.

The title refers to the turning of the gameboard and the placing of the stones (dark stones always go on the left, light stones to the right side of the board)

name: Battle B-Dabeast
description: Test your B-Daman battle skills with this target game that's loaded with new gameplay and challenges. Just load the Iba Blaster and blast armor off the B-Dabeast with all the power you've got! Target challenge B-Dabeast figure comes with Iba Blaster and 3 B-Daballs for sharpening your skills prior to battle.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

name: Voodoo Party
description:
Players have to build a word chain, i.e. the next word has to start with the same letter that the previous word ended with. Exceptions: If the previous word ended with L or N, the player has to name certain "magical words".
If someone makes a mistake, they get a needle in their Voodoo doll and have to do some silly thing until the end of the game.
If a player makes too many mistakes, they are out.

name: World cup cricket
description:
In this all luck cricket game the pitch is represented by a 6 by 6 grid on which the fielder places his nine men. The bowler uses a spinner to determine the outcome of the bowl. If it's a hit further spins determine which square the ball lands in. Should there be a fielder in that square the batsman is out, otherwise the lower of the two numbers on the spinner is the number of runs scored. After each over the fielder can reposition his men.
Play continues until all eleven batsmen have been dismissed. Then the other team (player) have an innings. The winner is the player who scores most runs.

name: Mystic Master
description:
"Mystic Master -- an adventure for the mind"

Presented as a game, Mystic Master is pretty unusual for its time. Coming in on the fringe of the D&D explosion in the early 1980s. It's games like this that made some people take the magic use in D&D way too seriously.

From the tube:

"Mystic Master is a unique and enjoyable adventure designed by a research psychologist to test, challenge and help develop the fantastic powers of the mind. Join forces with Merlin in mastering mystical mental powers of ESP. It's fun and easy to play. The game comes complete with:

"A long-lasting, attractive, vinyl game board, 18 specially designed mystic image cards and easy-to-follow multiple game instructions."

No designer is actually credited in the rules or anywhere else. It also comes with two gold plastic tokens.

Movement is literally governed by guessing (erm, divining) what card(s) is being held up, is closest to the top of the deck, etc.

name: Gold Rush in a Tin
description:
This is a dice and chips game, where players roll two dice and attempt to place a majority of their chips in one of 12 spaces in four different colors for an area majority win.

Components are two six side dice, gameboard, chips, instructions, and game tin.

name: Naturquartett Wasser
description:
Naturquartett Wasser is a small collection of games by Haba. The cards are Wind- & Wetter-Karten; sturdy cards that you can clean when taken outside.

Components:

36 Cards
1 Wooden frog
12 Wassersteine (beads)
Rules

With this small package of components, you can play different games: Quartett (A Game of Authors), a Quartett variant, a Quartett variant for 2 players, a Charades / pantomime game. The rules also suggest to go outside with the cards and search for all the animals pictured on the cards. The number on the card shows how many points you earn for finding that animal. The more rare the animal, the more points you get.

Also in the rules: a few tips on other outdoor activities. Measure the depth and speed of water, make your own watermill, etc.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Environmental, Memory

name: Eurasia
description:
This two to six player game of the rise and decline of historical empires could be described as a cross between History of the World and Vinci with a little Britannia thrown in. While the participants play historical empires, the game does not recreate any particular history, hence allowing players to fully exercise strategic judgment.

Players control empires on a map of Eurasia, ranging from the earliest history to the Mongols. As time passes empires decline and finally disappear and new ones appear, but in the meantime receive new armies depending on terrain type and empire type (steppe, desert, agricultural). Empires have historical point centers, and also have historically-based special characteristics such as leaders, religious zeal, light cavalry, and cataphracts.

There are 80 empires, with optional rules for use of 30 event cards.

Depending on the number of players, their familiarity with the game, and the victory target selected, the game lasts 60-140 minutes.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Mel Allen's Baseball Game
description: This game uses an 33 LP recorded by New York Yankees announcer Mel Allen to determine the outcomes of baseball plays. Each side of the LP has seven tracks, for use in different game situations. Each track has four interleaved grooves announcing the resulting play, leading to different outcomes based on which groove happens to catch the phonograph needle. The back of the LP sleeve itself is used as a game board.

name: Trail of 98
description:
Trail 98: A Historical Card Game of the Klondike Gold Rush.

Half-a-dozen cards make up the playing board, and players use their cards (claims, goods, strike, hit, bonus, passage, provisions) to make their way from Seattle to Dawson and to lay down as many claims as possible. Player with the most claims wins. But you can put a hit card like Avalanche, to slow players down and it's likely you're run into a storm, sandbar, log jam or some other hit cards along the way.

From the instruction book: "Welcome to the Klondike gold Rush of 1898! This card game takes players up the scenic Inside Passage from Seattle through historic Skagway and along the rugged Chilkoot Trail to Dawson, where they work the gold fields. along the way, players encounter difficulties of the trail, as well as some bonuses..."
categories: American West, Card Game, Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Role Playing

name: Reed's Game of Base Ball
description: Reed's Game of Base Ball is a dexterity game where players use little wooden bats to whack a dowel seated in a groove on the edge of the game board. The space where the dowel comes to rest indicates which Baseball play has occurred.

name: Hardtack: American Civil War Rules
description:
From Wikipedia

Hardtack was the first U.S. published American Civil War rules set and had an early following. However, by the end of the decade, it had been supplanted by Scott Bowden's Stars and Bars and John Hill's Johnny Reb 3 and is rarely played at modern wargaming conventions. However, it is considered as groundbreaking, and ushered an era of Civil War miniature wargaming in the USA.

Introduction by Gary Gygax
Painting Guide by Don Lowry

Guidon Games Product # WM103

Preface:

This comprehensive set of rules is designed to take a person who has never played miniatures before thru several increasing stages of realism to the point where he can create for himself the kind of Civil War game which is most suited to his own personality. When you have read and played everything this booklet contains, you will be prepared to design a Civil War game which has all the simplicity necessary for a great game. The first version described is called the TRAINING GAME because it is designed to teach the basic mechanics of recreating Civil War battles with miniatures soldiers. When it can be played without referring back to the rules, learn the more realistic BASIC GAME.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Conhecendo a B鱈blia
description: Players travel around the board answering questions about the bible. The first player to reach the finish line is the winner.

name: Personnages Historiques a Reconstituer
description:
This French-language educational game consists of 16 sets of 3 tiles each depicting important French leaders from Vercingetorix to Napoleon III. Each set of tiles displays the head (plus name and birth and death dates), torso, and legs of the leader in question. All three cards are marked with the same identifying number (1-16). The game also comes with a 4-page biographical survey of the depicted leaders.

For the under-6's, the game is simply one of putting the tiles together to form the leaders. In the solitaire version, the child attempts to correctly construct all 16 figures. In the two-player version, children flip tiles one at a time by turn, trying to build the leaders. The child with the most complete leaders wins.

The game for 6-and-overs plays with a simple Go-Fish mechanic where 2-3 players take turns trying to reconstruct the famous leaders of French history by asking each other for specific body parts and pulling from the draw pile if they don't get them. Again, the winner is the player who has reconstituted the most historical personages before the draw pile is gone and someone has run out of tiles.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Die kleine Spielerei
description:
'Little Game'

All players are editors of the Spielerei German Games magazine and they all want to show their 5 latest reviews to the chief editor. But only the only review that will be printed is the one that is shown first to the chief editor.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Nicke & Nilla: Spel & bus p奪 vinden
description: The goal of the game is to collect "Nicke & Nilla" tokens. You gain tokens by following instructions from the cards, as well as challenge and win tokens from your fellow players.

name: Shenanigans Dice Games
description: This set includes three types of dice: 5 poker dice, 5 regular dice, and a die showing various parts of the body. Also in the package is a dice cup and a hardcover book that describes proper dice rolling etiquette, the distribution of outcomes (bell curve), and rules for 19 games many of which include a variation using the die with the body parts.

name: Diamond Dynasty
description: Diamond Dynasty includes two Gold Decks of Domino 32 cards, two Silver Decks of Domino 32 cards, a set of Play Money (80 pieces, 8 denominations), the Domino 32 Card Games booklet which includes the rules for 9 games, printed out rules for the games Twister: Dragon Dances and Diamond Dynasty along wit ha set of scoring sheets.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: muistiepeli
description:
Muistiepeli is a memory game for Ages 6 - 10. It helps to learn also the basic childrens' rights listed by the United Nations. To aid with the learning, this game also has pictures and poems.

As in the basic memory game you try to find matching pairs. However in this game the pictures are different and the poems continue in the pairs.

The game includes two sets of rules. First is for the small children the second set is for the little older children.

name: Star Wars Clone Wars: Sith gegen Jedi
description:
The republic is full of conflicts. One solar system after the other is turns into a battle field. In this card game you assume the role of a warrior in the star wars universe trying to survive by using your skills and a little bit of luck.

Box content:

99 cards in six colors
18 planet cards in six colors
6 Coruscant-cards in 6 colors
6 stand-up characters (cardboard)

name: The hand that feeds, the hand that beats
description:
The Hand That Feeds, The Hand That Beats.

Gods want power
... they'll do whatever it takes to get it...

In a world of faith, or better: a world of faiths, different followers worship different Gods.
The more faith and followers, the stronger a God is.
So they play their game of power and strength and sometimes just use the followers as playing pieces...

In The Hand that FEEDS, the Hand that BEATS, players represent a God and His followers. The priest of your faith
may call a creature that scoops up the whole village and moves them around the board. The followers can then be used
to acquire resources with which they build obilisks or the temple or a part of one of the Gods' wonders: The Great Canal, The pyramid or the Mighty Colossus.

Three conditions trigger the game end:
1] If all three of the Gods' wonders are finished at the end of a round, the game ends.
2] If the creature-deck runs out, the round is played to the end, after which the game ends.
3] After ten rounds, the game ends.

Players try to score the most victory points (VPs).

If they build or convert obelisks or the temple they immediately score VPs.
If they build parts of the Gods' wonders, they can score VPs every round.
If they control the obelisk in the oasis, they score VPs if other players use the oasis.
Some of the actions, miracles and disasters will earn a player VPs.
Lastly, and most importantly, the most popular faith will be elected to feed all the players and receives VPs equal to the popularity of the faith.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: BlockBoomer
description:
This game have been created by two people who have time to waste on school day. A game which just needs : A pencil, a piece of sheet grid, a Friend and your Brains. Cause it's a strategic game, where you need to fight and conquer territory, by strangle your enemy in a prison of holes. Ok. Now here is the rule.

As told above, the only things you need, is Pencil and Sheet grid, That's right, no eraser just that. Its a game which is simple to do, to play, and to explain. Just few rules to understand and you can play.

What about the story ? Imagine that you are in a limited zone, with a chosen draw as player. You move and shoot each turn. When you move, you blacken your old player and place a new one at movement range. When you shoot, you blacken the place you shot from which is in Attack Range. A place which is Blackened cannot be passed through and is considered as an empty box. When the players ( all players ) aren't connected ( divided by empty boxes. ) The game ends, and the winner is the player with the most space. This game maybe looks boring but it isn't! Try it, its cost you nothing.

A lot of variants can be made, from the mines to Multiplication Artifact and Invisible Shield. Same for the Mod, Capture Flag, Zombie mod, Team, Werewolf. Infinite possibilities.

name: Inside Track
description:
From the rule book cover:

"EDUCATIONAL
Learn business terms and practices...
stock market, high finance, bartering...
Become wiser by trading and manipulating...
A game of skill combined with chance...

ENTERTAINING
Interesting to young and old...
Delightfully amusing...
Every game different...
One throw of the dice and you may "gain" a hotel or "lose" your shirt...
but one thing is sure that everyone will enjoy the game..."

Inside Track is a for 3-6 players based on business principles of purchasing, leasing, and bartering. Play progresses with players taking leases on different businesses, each with different income properties. Play continues, until all but two players are bankrupt. At that time players have a final audit of the last two players to determine the winner. The object of the game is to accumulate the greatest wealth (leased property and money) at the final audit.
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Mascate
description:
Mascate was a non collectible cardgame about commerce in Colonial Brasil (Circa XVII, XVIII centuries). The player was a Mascate ( a kind of Trader in Brasil), and he travels at the principal cities in Colonial Brasil transporting cargo and goods. The games was designed for solitaire mode and four players.

Game Art by brazilian artist José Augusto Praguer


Mascate é um jogo de cartas não colecionável que retrata o comércio no Brasil Colonial. Os jogadores são Mascates, onde através de viagens passam por perigos e aventuras, desbravando o território Brasileiro, em busca de fama e riqueza. O jogo pode ser jogado de 1 a 4 jogadores a partir de 10 anos e tem como objetivo desenvolver a estratégia, além do gosto pela história nacional. O Jogo tem duração média de 60 minutos e pode ser jogado por toda a família !

Arte do Jogo pelo Artista José Augusto Praguer

name: Nova Race
description: A racing game aimed at younger children, NOVA RACE has elements of classic games such as Chutes and Ladders, The Game of Goose and Sorry to name a few. It has a space theme in which each player represents a different company racing to be the first to reach the Nova. Simple roll and move mechanics move the player along, while various spaces on the board have differing symbols which represent a specific action. A guide is included to explain the meaning of each symbol. As in life, the players will encounter events which both help and hinder their race to the nova. Suggested Ages 5 and up. Suggested number of players is 2 to 4. Estimated playing time is 20 to 30 minutes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Huizenjacht
description:
On a piece of land players have to construct houses and renovate them to villa's, with unexpected events obstruct or stimulate these actions. Use your cards well, place your houses tactical, negotiate smartly and create a dream villa from your house.

The player who obtains 12 points first is the winner.

Contents of the box:
• The gameboard
• 24 wooden houses
• 55 building cards
• 57 "voor- en tegenspoed" cards
• 4 evidence cards
• 40 banknotes
• 1 color dice
• 4 overview cards
• Rules

name: Tiger Woods PGA Tour DVD Family Game
description: Game allows players to play on two PGA Tour courses, St. Andrews (Scotland's home of golf) or TPC Sawgrass (Florida) with its famous island green. Players can choose from Tiger Woods, John Daly, Colin Montgomerie, and Jim Furyk each with different abilities. See what happens on the DVD, then decide what you would do! Play solo or with up to three other players. Game includes double sided game board representing the two courses and comes packaged in a nice wooden bookshelf game box.

name: Jewels For His Crown
description:
The object of game play is to collect all 8 jewels for your crown.

Play begins with players placing their gemstone on the "birth", and then taking turns rolling dice and moving clockwise. A card is read from one of four decks: Chakra, Life, Angel, or Block. Following the instructions on the card, halos are collected (or sometimes forfeited) and stored on the player's pewter angel. Seven halos may be exchanged for one jewel. The first person to earn all their 8 jewels is the winner, however players may choose to continue until everyone achieves enlightenment.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Durch Th端ringen!
description:
Durch Thüringen! (Through Thuringia!) is a family game of the 1930s, one of the large number of roll-and-and move educational games where the players, in the course of the game, learn something about the region they travel in. As usual in such games, special field give advantages or penalties if players land on them.
The game was published by the Hausser Verlag who published a long line of family games, books and the famous Elastolin miniatures from 1904 until they folded up in the 1983.

name: SealHunters
description:
A fantasy card-game by the Italian producer Serfer Games. Players organize a team of magic-users and battle in order to gain magic seals. The battle mechanism includes both card management and dice rolling.

The game box contains:
84 playing cards
4 Player sheets
2 Dices
4 Pawns
1 Rulebook

Rules in Italian/English
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Ideograph
description:
Ideograph is a party game about ideographic / pictographic association. Players create meanings for combinations of symbols (graphemes) based on associations of the (combined) meanings of those symbols. The player that comes up with the best / most creative / most humorous / most plausible explanation of the meaning of a combination of symbols wins that round. This is decided by means of voting. Hence, whether plausibility or humor is prioritized depends on the players and the situation.

The game is based loosely on the structure of Chinese characters. The selection of symbols (card/graphemes) in the game is based partly on frequently occurring 'radicals' and other graphemes in Chinese characters, but also on Anna Wierzbicka’s theory of semantic primes (natural semantic metalanguage).
The shapes of the symbols are for the most part completely unrelated to those found in Chinese characters. Ideograph is not intended to be an educational game or to be helpful in learning Chinese characters. It is merely intended to be fun (within the right context), although playing with language in this way might be a rather geeky type of fun.

name: Mechabots
description:
The concept behind this game is the construction of warrior robots that fight each other. It all hinges on compromise in design - players get to rebuild Bots during the game and need to decide between how much damage they can do vs the range of the weapon, or how much armour it has vs how easily it is destroyed. All based on placing counters on one or more chassis cards which also act as hit charts. Hexmap based.

Object of the Game

Destroy all other Mad Scientists or their creations in order to dominate the city.

Available on the author's website here-
http://www.curufea.com/Wikka/wikka.php?wakka=MechaBots
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Pike Attack
description:
It was another fishing game, `Pike Attack' which was the the most promising new game on display at the "Death Row" at the London Toys Fair of 1994.
The aim of Pike Attack is to collect and keep a full set of five fishing tackle cards, which are laid face up on the board.
A full set of tackle allows a player to fish, with the object of landing the heaviest catch. If the player holds a bite card, then the player is able to take a fish card. If the player's tackle matches the ratings for both line and hook, as shown on the fish card, then the player lands the fish.
However, if only one of the ratings match, the player must throw the `fight dice'. The throw determines whether the fish is caught, gets away, or whether a penalty is suffered, such as loosing your hook or breaking your line.

Lurking amongst the normal fish is the Pike. If a player draws the pike card then it is possible to catch the pike if a Pike Buster card is held, otherwise you are likely to lose either part of your tackle or part of your previous catch.

The game has been sponsored by Shimano, a fishing tackle company, but the inclusion of their logo in the computer generated graphics is very discrete and does not distract from the appearance.

Very appealing game components make a good and light family game.

name: Dexter: The Official Board Game
description:
From the Manufacturer
Based on the critically-acclaimed television series from Showtime Networks. There is a horrific serial killer on the loose and the only way you can track this person down is by using your detective skills, gut instinct and gather as much evidence as possible. With the help of Dexter Morgan, Blood Spatter Analyst, who has a 'knack' of finding out exactly how a victim has suffered, you and your team at Miami-Metro PD go on a desperate crusade to track down the killer before another falls victim to it's evil ways. Will you catch the killer before Dexter does?

This was originally slated for release in 2009, but as of fall 2010 there was no news on it.

name: Fluency River
description:
Fluency River is a tool for professionals in the field of Speech-Language Pathology that can be used to help children with stuttering issues. From the publisher's website:

Fluency River™ is a fluency game that uses a river and its components to help students ages 5–9 learn about stuttering and become more fluent speakers. The goal of the game is for students to become comfortable with their speech and gain confidence by using fluency strategies to continually improve their speech. Up to eight players may play at a time. Fluency River™ will make an exciting and challenging supplement to your fluency therapy programs, kits, and guides.

name: Fuball f端r alle!!!
description:
A very simple soccer simulation with very few tactical options and a big chance factor. The rules barely fill one A4 (letter) size page and are printed on the back of the box; they are also not very clear about what happens when.
The teams have men of variable ability, which expresses itself in the number of squares they may move. Extra die rolls give free kicks and throw-ins to the teams and may, in case of repeated offence (=bad die-rolling) lead to a player getting the red card.
publishers: SVB D. Fr旦hlich & D. Breuer GbR, berlin

name: Bead Trade Game
description:
It's a bingo game with a beading theme. It is designed to be played at a beading party where the participants bring their unwanted AND valued beads and play the board game in which they wagering with their beads. Will you walk away with more beads that you started with or lose them all?

Contents:
6 Game Boards
89 Yellow Bead Terminology Disks
Pot Disk
300 Green Marker Disks
1 Bead Bag
1 Tracking Board

name: Heart 2 Heart
description:
From the back of the box:

The game of self discovery!

Great teamwork is what it takes to win Heart 2 Heart.
How well do you know your friends?
How well do you know yourself?

Answer the questions to move your team across the board and win the game.

name: Glory!
description:
Take command of a brigade and ride to Glory! in this new miniatures game from Grognard games. Players are Brigadiers, commanding a Brigade of troops.

Played with 28mm figures (1 figure=30 soldiers), each base is roughly a company, the manuever element a battallion.

This 'fast play' Napoleonic combines the classics of "Column/Line/Square" tactics with a realistic but very playable game that can be played with your friends in under 4 hours.

In addition, this game system is supported by the Glory! Napoleonics line of Pre Painted 28mm Napoleonic Figures from Grognard Games. Available now are French Line Infantry, with more figures to come.

name: Mensch Freue Dich
description: Up to four players put in their playing pieces, trying to complete different patterns unique to each player (and exchanged in subsequent rounds).

name: Alte und neue Erz辰hlkunst
description: Players roll dice to determine categories, phrases, words, starting letters etc., and then tell stories making use of these.

name: The King Khan & BBQ Game
description:
It probably has been many years since you could buy a 12" vinyl record and get a game with it, but with the 2008 reissue of rock and roll band the King Khan & BBQ Show's début album, you get a free game called 'the King Khan & BBQ Game'. The board and rules come inside the gatefold LP, and there is a sheet with 'Diary Cards' and 'Dream Cards', that you can cut out if you're that kind of person.

The game states that the object of the game is 'To make all your dreams come true by collecting the most hours spent out on dates in a week'. The game is roll and move, and on the board there are spaces where you can end up on a date, stood up or get a 'Dutch Treat'.

Components required to play that do not come with the game: dice, playing piece, poker chips in 4 different colours

name: Super Sandwich
description:
From the rules:

The object of the game is to concoct the "super sandwich." This is a sandwich comprised of any assortment of foods which will provide the RDA of protein, calcium, iron, vitamin A, vitamin B-complex and vitamin C, and still not contain calories in excess of the recommended allowance. Players purchase foods and record the content of each of these nutrients. The first player to accumulate the RDA in each nutrient while remaining within the allowable calorie intake, makes the "super sandwich" and wins the game.

name: My Mother sent me to the Grocery Store
description: In this game, players take turns reading the big card in front of them ("My mother sent me to the grocery store to get...") and then drawing a slip from the pile in the center of the table. If the object drawn would be available at the location read, they keep the slip. Play continues around until every player has drawn for one location, and then a new location is pulled. Once all the big cards have been used, the player with the most slips wins the game.

name: Zulu War Game
description:
From the tube:

"The Zulu War Game is similar to a european game called Nine-Men's Morris. It is thought that european missionaries introduced the game in Africa hundreds of years ago. Then the game evolved into a more complex and challenging game, called Mlaba-Laba, or the Zulu War Game."

The object of the game is to move and arrange your "stones" on the board to capture your opponent's "stones", the winner is the player who has captured all of his opponent's stones.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Myndaatlasspili丹
description: This game is both a puzzle and a trivia game. Players try to place their puzzle pieces and after a successful placing they get a question. The current player can continue placing puzzle pieces as long as he answers correctly. A simple scoring track is on the edge of the board, each correct answer gives you a pin to place in a hole in the board for tracking your points.

name: The Pride of Pasadena
description:
From the rules:

"The idea for The Pride of Pasadena was conceived by the Adult Vocational Staff at Villa Esperanza to provide work for the developmentally handicapped adults in their workshop. As the idea developed and solidified many staff and board members contributed to its final format and design. The game pieces were painted and packaged by workshop clients. With training and supervision, they also collated and packaged the Landmark Cards, Investment Cards, and money. The final product was then assembled and put through a shrink wrap machine. It is the hope of Villa Esperanza that "The Pride of Pasadena" will provide ongoing and meaningful work for the handicapped adults, along with representing our city in an entertaining and aesthetic way. We at Villa Esperanza are proud of Pasadena and our contribution to the city.

Object: The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player through purchasing the controlling interest in cultural and historical landmarks of Pasadena."

Not from the rules:

A monopoly variant.

name: Travel Time
description: The object of the game is to locate objects that correspond to one of the illustrations on the picture playing cards, and to discard your cards one at a time before the sand runs through the timer. The first player to discard all their cards is the winner.

name: The Sleeping Beauty Game
description:
The Sleeping Beauty Game

(c)1990 University Games

Designed for Ages 3 - 8 with no reading required.

Players rescue Sleeping Beauty by traveling through the forest and climbing the castle walls. Movement is determined by a spinner. Cards allow players to use special abilities.

Includes a colorful board, 4 tokens, cards, the spinner, and instructions.

name: Popular Game of Golf
description: This game also known as PARLOR GOLF comes from Parker Brothers and has a copyright date of 1896. The game is played somewhat similarly to Tiddly Winks. The game uses clubs instead of the large Tiddly Winks disks. The game comes with 6 clubs and a two Tiddly Winks balls

name: Gods: A Game of Righteous Smiting
description: Gods - A Game of Righteous Smiting is a fast playing "take that" card game. The players take the roles of gods trying to win followers by smiting tribes with horrible plagues and thus scoring points. Because carrots may be nice, but when it comes to religion, sticks – and the occasional flood or swarm of locusts – are even better. Each player has a collection of tribes they try to smite and make more devout by playing "plague cards" on them. But since you can also smite your opponents tribes, you have to be careful. If they suffer too much your tribes will turn against you and score no points.

name: GROG
description:
Welcome to the realm of GROG, the ULTIMATE Drinking Card Game!!! It is not a game for the conservative or squeamish and is not advised unless you are up for a game which may cause extreme inebriation and one's consequent actions we know so well so BE WARNED!!!

The game comprises 52 cards - 13 sets of 4 identical cards with specific drinking related actions attributed to each of the 13 different cards.

The 52 cards are placed face down, chandelier-style around an empty glass. The players then place themselves around the table with their preferred drinks. The game ensues in a clockwise direction with each person in turn flipping a card onto the table for all to see and responding to the action on the underside of the card. But beware, the rest of the players must all be attentive as there are 'reaction' cards like the 'HIJACK' card which requires every player to respond to the card as soon as possible.

There is no winner to the game, only one poor unfortunate sod, who will have the misfortune of flipping the fourth and final GROG card. As the game progresses, every time one of these cards are flipped, the 'flipper' will pour a tot of his/her beverage into the glass in the middle of the table. So by the time the fourth GROG card is flipped, there should be an alcoholic concoction of at least 3 tots of whatever the respective GROG flippers' beverages were. The fourth GROG flipper (the loser) must then pour a tot of their beverage into the glass and down it (OUCH!!!) That terminates the game and you may then gather all the cards together and play again until you have had enough... (or fallen down)

name: Play Safe
description: Play Safe is a game where players roll dice and pay fares in an attempt to move their pedestrians and cars around the board safely. Hazards include jaywalking, being hit by trains, etc.

name: Mind Ice
description:
From the box "The fine dice game in the blue box".

Contains 5 x 20 sided blue dice, dice bag, dice shaker, two score pads, 2 pencils, rules.

The idea is like a super Yahtzee, but not only do you make sequences but you can also make equations using addition or subtraction (for a couple of points), multiplication or division (for more points) or power/exponent or root equations (for even more points).

name: Vices & Virtues
description:
Souls are lost or saved a little every day with each choice a person makes. Behind those choices are little Angels & Devils whispering influences of the 7 Vices & Virtues.

Vices & Virtues is a trick taking game with a twist.

In addition to winning a trick, you also win a Human with an Ability you can use later.

Each card also has a good side and an evil side to it. So, your choices determine whether the Humans you capture will be Good or Evil.

This game is free for download.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/s2egtinn66w9o4n/Vices%26Virtues.zi...

name: Endspiel: Eine deutsche Apokalypse
description:
Designed and promoted in 1979 or shortly after by "Glatteis", a German satirical magazine (motto: "The absurd is the reality"), this is a simple roll-and-move game which is a "satirical, partly realistic mirror of our real life" (from the introductory text). Players start in a randomly determined town and race to complete a circuit through the other five towns on the very abstract map of Germany. Players can choose between a "career path" and an "alternative path" for their trip. Special fields may force a change of path, and players may influence the game by placing bridges and barricades.
One of the crude attempt at humorous games that were typical of the time, but this one is extremely simplistic and offers next to no gaming fun.

name: SoapBox
description:
The Soap Opera in a Box

Become the director of a cheesy soap opera, moving the characters around the board to arrange meetings where, regardless of what happens to them, ratings improve.

Move to Soapbox Ratings to interfere with the other players' plans, but keep your characters out of Court or Jail, the Hospital or Asylum -- each of those places has its own risks of axing the character from the show or sending them into limbo, never to be referenced again! Characters have trysts, get married, become pregnant... not necessarily in that order. Will the young mother have a high-ratings birth or meet an untimely and unlikely end? Will there be a ratings-grabbing wedding or a spectacular and far-fetched catastrophe?

Includes both Basic and Advanced rules.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trias
description:
This memory game was designed after a 19th century game idea an is recommended for ages 6 and above. You get 20 circular discs in a tin (like a traditional shoeshine tin, see image gallery); each disc shows a black-and-white picture and is sliced into three sectors. Three very similar game variants are described in the small rule leaflet: Free for all, team play, group play. In all variants, the disc sectors are mixed and placed on the table face down. Now players openly look at some pieces (3 per player in free for all, 2 per partner in team play); if the pieces match, i.e. show a complete picture, the player/team may keep them, otherwise they are turned face-down again and play passes to the next player (in traditional "Memory" fashion). At game end, each complete picture disc scores one point.
The pictures come in 5 groups of 4 discs each: Symbols (zodiacs, wiring schema, sports, signals), Fonts (musical notes, handwriting, typewriter, Japanese), Small Things (buttons, paperclips, matches, tacks), Structures (millimeter grid paper, wood, knitting, honeycomb), Currency (coins, bills, stamps, cheques). A rule "for experienced players" recommends to award extra points if more than one picture of the same group has been collected.

name: Pixie Pairs Card Game
description:
This "Go Fish" variant was distributed exclusively at Best Buy stores as a promotional item with the purchase of Disney's "Tinker Bell" DVD.

The main differences between this game and traditional "Go Fish" are the number of cards in the deck and the goal of collecting pairs instead of books of 4 cards.

The 36 cards in the game are made up of 4 cards each of 9 of the Disney Fairies that appear in the Tinker Bell movie.

In a 2-player game each player is dealt 7 cards to start with. If there are 3 or 4 players, each player is dealt 5 cards.

On a player's turn, another player is asked for one of the fairies in the asking player's hand. If the asked player has that fairy, one card of that fairy is given to the asking player, who then puts the pair in front of them and continues their turn by asking another player for another fairy. If the asking player does not get a fairy from an opponent they draw from the deck. If they get the fairy they had asked for, they place the pair in front of them and continue their turn. If not, then the turn passes to the left.

The game ends when the draw deck is exhausted and at least one player is out of cards. Whoever has the most pairs wins.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kotu-baendum
description:
From wikimanqala:

http://www.wikimanqala.org/wiki/Kotu-baendum

Kotu-baendum ("tying up the enclosures") is played in Sri Lanka. The game was first described by Henry Parker in 1909. It is almost exclusively played by women, especially at the season of New Year. An average game takes about 30 moves.

Rules:

The board called olinda-poruwa has 14 holes (wala) arranged in two rows (pila). Between them are two rectangular hollows serving as stores for the captures.
Initially there are four seeds (indiya, pl. indi) in each hole, usually from the Olinda creeper (Abrus precatorius).

On his turn a player sows (ihinawa) the contents of one of his holes one by one into the following holes. The direction of play (clockwise or anti-clockwise) is decided by the first player and then adhered to throughout the game by both players.
The first turn of the game must be commenced from one of the two end holes.
A seed may not be placed into a hole containing three seeds except it is the last one sown.
If the last seed falls into a non-empty hole (any number but three) its contents are picked up and distributed in another lap.
If the last seed is dropped into a hole containing three seeds, its contents including the last seed sown are "eaten" (innawa) and the turn ends. The captures are collected in the store.
If the contents of an end hole are captured, this hole is said to be "tied" (baenda). A baenda is owned by the player who effected the capture. A move or lap cannot start from a tied hole. When a player sows his last seed into a baenda, his turn ends and the player "sits down". Any seeds sown into a tied hole are owned by the player who made the baenda.
The game is finished when a player has nothing to move with at the start of his turn. The remaining seeds that are not yet captured or trapped in a baenda are won by the player who could move last.
The game is won by the player who won most seeds. "

name: The Modern Orchestra Game
description: This is a turn of the century card game. There are 24 cards that show different types of orchestra instruments. Wood Wind, Brass, Percussion and Strings are included. Object of the game is to answer musical questions posed on each of the cards.

name: Freddy Frog
description: This game was published by Milton Bradley in 1910. This game comes with a spinner and 4 wooden markers. Game instructions are printed on inside of lid, and the gameboard is on inside of box. The object of the game is to jump the Frogs from the shore, across the lily pads to the Sunshine Log at the opposite end of the board.

name: G4
description:
An educational game to be used in a classroom environment, published in Flanders. The aim is to learn about city government and local politics.
A cityscape is built up out of roads and buildings. The buildings are sheets of thick paper that are placed upright with plastic stands.
Pupils are members of the city council, representing one of four parties. They must gain votes (represented by meeples) by answering questions on politics in Flanders, and by having their party projects accepted by a council majority.

name: The Magro Game
description: From the box "The International shipping game for 3 to 6 players. You win The Magro Game by becoming the wealthiest shipowner afloat. Which is far from easy. To prosper in this game you'll have to be successful at outbidding your opponents for the most lucrative cargoes, quick at working out the most profitable routes, and adroit at running your fleet in the most efficient way. None of which is very far removed from the real thing. But then, that's what The Magro Game is all about."

name: Gold Rush The Prospectors Game
description:
This is a very simple game in which the players take turns spinning a 6-sided teetotum, each spin determining the distribution of the 10 "gold nuggets" that come with the game.

The contents of the game are the metal teetotum, nuggets, rulebook with a very short history of the California gold rush, and a canvas pouch to hold it all.

Teetotum has sides T1, T2, TA, P1, P2 and PA.

name: Kumbuka
description:
Kumbuka is a collection of different games using the tile set in different ways. The games are mostly for young children and encourage thinking and memory skills.

The games are; Pairs, Guess The Animal, Animal Caravan, Animal Party.

The fantastic art on the tiles is derived from the work of Edward Saidi Tingatinga, who drew his inspiration from the local cave art in Tanzania. Helvetas is a Swiss charitable group that supports artists in a workshop in Dar im Salaam producing Tingtinga work.
publishers: Helvetas, Murmel Spielwerkstatt und Verlag AG

name: "Canberra visitor" a game about our National Capital
description:
"Canberra visitor" The Capital board game

This game is intended to provide an enjoyable and stimulating way of learning about Australia's National Capital. It is also an effective medium for teaching, learning and practising a range of skills.

The board is based on a scale map of the city showing its geographical features, the major road system and the location of 40 places of interest.

Players move tokens along a road system, determining their rate of progress by trying to avoid strategically placed penalty spots and chance spots.

Sketches and detailed information of the 40 places are given on large playing cards and players are exposed to daily life situations in the capital through the use of chance cards.

Detailed instructions for 4 games, each of increasing complexity are clearly presented in a small booklet.

name: Blotto
description:
From the game tube:

Blotto is a Party Game
Play it with as many people as can fit around the giant Vinyl Board.

Blotto is a Drinking Game
You drink is used as he actual playing piece.

Blotto is a Fast Moving Strategy Game
Quick to learn with noise-makers provided to hurry slowpokes.

Blotto is a Party Starter."

Think of Quoridor played with drinks? You are trying to move your drink to the temperance zone, last one to make it there has to drink. You have Blocks you can put up to slow your opponents down.

name: Lion Country
description: Lion Country is a Monopoly-esque game produced as a fundraiser for the Centre County Medical Society Auxiliary in 1983 by CPM Associates. In this game, you acquire and expand franchises. It uses the typical roll & move mechanic of Monopoly, but rather than buying groups of properties, you can expand almost any property by purchasing franchise discs thus expanding it. It has a single chance-like card deck. It is called Lion Country after Penn State's mascot.

name: Jeu des boucles
description:
A set of 36 cardboard tiles featuring numerous paths on each, and 4 borders with ending loops.

Up to 6 players compete to build the largest loop.

The rules are close to Tantrix, but the tiles are identical to those found in the recent game Tsuro.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Give and Take
description:
From the designer:

"Give and Take is a board game one can learn in a few minutes, although mastering it may take a little longer... like a lifetime.

Simplicity and elegance with diabolical plotting and incredible depth of thought make this game worth trying.

This may be the only board game one may win even when trailing way behind.

A combination of chess, checkers and backgammon principles with a unique way of sacrificing pieces for position, Give and Take is destined to withstand the test of time."

Players start with sixteen pieces that can move one space forward or to the side, but never backwards. Pieces are captured by jumping and if a piece can capture another, it must (like ZERTZ).

If a piece advances to the opponent's edge of the board, it becomes a King and can now move any number of spaces in a single orthagonal direction. Also, if a player only has one piece remaining, that piece automatically becomes a king.

The winner is the player who captures all of his/her opponent's pieces.

name: V辰rldsrekord
description: An old game about athletics where the placers compete with eachother in up to 16 different sports, such as e.g. highjumping, racing, javelin and high jump.

name: Song of the Dwarf Lords
description: Players represent Dwarven nobles. Each turn you will attempt to win honor by giving the most money in the Contest of Gifts. The winner of the Contest also gets first pick of the opportunities available for that year; lands that can increase your wealth, magical items, buildings and quests. You must manage your gold carefully and evaluate the relative value of the opportunities based on the stage of the game and what you and your opponents have already developed.

name: Match 'N Stack Race Game
description:
From the Box:

- Exciting three dimensional board game features molded plastic tiles with simple words and pictures.

- Great action as players "Match and Stack" word tiles on their own section of the board.

- Kids learn word, letters, objects, and test their memories all while having a good time!

name: Ground Zero
description:
From the website:

"The Game that allows you to sense the hypocrisy of the New York Politician or the embrace what it means to stare treachery and adversity head on as a Rescue Worker. With the roll of each dice sense the tenacity of a First Responder, even while being used as a political pawn."

name: The Sword in the Stone Game
description:
A childrens game designed by the Walt Disney corporation published by Whitman based on the Disney story of the Sword in the stone. The gameboard has a disc under the play area that can be moved with the finger so that the colors on the paths on the board change.Movement is done by s spinner. The object of the game is to pick up a sugar bowl,a squirrel, a bird and a fish in different areas of the play board. Then race toward the sword and when you pick that up you are the winner.
When you land on a red dot(the position of the dots change by turning the disc under the play field you have to spin the location spinner and you are send to that location....

name: Poltergeist
description: A non-player hides little playing pieces in stacks of two hollow cubes. Children pick up stacks and shake them to find the playing pieces. Whoever finds most is the winner.

name: Fughedaboudit!
description: This is a trivia game about organized crime, particular that which showed up on TV and in the movies. It later got some revamped rules (clarifications) and became Godfathers & Goodfellas - The Organized Crime Trivia Game. This game is much cheesier in appearance in a plane cardboard box with a crime boss mug printed on the front.

name: Stop-Over Berlin
description:
This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Berlin-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Eastern Panzer II
description:
Eastern Panzer II is a turn-based tactical level wargame, set during 1943 to 1945 at the Eastern Front.

In Eastern Panzer II, players take command of their army and attempt to crush any opposition.

The game features simple rules, many types of units, is very compact, is fun, and most importantly, is free!

Eastern Panzer II will have updates and expansions, often with advanced rules and new units for the game.

Credits:
Counter art: A.Tan
Unit pictures: Dirk Schoenberger, Matt Fritz and Jon Oldham (www.juniorgeneral.org)
Rules and Instructions: A.Tan
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: The New Zoo Revue
description:
Billed as "the fun game that lets you explore your feelings & values", this TV show-inspired game seems to be in keeping with its Ungame ancestry. The goal of the game is nominally to collect a set of cards which match your "Winning Ticket", where the four types of cards correspond to the four main characters from "The New Zoo Review" (Freddie the Frog, Henrietta Hippo, Charlie the Owl, and their human friend Doug). However, the clear focus of the game is for the players (ideally children and their parents) to discuss various emotions and values in response to scenarios from the show described on the cards. For example, by landing on a Charlie the Owl space, the player may receive a card which reads:

Charlie is disappointed when his oil well isn't a big "money maker."
TELL ABOUT ONE OF YOUR DISAPPOINTMENTS.

One odd element of the game is the Gift Exchange spaces, which require a player landing on them to use a large spinner to select a "gift", which can vary from "if you have any cards, give one away" to "apologize to somebody for something" to "scratch someone's back for 15 seconds".

The game comes in a "Christian Version" which includes two pages of notes on how to enhance the religious education aspects of the game.
categories: Animals, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Religious
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tchadji
description:
A manqala game. From http://www.wikimanqala.org/wiki/Tchadji:

Tchadji is a game played, at least, in Island of Mozambique (Ilha de Moçambique in Portuguese, the official language; Muhipitti in Makua, the local language). It has been studied by Abdulcarimo Ismael, a mathematician from Universidade Pedagógica, Maputo. It is played mostly by men.
Except for the initial position, and for the fixed length of the board, tchadji is identical to mefuvha and moruba.

Rules:

Tchadji is played in a wooden board with four rows of eight holes each. At the beginning there are 2 seeds (Caesalpinia bonduc) per hole. Each player only uses his side of the board, which consists of two rows.
At his turn a player takes the contents of one of his holes, which must contain at least two seeds, and distributes them, one by one, counterclockwise into consecutive holes on his own side.
If the last seed falls into a non-empty hole, its contents are distributed in another lap in the same direction, and so on.
The move ends when the last stone is dropped into an empty hole.
If the last seed is put into an empty hole of the inner row and the opposite hole of the opponent contains seeds, these enemy seeds are "eaten" (odjá).
Additionally, the seeds of the outer hole directly behind it, if any, are also eaten and the contents of another (any) enemy hole. The eaten seeds of the opponent are removed from the board.
When a player has only singletons (ompwechá, "divided into pieces"), he is permitted to move them, but only into empty holes.
The winner is the one who captures all the opponent's seeds.
Other data
Talking about habitual players, the first move is made without counting, as they know beforehand what are the best moves. Usually the first move is made from the last but one hole in the outter row (the second from the right). On next moves players do count.
According to the study made by Ismael, a game lasts a mean of 146 seconds, and 38 moves per player. The shortest (in time) recorded game lasted 62 seconds. The shortest in moves, 16. The longest, 4 minutes 39 seconds and 73 moves respectively."

name: L'Auto-Portrait des Animaux
description: Players try to cover places on their cards based on what animal is called out. They must match an animal and its simile as in "As clever as a ?" (Fox should be the answer).

name: Dragon Lord
description:
Become a Dragon, ruler of your Clan, use your armies of slave servitors - Drake Warriors, Scale Masters, Human Sun Dancers and Ogre Gladiators - to defeat your enemies.

In conjunction with your mighty Draconic Sorceries, gain in Rank and Prestige as you win each battle, enabling you to lead larger and stronger armies from one confrontation to the next.

A collectible card game, published in the UK in starter packs of 75 cards. Possibly only available at conventions for a limited time.

name: Whirletto
description: This game uses a gyroscope/spinning top and plastic 'balls' containing ball bearings. In the center of the bottom of the box is a little metal dish. You spin the gyroscope, put your 'balls' into the box with it and hope that they are hit by the gyroscope and sent through one of the four holes into the corners (the bottom of the box has a diamond shaped framework with these holes in it). Balls that reach the 4 corner holes score points dependent on where the wind up along the diamond. The game is "MADE IN ENGLAND" by an unknown maker.

name: The Sisti Challenge: Circular Checkers
description:
Published in 1963 by "Circular Checkers, Inc." in Newfoundland, New Jersey, "The Sisti Challenge" is a Checkers variant. The publisher provided a round board consisting of 37 circles arranged in four concentric rings and split among two colours, and two sets of checkers (12 in each colour). As in traditional Checkers, the players' goal is to capture the opponents' checkers or to force the opponent into a position in which any legal move will allow the moving piece to be captured.

The rules approximate traditional checkers, with only six circles in the outermost ring serving as "Kinging Circles." (These are the three rings for each colour that are farthest removed on the board from the opponent's home territory.)

The construction of the playing area into a series of rings comprised of circles creates the necessity of several unique rules, specifically redefining "forward movement" (the motion of a checker toward its opponent's central kinging circle, the "Rules of the Nearest Circle" in movement and jumping that define which circles a checker may move to from its current position, and a "Single Combination Jump" which allows one checker jumping another within its ring to change directions and end in a separate ring.

name: Touchdown
description:
Thanks to ebayer gljacobsct for info on this game

Touchdown from Milton Bradley (There is a NAVY Pennant on the game board but the box title is simply Touchdown) comes with 1 spinner dial numbered 1 to 6, one head linesmen piece and 1 Milton Bradley Football Playing board.. Players spin the dial to kick off. After placing the ball on a square according to directions in squares one to six, the head linesman piece is placed 20 squares ahead of the ball. Each square represent ½ a yard with the object being to gain 10 yards or twenty squares within 4 spins. If a player should not succeed in advancing the ball 10 yards in 4 downs, the opponent takes possession of the ball. If the ball lands upon a square marked “opponent offside” no count of that down is taken. Should the ball land for two successive spins upon “forward pass incomplete" within a period of 4 downs the spinner is penalized 5 yards or 10 squares. The squares of the game have results in them which direct the person spinning the spinner to go to different squares on the board which might add yards or cause a fumble or score a touchdown.

name: Zip Code
description:
Object -

Be the first player to fill the 12 bins in his letter case with properly Zip Coded letters. This is done by rolling dice and drawing letters.

Summary of play -

Players each chooses a letter case bin (1 of the 4 different colors) each has a unique zip code, then each player is dealt a starting hand of letters. These letters are sorted into a players bin if they have the correct corresponding zip code. All other letters are placed face down in front of each of the players.

On a turn a player rolls two non standard dice. One with colors and the other is numbered 1, 2, or 3. The color rolled determines the pile of letters a player will draw from the number determines how many letters are drawn.

First player to fill his bin wins the game.

name: Kombik旦nig
description: A noun, an adjective and a letter are flipped open, and all players need to find a word that matches all three components by shouting out a profound or silly association. There are several variants of this included in the rule sheet.

name: Dolle Jolle
description: The players use drinking straws to blow their little sailboats towards a finish line. The sailboats have a rounded wooden hull and a plastic sail and are difficult to control.

name: Geography Game
description: Card game where you ask geography questions on the cards. A correct answer will get you the card. If no one can answer your question, you keep the card. The person with the most cards win.

name: Uncle Sam's Cabinets
description:
A card game of collecting sets of historical Presidential Cabinets. The Presidential Cabinet at the time consisted of Secretary of State, Secretary of Treasury, and Secretary of War. The player that collects the most Cabinets wins.

The each card has background information about the person.

name: Boys are Stupid, Throw Rocks at Them!
description:
From the publisher's web site:

But first you must collect them! Just answer the wacky questions to pick up enough rocks and race back to your home base to win the game. But watch out, other players may steal your rocks by challenging you to a throw-off.

So what are you waiting for? Pick up the dice and let's find out who has the best throw!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Ragnarok
description:
From the publisher's website:

Ragnarok is Upon Us!

You gaze across the once peaceful lands as you strap on your heavy armor and weapons. The leather creaks and steel clangs as you gird yourself for war. Overhead, storm clouds gather and the lightning slams into the earth in great forking bolts all around you. A howling north wind scourers the lands clean in preparation for the final conflict that will decide the fate of the world.

You know in your heart that of all the battles that have come before, this will be the last, and greatest. This is Ragnarok, the final battle between the gods of men and the dark forces of the night.

With a wave of your massive hand you summon forth the heroes and Valkyrie that will fight at your side. The ground trembles under the footsteps of your mighty foes. There they are! On the horizon, grim giants, fell beasts, and the undead of countless battlefields approach in unending waves. Above the clatter of their weapons and armor a clear deep note pierces the sky.
