description: The game is manufactured by Are-Jay Game Co. Inc., Cleveland, Ohio. It comes with a wooden board that is attached to the box along with pegs and a die. For 2, 3 or 4 players. I could find no date for the game.

name: La Grande Boucle 1954
description: Small French game published in July 1954 about the Tour de France. The game works with dice but strangely enough the players get rewarded for throwing low numbers.

name: Wonder Woman Justice League of America Game
description: Features: Aquaman, Batman, Flash, Superman, Green Lantern, and Jonn Jonzz Super Hero cards along with Wonderwoman in a simple roll and move game from Hasbro.

name: ADDO
description: ADDO is a Bingo variant where the "banker" draws chits containing sums (from 0 + 0 to 9 + 9) and calls out the two numbers. The players then check to see if they have the answer printed on their card. The first player to cover all 9 numbers on his/her card wins.

name: Lustiges Schrobenhausener Spargelstechen
description: Two players start at opposing ends of the game board, which is made from wood and depicts an asparagus field which contains little wooden asparagus. The players now roll dice and move along certain tracks, in opposing directions (without getting into each others way), following instructions on certain fields or just harvesting the asparagus. When one player reaches his or her destination, the player with most asparagus wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mathador Kid
description:
Mathador Kids is a mathematical educational game from the designer of Mathador.

It consists of 25 little games played with large dice which involve mathematical operations.

name: Fun with Rhymes
description: Recognize, identify, and match rhyming endings in three different educational games played on the same game board.

name: The Classification Game
description:
This is a boxed set of four brightly colored cardboard scenes that fit together to stand up in a three dimensional display: a toy collection, clothes closet, zoo, and grocery. Each scene has twelve printed tiles of images that belong in that scene.

The object is to classify the image cards into the correct scenario. Does the bunny go in the grocery store, or the closet?

Gameplay can be expanded to include an entire classroom or smaller groups as players fit their items into logical groupings to encourage the development of organizational and classification skills.

name: Paduk
description: Paduk is a traditional game of Korean origin usually played on the specially marked inner 9 by 9 grid of the Go board. Players own two sorts of pieces, called stones (round) and columns (square). The stones are able to move, the columns stay on their places, until a player breaks the game, then all columns of this player go to the hand of this player for new placing. A player is not allowed to break the game twice, the hostile side must break the game also. Object of the game is to form geometrical positions of four on the board, which are formed of the two sorts of pieces. After the first move Paduk offers more movement possibilities than Go and clearly more than Chess.

name: Was ist Was: Junior  Ritterburg Kartenspiel
description:
Was ist Was: Junior – Ritterburg Kartenspiel has an educational aim: by reading (or getting read) the texts on the cards, the children learn details of daily life in a medieval castle. In order to complete certain tasks, like "There is a feast at the castle. Eat with the noble knights and lead the ladies to dance", you need to collect specific sets of cards (in the case of a feast: juggler, vegetables and roast).

You draw cards until you can complete one of three outlying tasks, then take the task-card, adding the worth of tasks once the pile of cards has been emptied.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Medieval

name: Cross Cartes
description:
A race game with tactics and luck. Plays with cards, pawns and board.

"Gobelet d'argent" winner at Boulogne Billancourt's International contest (Concours International de Cr辿ateurs de Jeux de Soci辿t辿) for board and card games designers for the year 1983.

name: Beint 鱈 mark
description: A simple football (soccer game) where players roll dice to move the ball and try to score. Players can land on special spots, get yellow or red cards and so on. Penalty shoot-out is possible as well.

name: Civil War "Blast from the Past"
description:
Civil War "Blast from the Past" is a game for children. It involves a 32 page booklet that contain the rules, assorted trivia of the Civil War and most importantly, the answers to the questions on the cards in the game!

It is a game where you move to a space and according to what the space is that you landed on, you pick up a card. This can result in moving further, hampering your opponent or answering a trivia question.

There are also several sets of stickers that come with the game that are placed on a small map showing decisive battles of the Civil War.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Trivia

name: Ellipse
description:
From the Instruction booklet:

"ELLIPSE has a simple premise, but unusual tactics that you will enjoy for minutes at a time, or for repeated ROUND AFTER ROUND OF FUN!!"

Game includes
-vinyl roll up board (similar to vinyl chess mats)
-48 "jewels" in primary color (glass beads)
-2 "jewels" in secondary color for alternate "8 ball" rules.

The board features a series of circles and ellipses all intersecting at tangents and perpendiculars. Players take turns removing jewels from one shape (circle, or ellipse). The player who takes the last jewel loses. Strategy involves controlling the number removed on your turn by selecting intersecting shapes to either increase or decrease the number you take that turn, thus hopefully forcing your opponent to take the final piece.

name: Emergency Action
description: This roll-and-move game is designed to teach players about first aid. Each turn, the current player rolls a special die (featuring the numbers 1 through 4, a plus, and a minus). If a number is rolled, the player moves forward; pluses are re-rolled, and minuses cause a turn to be lost. Some spaces have special actions (roll again, go back to start, etc.), while others require the player to answer a question about first aid. If the player is unable to answer correctly, he or she must stay on the square and continue answering questions on subsequent turns until successful. Special "first aid station" spaces give "first aid fact" cards which may be used as references when answering questions. The first player to make it all the way around the board wins.

name: Grand Fleet: Tactical Naval Combat in the Dreadnought Era, 1906-1919
description:
Grand Fleet is a complete standalone game. It employs the Battleship Captain game system of swift naval combat, and the rules and components of the two designs are fully compatible. If you own Battleship Captain, you already have all the components contained in Grand Fleet.

Scenarios include:

Dogger Bank, Jan 1915
Falklands, Dec 1914
Goeben vs. Cruiser Squadron, Aug 1914
Nation vs. Nation (hypothetical)
Design your own

Contents:

Rules booklet
2 sheets of ship counters (British, French, German, Italian)
one sheet of game markers
Reference Card
scenarios

Included in:


Battleship Captain


Preceded by:


Tsushima: Tactical Naval Combat in the Pre-Dreadnought Era, 1890-1906


Followed by:


Battlewagons: Tactical Naval Combat in the World War II Era, 1920-1945


Includes a complimentary copy of Salvo!.

name: Quebec in a box
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μνος (alone or single) + polein πωλε畤ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Monopoly variant based on Quebec City.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Landhelgisspili丹
description: This game is all about the struggle between Iceland and the United Kingdom during the 50's - when Iceland was expanding it's territorial waters by increments.

name: Ben 10 Alien Force Web Cardz
description:
Based on the Cartoon Network series, Ben 10 Alien Force Web Cardz is a modular board game, where players place tiles from their hand to build the board that their character then travels, activating tiles as they move around the board.

The decks of tiles can be customized, and an online play element is included.
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Le D辿fifoo bleu
description:
Each player has to cross the 5 continents by placing continents cards in front of him.
The first player to reach that goal wins the game.
Players can also play negative cards to slow down or stop other players progression.

Game Components: a blue velvet bag, 110 charts, 1 , 1 score notebook, 1 pencil.

name: Pro Football's Extreme Gameday Trivia
description: This trivia game is played on a game board that looks like a football field. Each question is aimed at making you do different plays of the football game so you can advance on the field. About 2000 questions covering the last decades of pro football, and the company even offer free update cards to keep the game current.

name: Face of Emoch
description:
This card game is included as a bonus at the end of Points in Space 1, an RPG supplement. The card deck consists of 54 cards, each depicting part of the visage of the mad alien god Emoch: the left eye, the right eye, the left gova (tentacle-like horn), the right gova, or the maw.

Various hands are ranked. The best hand is Granmung's Death, consisting of five maw cards.

The card art was drawn by Dan Smith. The cards contain text both in English and in alien script.

name: The Sword in North Africa Event Deck
description:
This is a set of event cards for The Sword in North Africa variant of The The Sword and the Flame miniatures game. There are events for the French Foreign Legion as well as their enemies. The deck is similar to The Sword and the Flame Event Deck, but has events more suitable for TSINA battles.

A sheet explaining the use of the cards in a game is included.

name: Cykelspurten
description:
Cykelspurten is game for 2-6 players from 6 years and up. The game is about getting home on your bicycle - without getting hurt during the trip.
That's why you have to use hand signals and be aware of the traffic during the trip and further more to get the right equipment for your bike. (the bicycle cards)
Each player has his wn bicycle and a set of cards which is dealt at the start of the game.

On your way home you can encounter unpredicted challenges or surprises when you reach the police or !-places on the board. If you reach a bicycle store, you can draw a card from one of the other players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: WILD ANIMALS, Educational Games
description:
An educational Game for school and home
Content: 55 cards with animals and their description in 2 chapters:
A: uses, habits, characteristics
B: Their peculiarities
It can be played in 2 different types:

-The active player tries to get pairs of animals by naming his animal and asking another player if he/she has an animal with the same description.
With the peculiarities in chapter 2 on the cards the players can learn the different forms of the same attribute of animals.
-The active player reads aloud one peculiarity of one of his cards in his hand and all the other players try to guess the name of the animal. If they don´t find it he reads a second peculiarity, and so on.

name: Il Gioco del Giro
description: Italian cycling game published in May 1964 about the Giro d'Italia. The game is played over 6 stages, the track of each stage is composed by parts that can be put in a different order and it includes mountains. There are 2 dice in the game: a white one that determines movement and a green one that triggers events. The winner of the game gets the pink jersey?
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tour de France
description: Early cycling themed game. The board consisted of 10 cards measuring 12.5x23.5cm., they were put next to each other to form a track.

name: Le Jeu du Tour de France Spirou
description:
Belgian cycling game about the Tour de France released in June 1960.

This roll and move game inspired by the Game of Goose was published in four consecutive issues of Spirou (issues 1158 to 1161) during the summer of 1960.

The game is played in multiple stages covering the full Tour. For each stage, a common track and common rules are used for the first 80 squares. However, the last 20 squares of each stage are played on different tracks using different rules and some stages are played with completely different rule sets. Time trials, for example, turn into timed dexterity contests. Points are earned for every stage and overall rankings are tabulated.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Racing, Sports

name: Il Gioco del Tour
description: Italian cycling game about the Tour de France published in June 1961.

name: Euroraces
description: A table board game that was created by the Bank of Greece to promote the usage and knowledge of the new European currency called "Euro". The players are given cash in various denominations, and the object of the game is to visit as many as European destinations as possible and spend all the cash. The back of the board illustrates all the coinage and paper bill denominations of the new currency. The entire description is in greek language.

name: Sandokan: La Tigre della Malesia
description:
Simple Italian game for children, from TV cartoons in late '90.
Interestingly, movement is determine by use of chips.
Each player plays the role of Sandokan.
He must reach the fortress where Marianna is trapped, set her free and return back to Monpracen.
The first to do this wins the game.

name: Cyclisme Manager
description: French cycling game base on peloton movement rather than on individual riders' movement.

name: Jvgec
description:
French cycling game, the name stands for 'jeu de vélo et gestion d'une équipe cycliste'.

This game is mentioned as roleplaying but it is more a campaign of many games for a full year.

name: Tour de France
description: French cycling game about the Tour de France. Each player has a team of three cyclists and a series of tactics cards. Cyclists move by groups and players can use their tactics cards to help them. The race is composed of different zones like Sprint or Mountain. Race Event can appear in specific zones determined by Event Cards. Players can win on three different classifications : General, Sprint or Mountain.

name: Die Rundfahrt
description: Cycling game from Berlin.

name: Big Day Dice Games
description:
This simple black felt bag comes with 2 shiny metal 6-sided dice and a rulebook for 5 unique games. These games include:

Around the Horn = Players split into 2 teams, that line up on opposite sides of a table. Starting with the players at one end of the table, each team is given one die to roll. Players race to roll a 6 and then pass the die. The first team to have all players successfully roll a 6 wins.

Face-Off = 2 players go head-to-head rolling one die each. Low roller pays the high roller the difference in chips. Ties are paid by both players into a common pot in the center.

Dealer's Dice = Players take turns being the "dealer". The other players put a number of fingers on the table to guess what the dealer will roll. If you are right other players pay you their own finger-count in chips.

Wild Ride = A push-your-luck game where you keep rolling and add up the total of the dice for your score, but if you ever roll a six you bust and lose all your points for that turn. A double-six loses all your points you've accumulated for the entire game. First player to 75 points wins.

12 Down = Players write down the numbers 1 through 12 on paper and then take turns rolling to cover up as many numbers as possible. The numbers you can cover are ones that add up to the same total as your die roll. The player with the most numbers covered wins.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: alea
description: The components are colored tops and an hexagonal board with numbered holes. Throw your top and score the number of the hole where your top stops.

name: Professor Quizzle's Quiz Wizard Trivia: Television
description: Basic deck of cards with trivia questions about television programs. Can be added to any other trivia game for extended fun.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Knight's Domain
description:
Knight's Domain is played with similar rules to chess. Each side has only three types of pieces, 8 Knights, 3 pawns, and 1 King. The object is to Checkmate your opponents King. The King is restricted to movement within a 6 space area called the "King's Vale" at the rear of his board.

Game components as published include:
1 9x8 board with "Vale" area clearly marked
2 kings
16 Knights
6 pawns
instructions.

name: Super Gachapon Fighter
description:
Super Gachapon Fighter is a tabletop/miniatures fighting game ruleset designed for 2-4 players.

Players create their own personalized fighter (using any figures or miniatures you have at hand) and take to the streets for one on one or team based combat. Make any tabletop a arena to stage your bouts.

Use fireballs, combos or grapples to pound your opponent into submission. Or build up your charge meter and unleash a Super Move!

Visit www.gachafighter.com and download the Demo rules!!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Equine Trivia
description:
Equine Trivia, The Game

Players answer questions about horses and equestrian sports as they attempt to advance to the Championship Round.

Includes a colorful board, tokens, dice, score chips, rules, question cards, storage box, and rules.

The game features an unusual packaging concept: it comes in a plastic tote box.

(c)1984
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Coppa Santagostino
description: Italian cycling game released to promote a manufacturer of socks (!?). Played on a board measuring 49x34cm.

name: Das Camp
description:
Youth leaders can test their knowledge with this game. The game is about the organization, performance and evaluation of children in a youth camp.
The game is played with 2 to 4 teams with at least 3 gamers. The game map is divided in three parts which symbolize the three phases of a youth camp. The teams have to go trough these phases and resolve the duties and responsibilities which they get by cards. The team which is first to reach their goal wins.

name: Convention
description:
A tabletop dexterity game where players flick wooden half-cylinders into each other, scoring points when a flicked piece hits another of the same orientation.

The 48 wooden pieces are tossed on the table. Those lying flat side down are called "Republicans", and those lying curved side down are called "Democrats". In addition, four of the wooden pieces are colored blue and deemed "Independents". Players attempt to flick a piece into another of the same affiliation, without hitting any other piece. Special rules detail the proper way of handling Independents and any maverick pieces that happen to land standing on end.

An odd marriage of Crokinole and Pass the Pigs.

name: Guard the Hive's Golden Treasure!
description:
Guard the Hive's Golden Treasure! was published on the back of a Honey Nut Cheerios cereal box in 2008. The cereal box comes with a Magic Compass Decoder that is used in playing the game.

From the box:

Guard the Hive's Golden Treasure!

Buzz and his friends want to move the honey that makes Honey Nut Cheerios cereal so delicious across the amber ocean. But Yellow Jack and his crew won't make it easy!

To Play:
Help Buzz transport the honey across the ocean or challenge a friend to see who can get there first. To play, flip a coin to determine how many spaces to move. Heads move one space, tails moves two.

When you land on a compass, place your magic compass decoder on the spot and move it back and forth to reveal the symbol for your next move. Use the key to determine the value for each symbol.

name: Alpha Cards: The Game of Games
description: This deck of 100 cards, each containing a letter and a point value except the two wild Alpha cards, can be used to play a variety of word games. Included with the game are instructions to play Alpha Cards and Team Alpha Cards (beginner and expert); Crazy Alpha, Alphataire, Five Card Alpha, and Five Letter Alpha.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Spelling

name: Der kleine U-Boot-Kommandant
description:
The complete title including subtitle is "Der kleine U-Boot-Kommandant auf großer Fahrt nach Engelland" which literally sounds like "The little U-Boat-commander on his speed to England"but figuratively is saying, "...on the great mission against England."

This may be the first U-Boat game ever published (1940) and is inspired by the previous successes (real and propagandistic) of the German submarine force.
Aim of the game is to shoot enemy vessels with a spring driven torpedo.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: G坦b辿
description: There are two rounds in this game. In the first round players put down hexagon tiles of their color, In the second round they put down white tiles and remove their tiles, and get points according the number of neighbors of the removed tiles. The board, which is made of these hexagon tiles, always has to remain connected.

name: Harmat
description: In this monopoly-type game the result of the dice-roll determines only the direction of the movement on the board (every field has at most six neighbors). The properties are companies and players can only buy shares of the companies.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: V叩llalkozz okosan
description: The title refers to the classic Hungarian boardgame Gazd叩lkodj Okosan!, where you have to manage your money smartly. Here players lead a company, hence they have to manage their money and the company's money too.

name: Az abakuszt坦l az internetig: informatikai t叩rsasj叩t辿k
description:
The players can acquire parts of a computer answering questions about the basics and the history of computers and internet.

Play with ease from @z abacus to @z Internet! 1000 questions, in 6 topics, in 3 levels of difficulty, according to the age and preparation of the players. It encompasses the knowledge of computer technology and information technology, and guides you from the basics to the ever-developing world of today. We can walk this path in such a way that in the middle of the enjoyable and exciting game, our knowledge increases imperceptibly, the computer becomes our friend, and the possibilities offered by technology open up before us. We especially recommend it: at school, for class or professional activities, for differentiation, for spending time at home, for free time activities, for preparing for competitions. Go to the world of IT!

name: J坦laspili丹
description: In this game the players travel along a simple track in the Biblical areas, from Nazareth to Bethlehem, and to Egypt and back. The box is made out of steel and the pawns are magnetic.

name: Hustler Intercollegiate Football
description: A solidly made tin Football Game that has a large roller at the top and a very nice graphic representation of a ball field. (Hustler also produced a Baseball Game of the same ilk.) That roller has a slot at the top of the game that shows results of the play depending on what is happening on the field. In other words with different field position the play yields different results.

name: The Greatest Mission is the World
description: The Greatest Mission is the World is a Risk-like in which players control "armies" of LDS missionaries in an attempt to get their missionaries into every country in the world. Players roll dice in battles determine which missionaries will get sent home and collect cards for victory which can be traded for more missionaries. Special interest is paid to Israel as the player who controls that region has access to the 12 Tribes to help win battles.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: LDSopoly
description: LDSopoly is a Monopoly style game in which players complete for stewardship of LDS Temples. One player is chosen as the bishop who is in charge of all finances. As players move about the board and "visit the temples" they pay offerings for temples to those who have stewardship over them. The winner is the first to control all temples.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Temples Chess
description: Temples Chess is an LDS Collectible Card Game somewhat similar to Hera and Zeus or a card game version of Stratego. The players have customizable and expandable decks of cards illustrated with an LDS temple and chess piece (which dictates the card's movement). The cards are laid out face down in a 5x4 grid and are revealed when used or attacked. The goal is to find and capture your opponent's king.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Temples Collectible Card Game
description: Temples CCG is an LDS collectible card game somewhat similar to Magic: The Gathering. Cards feature pictures of LDS temples with indicators of Priesthood Power and required amount of genealogy cards needed to activate the card in battle. Players build their hands from an available 130 cards to have the most Priesthood Power. Kingdom Cards (sold in Booster packs) allow for an increase in Priesthood. Temples that are defeated go to the graveyard until one player emerges victorious.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Christians and Saracens
description: Christians and Saracens is a low-complexity wargame based on the Battle for Jerusalem. Up to six players can play as an army from the period (Britonian, Franks, or Saxon Crusaders or Turks, Arabs, or Egyptian Saracen). The goal is to break through your opponents' defenses while at the same time maintaining your own. The game is flexible enough to allow one defender the opportunity to beat three attackers (in a four player game).

name: How to Host the Greatest Mission in the World Party Game
description: How to Host the Greatest Mission in the World Party Game is an LDS storytelling game. Each player fills out a ballot and takes turns telling stories about their LDS Missionary Experience (whether full time or just telling a neighbor or coworker about the LDS Church). After stories are complete, the players use the ballots to vote on the stories. Blue ribbons are provided in the game for prizes.

name: Sesame Street Preschool Games for Growing: Counting
description:
This GAMES FOR GROWING -- Counting Game Set is designed to help your child learn to count, to learn different ways that numbers are written or shown, and to do simple adding and subtracting. This learning is done in the way that children learn best -- through play.

Includes 3 decks of cards in different sizes, spinners, and a parent teaching guide with teaching tips and rules for 8 different games.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number

name: Pas de Charge
description:
Pas de Charge is a set of rules for Napoleonic Miniatures.
Rules covering the entire Napoleonic period.
Each player in turn pulls its overall initiative to make voluntary movements, spontaneous movements are carried out later.
After shots were fired artillery and fighting Melee.

name: Impacto
description:
Impacto is a set of rules for WWII Miniatures of 5mm.
The rules are a basic introduction to the game of miniatures.
Sequence of game is typical: simultaneous movement and fire.

name: Pok辿mon Diamond and Pearl Battle Dome
description: This game comes in a huge box, and builds up a multi-level tower measuring over two feet tall at 26 inches. The game comes with five different Pokémon miniatures, and players choose which to play. Each level of the tower features a different game usually representing a Pokémon-style showdown, culminating in the top level, where one player takes the cannon while the defending player controls his piece, trying not to be hit.

name: Harigana
description:
Harigana is a tile-laying word game for Japanese for 2 or more players. Tiles have hiragana syllable symbols rather than letters. The game is similar to Scrabble, but has some differences in the scoring system and some other differences to accommodate the Japanese language and the hiragana writing system.

The game was designed with Japanese language learners in mind, but can be played by Japanese speakers just as well. Japanese language learners should not hesitate to use a dictionary to help find words, and are advised to use an optional rule that awards bonus points if they can write kanji versions of words correctly (without looking them up, of course).

name: Grand National: A Sweepstakes Game of Chance
description: Featuring a copyright date of 1937, the box proclaims the game to be "complete with game * board * money * dice * horses * counters" and inside it indeed comes with all those parts. There are four horses -- red, blue, green and yellow -- in this game, which was released by Whitman Publishing Co.

name: You're the Boss
description:
From the publisher:
This character education game teaches students how a real business works, as well as how employees directly contribute to the success or failure of the business. As the game progresses, profits and sales are affected by the behavior of employees under realistic business conditions. Students will recognize exactly which behaviors employers value in their employees. A fun game that reinforces good employee behavior and introduces common business terms. Includes teacher's booklet and reproducible score sheets.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Zap Bam Pow
description:
[From the box back]

"Time to throw your best combinations and shout out loud. With a little strategy and luck, you'll be the first to get rid of all your cards to win this lively game of pivotal plays. How many times can you Zap? Is it time to Bam? Can you plan ahead to Pow at just the right moment? A game of cards never looked or sounded so fun."

Contents:
60 Cards
3 Start Cards
Rules of Play

In this simple card game, players take turns playing their cards to one of 3 piles, initially in the three suits of Zap, Bam and Pow. When playing a card, it must match either suit or number of the card being played on, with a matching number switching the suit of the current pile and allowing the player to continue his turn. The first player to play out all his cards wins.

name: Pitch-A-Ring
description:
From game box inside:
4398 THE THREE GAMES OF PITCH-A-RING CROWN THE KING AND RING TOSS
These games may be played by two, three of four persons.
Directions For Playing Pitch-A-Ring
Remove from the box, and inset the tall post in center socket (wooden post 9" long) of wooden frame (two wooden interlocking pieces 11" long). The player takes his position at such a distance from the box as may be agreed upon, thus bringing one of the four posts directly behind the tall one (4 shorter posts 7" long).
Each player in turn pitches all the rings and endeavors to make the highest score according to the following plan. Each hoop that goes upon the tall posts counts 50, and a hoop on any of the other four posts counts 5. The hoops that do not go on to any of the posts count nothing. The players may take as many turns as shall be agreed upon, each player throwing all the hoops at each turn (4 wooden hoops 6" diameter).
Crown The King
This game is played precisely like the preceding, only it may be placed in any position, and a hoop upon the tall post counts 10, and a hoop upon any of the other four posts counts 5.
Ring Toss
In this game the short posts are dispensed with, the tall post is inserted in the socket in center of the frame. Each player, in his turn, pitches all the hoops. Every hoop that goes upon the post counts any number that may be agreed upon, as 10 for example, while all others count nothing.

name: Kids Say the Darndest Things! Family Game
description:
Based on the hit TV show starring Bill Cosby and classic segments from Art Linkletter's "House Party" program, the Kids Say the Darndest Things Game takes the most outrageous comments made by kids and puts them in a game that the whole family can play.

Players are read a question straight from the Kids Say show and then read four possible answers. It's your job to choose which response was actually given on National TV. As you move around the board, you may also land on "Hot Seat" spaces that will put you on the spot to fill in the missing words from a Kids Say response.

Players score their correct answers on a Bill Cosby scorecard. The first player to completely uncover Cosby wins the game.

name: Peanut the Elephant
description: Simple roll and move game, the object being to get your elephants through the SHADY, HAPPY and SUNNY Jungles and to the finish line which is the HOME OF THE PEANUT.

name: Search for Sita
description:
This is a game conceived by Kreeda, and is a sequel to Vanavas. In the Indian epic - the Ramayana, Dasharatha, Rama's father is forced by an old promise to send Rama, his eldest son away to the forest for fourteen years. Rama is accompanied by his wife Sita and brother, Lakshmana. Vanavaas - The Adventures in the Forest follows their experiences until the kidnapping of Sita.

In this game, you follow the adventures of Rama and Lakshmana as they Search for Sita and seek the help of the vanaras or monkeys.

name: Kleuren en figuren
description:
One of the "Tingo - Fun for Child and Parent series" games.
All the games in this series are created to challenge the skills of the child.
This game is created to improve & challenge sense of touch & sight for children (Ages 4 and up)

The game contains 24 plastic tiles, 4 boards showing different images and colours and a plastic frog
The goal of the game is recognition of difficult shapes and color-combinations

the tiles show an image or a color, the boards have images in colors.
there are different levels to play this game.
Goal is to match an image on the board with the tile in the same color and a tile with the same image.

name: Voel de Vorm
description:
One of the "Tingo - Fun for Child and Parent series" games.
All the games in this series are created to challenge the skills of the child.
This game is created to improve & challenge sense of touch & sight for toddlers

the game contains 24 plastic tiles with different patterns(dots, stripes, squares,...) (2 of each)
The rules describe 11 different ways to play using the tiles
Some of the possibilities

The goal of the game is to find (by looking at it) 2 of the same tiles.
The same as above but by feeling (blindfolded)
use them as a memory game.
blindfolded memory
Name the shape on the tile

name: Marathon
description:
Players take the roles of Gods, secretly
influencing six Heroes as they strive to complete the mythical Marathon race. You must be subtle as you influence
your Heroes: once a God’s favorite Heroes are known, the other Gods will work to thwart them! At the end of the
race, the God whose favorites have moved the furthest wins the game!

Get the game for free here:
http://www.bonegames.com/beta/index.htm

name: The Game of Saints
description:
This is a card game featuring sets of christian saints. The rules list three games: The Game of Saints (Rummy), All Saints Memory Game (Pairs) and Saints (Snap).

The cards show 10 different saints, with 4 cards for each saint showing different aspects of his or her life, and 2 "All Saints" cards.

There is also a sheet of rules, which includes a "Who's who" of the saints illustrated.

The game was produced for the Leicester Diocese Mothers' Union.

name: WWII-opoly
description:
In September, 1939, Adolf Hitler's Nazi Germany invaded Poland, beginning a war that would eventually involve the entire world. The Second World War cost more than 70 million lives. Among the dead were millions of innocent civilians including the victims of the Holocaust. The war ended when the United States dropped the first atomic bombs ever used in war. WWII-opoly commemorates twenty-two of the most recognizable battles and conflicts fought during WWII. The battles are positioned chronologically on the board. While playing WWII-opoly, players will learn the location and essential information about each battle.

The object of this game is to increase the size of your army and conquer the battlefields. Each game consists of a board, 2 dice, tokens, 35 infantrymen, and 15 artillery. There are Axis and Allies cards, battlefield cards for each battlefield, and enlistment rosters with different amounts of men to increase army size.

name: Revolutionary War-opoly
description:
On April 19, 1775, "The shot heard round the world" began a war for freedom. It took the American colonists eight (8) years to gain freedom from King George III of Great Britain. Noble men fought till death so that future generations of American-born citizens might have life, liberty, and pursuit of happiness. Revolutionary War-opoly commemorates twenty-two of the most recognizable battles and conflicts fought during the Revolutionary War. The battles are positioned chronologically on the board. While playing Revolutionary War-opoly, players will learn the location and essential information about each battle.

The object of this game is to increase the size of your army and conquer the battlefields. Each game consists of a board, 2 dice, tokens, 35 infantrymen, and 15 cavalry. There are American and British cards, battlefield cards for each battlefield, and enlistment rosters with different amounts of men to increase army size.

name: Civil War-opoly
description:
The United States was torn apart from 1861 to 1865 by the Civil War, primarily, due to slavery. The Civil War was the first war fought on American soil and cost more than 600,000 lives. Among the ten costliest battles were Gettysburg, Chickamauga, and Chancellorsville. The war ended in 1865 with the freedom of slaves. Civil War-opoly commemorates twenty-two of the most recognizable battles and conflicts fought during the Civil War. The battles are positioned chronologically on the board. While playing Civil War-opoly, players will learn the location and essential information about each battle.

The object of this game is to increase the size of your army and conquer the battlefields. Each game consists of a board, 2 dice, tokens, 35 infantrymen, and 15 cavalry. There are North and South cards, battlefield cards for each battlefield, and enlistment rosters with different amounts of men to increase army size.

name: ReimFit 1
description: Each card in this card game contains one larger picture and two smaller ones. The item in one of the smaller ones rhymes with the larger one. The players have to find out which one rhymes and then ask other players for missing cards to complete pairs. The rhymes are in German, the game is designed as a learning aid.

name: Godfrey Cambridge's 50 Easy Steps to the White House
description: A game in the Monopoly style about an African-American running for President in 1968.

name: Colour Tactics
description:
A "Colour Mixing" Game for up to Four Players

Designed as an educational toy for children, Colour Tactics is a tile laying game, where players place tiles to create coloured tracks.
Each player begins with 8 tiles, and either places one each turn, or draws one if they cannot play. The winner is the player who plays all the tiles in their hand first.

There are 6 different coloured tracks - Red, Yellow, Blue, Green, Orange and Purple - the primary and secondary colours.
These tracks can only be joined to create the correct colour mix (eg: red and yellow joins to orange).
In this way, children will learn about colour mixes.
Ages 3 - 7.

name: Scrambled Egg
description:
Be the first chicken to kick your egg over the fowl line.

Contents: Barnyard game platform
2 funny chicken finger puppets
plastic egg
4 discs
2 scorekeepers
Ages 4 - 10 for 2 players

name: Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race
description: A simple roll and move game (using a six-sided die), along path of 100 spaces representing the course of a yacht in the famous Sydney to Hobart yacht race (raced annually, starting on Boxing Day, since 1945) down the east coast of Australia. Along the route, red spaces incur penalties (missed turns or backward moves) and green spaces give bonuses (extra turns and forward moves).

name: Have A Word
description:
A simple letter-tile-placement game. Words can be formed diagonally as well as horizontally or vertically. A spinner is used to determine where the next word must go: either at the beginning, middle or end of an existing word, or "any" (anywhere on the board). The penalty for not being able to put down a word is to pick up 1-4 more tiles (as indicated in the outer circle of the spinner).

The aim is to run out of letters. When someone does so, their score is the total number of tiles remaining in everybody elses racks. The rules suggest playing three games in a row to determine an overall winner.

name: Shadrack
description:
The game is called SHADRACK and was distributed "exclusively by the John Ladell Company". The game was made in TAIWAN and has the number (no.412) on the box.

The game is a well-made wooden game. It comes with a 10 X 10 board and some hard wood pieces. Those hard wood pieces include 14 tiles with number 1 on them, 10 tiles with number 2, 6 tiles with number 3, and 4 tiles each with N,S,E,and W. The tiles fit into the spots on the game board. Also included is a black covering which lays over the gameboard. That covering has an opening cut in it which allows a 4 x 4 area of the gameboard to become visible. On the covering is printed the name of the game, the company the game is made by, the letters N,S,E,and W and some fancy scrolls in each corner.

SHADRACK'S THE NAME. GAMBLING IS THE GAME!

Take Tic-Tac-Toe, flavor it with a hint of Craps, toss in a soupcon of Dominoes... and you've got a swinging new game called SHADRACK! Can be played for matches, pennies, dimes or dollars. Two to eight players. Solid mahogany board makes conversation piece worth the price alone.

name: Beneath Cragmist Castle
description:
"It is oft said that lying beneath the towering stronghold of Cragmist Castle a complex maze of underground dungeon chambers exist"

Beneath Cragmist Castle is a dungeon race game for 2-4 players.

Player's take turns to progress through a maze of disorientating catacombs, building up their inventory as they do so, to reach a secret entrance into the dungeons of Cragmist Castle. Once here, it is the Mercenary's job to rescue a Prisoner and then both Mercenary and Prisoner escape from their captors.

What makes the game unique is the mechanic that enables the player's pieces (a 'Mercenary' and a 'Prisoner') to move through the dungeons. To pass through passageways players must have a Skeleton Key in their possession that matches the door they are passing. Beware though, because not only must players avoid the ever present dungeon Guards, they must avoid traps that have been set within the dungeon.

A player's Prisoner begins the game in a locked cell, within the dungeon, that must be opened to free him. It is the Mercenary's job to assist the Prisoner in his escape attempt. The first player’s Mercenary and Prisoner to escape from the dungeons wins the game. An escape is made when a player’s pieces enter the Guardhouse.
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: El juego de la guerra de los golpistas
description:
The Spanish transition lived through three attempts at a Coup D'Etat. The game focuses on the last attempt at a Coup D'Etat that occurred on the 27th of October, 1982 during which the Coup participants were arrested and judged.
At the 14 of April of 1984 sentencing, seized documents from the Coup participants showed a detailed plan to isolate Madrid and to occupy the key points of the city. These documents were submitted as evidence. The defense claimed that they were based on theoretical exercises of wargames that were standard practice at the military academy.
The game designed by Rafael Diez and published by the magazine Tiempo the 7/5/1984 is based on these documents.


La transición española vivió tres intentos de golpe de estado, el juego se centra en el último intento de golpe de estado que se tenía que realizar el 27 de octubre de 1982, los golpistas fueron detenidos y juzgados.
El 14 de Abril de 1984 se dicto sentencia, entre los documentos incautados a los golpistas existía un plan detallado para aislar Madrid y ocupar los puntos clave de la ciudad. Estos documentos fueron presentados como pruebas y la defensa alego que eran ejercicios teóricos basados en los wargames que son de práctica habitual en la academia militar.
El juego diseñado por Rafael Diez y publicado por la revista Tiempo el 7/5/1984 se basa en estos documentos.

name: ReimFit 3
description: Sets of three cards with pictures of rhyming items have to be collected. In his or her turn, a player asks another player for a certain card. On his own cards, only the beginnings of words are spelled out, and the player has to decide which of the two possibilities on each card rhymes with the item in the large picture on the respective card.

name: Taxi
description:
Taxi was 1992 participant at the game designing contest of the Hippodice Spieleclub.

It resulted to a publication of it in the German game magazine Spielerei.

The game itself is very easy. Rolling dice, moving your taxi and collecting money. Some times you can move taxis to a different lane to block others from moving.

Contents:
1 Punch-out sheet containing of:
1 Game board, 32 cards, rules
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: James Bond Jr. Game
description:
Backcover reads:

Take part in James Bond Junior's greatest adventure and try to save the world from nuclear catastrophe. James and his friends battle with the likes of Oddjob and Jaws. Will they save the world or will the forces of evil win?

Players take on the role of characters from the cartoon series and are trying to prevent the launch of nuclear missile on a deserted island. By collecting enough computer disks, the heroes will be able to deactivate the missile. At the same time, they must watch out for SCUM agents that will try to stop them and take back the stolen computer disks.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Guerilla: Universal Rules for Warfare
description:
Guerilla - Universal Rules for Warfare by Iain Dickie, Rules by Jim Webster

(Webster seems to have authored the rules for actual combat, while Dickie apparently authored the rules for determining the forces and deployment.)

Simple miniatures rules for guerrilla warfare in a wide range of eras. (A list of guerrilla wars going back to Scythians vs Persians in 516 B.C. is included.)

The forces for each side (State and Guerrilla) are determined randomly. A d6 and a d100 is rolled for each side. The d6 determines how many officers(state) or leaders(guerrillas) are present; the d100 result is the number of troops. The two rolls together determine the force's mission.

For example, a roll of 3/13 gives the state forces one major, two captains, 3 lieutenants and 13 troops. Their mission reads, "You have captured one important guerrilla leader and must escort him, alive, from one corner of the table to the opposite for a show trial. Convoy." A roll of 6/50 gives the guerrilla forces 6 leaders (and, as a 6 was rolled, one of them must be secretly designated the chief leader of the war) and 50 troops. Their mission reads, "Funeral of a fighter, now a martyr, being used to whip up support. The three most senior leaders are at the graveside with both parents of the victim. Next the enthusiastic fighters form a ring, surrounded by the reliable and unreliable fighters mixed, who are in turn surrounded by the fanatics and remaining leaders. Company."

The way in which troops are deployed on the board is determined by cross-indexing the mission type of each side on a table. In the above example, the state's mission type is "convoy" and the guerrillas' is "company," which gives "deploy company first then start convoy."

A d10 is rolled to determine the location, which can range from "Steep hill country" or "dense woodland" to "city back streets" or "market town, market day, very crowded."
categories: Ancient, Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Renaissance, Wargame

name: The Sailor Boy
description: This is a simple spin the spinner and move game where you begin your adventure at sea as the lowly CABIN BOY and by successfully moving around the board eventually get promoted to ENSIGN, LIEUTENANT, CAPTAIN and in order to win the game, ADMIRAL.

name: The Group Word Teaching Game
description: from the rules: This game provides a means by which the 220 basic words that make up about 2/3 of all primary reading books can be learned.

name: The Great Football Card Game: AFL Football Edition
description:
[From back of the box]

There are sixty individual "Footballer" cards in the set and an equal number of these cards are dealt to each player in a clockwise direction. Two players receive 30 cards each, three players 20 cards and so on.

The purpose of the game is to secure all of your opponent's cards whilst retaining your own.

The Dealer, or Player One, has "Possession" and he begins by reading aloud he name of the player on his first card, together with the single statistic that he believes will prove superior to the corresponding statistic on his opponent's card ie: "Alex Jesaulenko - Goals 434".

Player Two responds by reading aloud the corresponding statistic on his first card ie: "Leigh Matthews - Goal 915".

Since Player Two's card has trumped Player One's, Player One hands his Alex Jesaulenko card to Player Two, who together with his Leigh Matthews card, places it on the bottom of his deck. These cards will in turn come into play again.

As Player Two has won the hand, he secures "Possession" and reading from his next card might continue with "Bill Picken - Games 240" and so on.

Player Two retains "Possession" as long as he continues to win each hand, securing his opponents cards. The moment he loses a hand, "Possession" reverts to Player One and so on until either player has secured all of his opponent's cards and is declared the winner.

name: To The Pole With Shackleton
description: This game, from the famous shop 'Hamleys Of London' was produced around Christmas time in 1910 and is about Ernest Shackleton's near miss attempt to reach the South Pole during that year. (He eventually succeeds in 1914-1916). I know little about the game except that I did see an artist's rendition of the game being played in the book "SAFE RETURN DOUBTFUL - The Heroic Age of Polar Exploration" written by John Maxtone-Graham. The game is about racing sleighs to the south pole and uses pencils to map out the route. From page 259 of the book. "The game was played on a large circular papier-mache board, painted white and grooved with concentric ridges of miniature sastrugi (SASTRUGI = Wind eroded snow, which often looks rough, like frozen waves. Usually found on windward slopes). Each player assumed the identity of a famous explorer and, equipped with special magnetic pencils, coaxed miniature sledges through the maze of tracks toward the central pole, False leads led to dead ends, and any player thus stymied could extricate his sled only by using a magnet of reversed polarity marked "Dr. Cook""

name: Kill The Sheep
description:
The game can be played on any piece of paper, as long as you have two pencils and two players.

How the game works is simple. One player assumes the role of the sheep and one person assumes the role of the person trying to kill the sheep for various reasons. To start the game, a sheep is drawn on the page, preferably in the middle, then one person decides to go first and draw something on the page. Remember, the sheep is trying to escape the traps of the killer while the killer is trying to kill the sheep. The game eventually reaches a point when one person or the other is trapped, and has died. This can be over in a few minutes or drag on into a philosophical debate. The choice is up to you!

name: Race Cars: Tracks and Drivers
description:
In this simple roll-and-roll game, players roll dice and then move their Hot Wheels-style race cars around a large (22"x36") mounted board featuring an oval race track. The winner is the first driver to complete 36 laps, enter the victory lane, and then land in the winner's circle.

The game is complicated slightly by Lap Cards and Pit Cards. Eight Lap Cards are drawn by each driver over the course of the game; these cards may instruct the players to move their cars or may indicate problems that require a visit to the pits. The driver must be able to enter pit road within two turns or suffer further consequences, and each driver must draw a Pit Card (which may further delay re-entry) upon leaving pit road.

Contents: 5 Racing Cars, 2 d6, 1 Score Pad for keeping track of laps and Lap Cards, 1 Game Board, 30 Pit Cards, and 40 Lap Cards

name: Oil Drills
description:
The goal of the game is to build a collection of the deepest oil drills.
Each player will first place a bid on resources buying order. After placing the bids the resources are rolled and players in bid order can buy resources.
Using the bought resources the players can deepen their oil shafts. Usually a player can only do one build action but with the help of their train workers and helpers they can have more build actions.
At the end of the turn players can sell oil in order to gain money to help them build deeper shafts.
At the end of the game the player with the best shafts depth combination wins. However, if a player catches a place of a possible deep shaft and does not build it as deep as possible he will get a penalty. Remember, money is just a tool in the game and not a goal!

name: Shlak
description:
Splatch, Katch, Shlak!
It's a collectible game similar to pog but it uses larger discs made of metal. Each player put on the ground a pile of the same number of Shlaks (the metallic discs). With the use of a Splatch (a sort of giant plastic hand) the pile is hit and shuffled around. The player, in their turn, try to catch as many shlaks as possible using the "Katch", a sort of monstrous head with a magnet at its bottom controlled using an elastic cord.

name: Darkball
description:
Darkball, a "truly monstrous game!" it's a collectible soccer-like game. Each player creates his team choosing the players from his collection of monsters. Each monster has a point value and some special ability and it's printed on pog-like disks. The players use a sort of plastic hand to shoot the Darkball, a glowing ball similar to tiddlywinks.
There are 10 races to choose from and each one has its own champions and peculiarities. You can choose from Human Gladiators, Skeletrids, Reptyl Race, Walkir Viragoes, Zombics, Felinian Players, Canidians Pro, Droids Forever, Orchetto's people, Aracnyans.

name: From Boston to Columbia
description: This educational game is designed to teach facts about the cross-continental trek from New England to the gold fields of California in 1849. Die rolls move the players' wagon trains nearer to their goal, and many spaces direct players to draw cards. Most cards hinder the journey, while some speed things along.

name: War: A New Concept in War Games
description: A strange monopoly clone. Players use lorries to move around the board a la Monopoly. Players collect Army, Navy and Air Force pieces. When a player lands on an Allies space (properties) Each allies card is worth a certain amount of forces, and once war is declared, each allies card does a certain amount of damage to your opponent. War is declared when all players have at least one allies card.

name: Elsie and Her Family
description: This is a game about Elsie, the famous cow. Elsie has a husband named Elmer and they are proud parents of BEULAH. All 3 live in a big clean modern barn but during the daytime they are all out in the pasture eating sweet clover. In the evening they wander slowly back to the barn. In this game, you try to be the first to get your Elsie, Elmer and Beulah back in the barn. The game comes with a playing platform, a spinner, 4 sets of colored wooden pawns (3 pawns in each set representing Elsie, Elmer and Beulah.

name: Kingdoms
description:
From the box:

"If you like to play Euchre, Hearts, Pinochle or any card bidding game, you will love Kingdoms.

"A four suit card game played cut-throat or as partners.

"Instructions and Score Pad are included within."

Some interesting features of this game include:

- There are 4 suits (North South East West), with 15 ranks each, with 10-15 labeled as the Knight, Wizard, Bishop, Queen, King and Dragon. If the Knight and Dragon of the led suit are played to the same trick, the Knight wins.

- There also two special cards: The Supreme and The Void Card. They cannot be led but can be played to any trick. The Void Card voids out its trick, so no one wins it, though the player who played it still leads the next trick. The Supreme wins any trick it is played in unless that is not Voided.

- Of the 62 cards in the deck, 14 are dealt to each of the 4 players, and the remaining 6 are laid aside unseen, so people are not sure what is missing. Players pass 3 cards, similar to Hearts (left / right / across / no pass).

- Each player bids once on the number of tricks they'll take (minimum 4). The winner names trump, and gets one point per trick if he makes his bid, otherwise he subtracts his bid. Others must take 3 tricks each for 3 points or lose 3 points if they don't; unless they bid "Low", and if they take no tricks they get 6 points, or lose 6 if they fail.

- Winner is the first to 23 points.

name: It's a MAN's World
description:
This game is vaguely similar in play to Careers without the strategy. The similarities are in that there are different tracks players can take, however players have no choice where they go. Roll and move and do whatever the spaces say to do.

Pieces move around an outside blue track if their piece is male and the inside pink track if female. This is purportedly so the men can protect the women. Players move by rolling 2 dice, if on outside track, and 1 die if on inside track or "Profession" track.

Men start with paychecks of $710 and Women with $300. The first player to reach 10 status points and have $20,000 wins. Of course, the odds are so stacked that the lesson here is that no matter what a woman does she cannot come out ahead.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: First 'n' Ten: A Football Dice Game
description: A Football Dice game where players roll two dice, one large and one small, and compare the results to various charts depending on what kind of play they were running. Sometimes the big die counts as tens and the little die counts as ones, sometimes the basic numbers on both dice are added together to achieve a total. All of the dice charts have to do with offensive play calls.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mardi Gras
description:
This is a non-partnership precise-bid trick-taking game with a few twists.

The deck has five suits (1-King), with Mardi-Gras - related symbols: Masks, Crowns, Doubloon, Fleur de Lis, and Beads -- Masks are always trump. Plus there is one Mardi Gras card, which counts as the highest trump; and two FATuesday cards, which can always be played and count as the lowest cards (if led, a suit is declared). The 68 cards deal evenly with 4 players; with other numbers, leave out enough "1" cards so it goes evenly.

Each player bids the number of tricks he'll take -- the goal is to take exactly that many. If you make your bid you get 10 points per trick (a successful bid of 0 earns 10). If you go over, you get 1 point per trick taken; if under, you lose 10 points times your bid. Play until a pre-assigned total, such as 200 point.

The advanced Challenge game has extra rules: The Mardi Gras card can be declared when played as the highest or lowest trump; when led, each player must play their highest trump in hand. Bids are in secret, written down and revealed simultaneously. A Nil bid goes for 0 tricks and earns or loses 50 points. Finally, after the bids each player has a chance to double their own bid, to double the points at stake, except you also lose if you go over your bid.

name: Number Up
description:
This game appears to be a fusion of Yahtzee and Scrabble, from the Lowe's the original publisher of Yahtzee Lowe's.

The object of the game is to roll the included wooden 6 sided dice with non-traditional numbering building sequences that players place on the board for scoring all while under time pressure from the included sand timer. The board looks remarkably similar to a small Scrabble board, with double and triple score zones all in similar Scrabble colors. The game board, also has a built in dice tray to accept keep rolling all these dice in one place.

Components:

12 Wooden six sided dice
Blue plastic Game board with Dice tray
Dice Cup
Sand Timer
Instructions inside box cover.

name: Gimme
description: An exciting and thrilling combination of the nations most popular card games Poker and Michigan Rummy for both young and old

name: Card Spin
description:
This game maps traditional playing cards onto the magnetic wheels also found in Word Spin.

From the instructions: "Each of the 10 wheels contain a different combination of ten 'cards' for a total of 100 card faces. Wheels can be separated from each other and played individually, or snapped together magnetically in 'hands'. Millions of card combinations are possible.

"Using the magic CARD SPIN Wheels is fun and adds a new element of chance to games. Get the feel of the wheels. Most hands are played with 5 or less wheels. Rotate and arrange them to form winning combinations."

Instructions are included for versions of Rummy, Black Jack, Poker, War, and a sort of Crazy Eights.

name: Starship
description: This 23 page rule book is a supplement to Star War 2250 A.D. It adds a starship design system, rule changes, new weapons, and technology levels.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Adventures of Pinocchio: An Electric Game
description:
A Spin-and-Move game with an 'electric' element. Players take turns flicking a spinner attached to the board and moving their wire prod. If the contact makes the whales eye light up, the player reads a fact about the story of Pinocchio from an enclosed booklet and then advances or retreats a set number of spaces per the booklet.

A 'Wiry Dan' game published by Harett-Gilmar, Inc. Circa 1950's according to the book American Games by Alex Malloy.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Kim Color
description:
A pure memory game for kids: players have 45 seconds to memorize the pattern of symbols shown on a card, then to reconstruct it upon a 25 squares grid by arranging tiles.

The game board consists of a wooden frame with five poles, each pole showing five wooden cubes (so a 5 x 5 grid is formed). Each of the four cube sides that can be on top (all except the two with the pole running through it) has a symbol (one of five).

The cubes are randomly set up, then a player (or a team of players) has a minute to look at the pattern. The grid is then covered and the player(s) have to reproduce the pattern with wooden chips that have to be placed in the same order as seen. The player(s) with the best memory is/are the winner.

name: Ion Glory's Destroyer
description: Ion Glory's Destroyer is a supplement to Ion Glory adding two new ship types, frigate and destroyer, a new optional rule, more ship and weapon cards, and new action cards. Like the original game, components are supplied uncut on card stock.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame

name: Upstacks
description:
The sky-high, dice-stacking game!

Do you have luck, skill and a steady hand? UPSTACKS is the exciting new game from GAMEFORCE Studios that provides a fun game experience for 2-4 players.

Roll the dice! Every dice counts when its time to add up the points. Be the first to reach the final score and win the game, but beware of the penalty dice as your opponent pushes you to go too far. How high can you stack YOUR tower?

name: Yangsh
description: In Yangsh two players try to make rows of 5 markers by flipping them to their own color. Markers can be flipped by jumping over them with pawns, moving along straight lines in 8 directions. Pawns can only land on an empty field. Markers are placed when taking off form an empty field. When you succeed in making 5-in-a-row, you must take the row and one of your pawns off the board, making it harder for you to make the next 5-in-a-row. First player to play 3 pawns off the board wins.

name: Timber Wars
description:
This is a basic wargame that uses bits of wood as units. Each group is marked with a group tag. The game uses a point system based on gold pieces -- each unit is worth a certain number of gold pieces and are purchased at the beginning of the game. The players alternate placing terrain, structures, and siege engines. Once this is completed, the players fight it out to see who is victorious! Players can also come up with scenarios if they wish.

Available from http://gnomegaming.com/ourgames

name: The Red White & Blue Game
description: Game comes with a cloth game board, wooden squares and instructions in a heavy drawstring bag. Instructions say that the game is a game of logic and strategy for 2 to 4 people. The game is published by Scuda games of Boston.

name: Ranch Poker
description:
Six cards are on the table. Players place bets on any of those (no tokens included for some reason) and roll three dice. The dice show on of the cards on each of their sides. If the cards you bet on are rolled, you get double your money back (one die), triple (two dice) or quadruple (all three dice). No goal is set, players just play as long as they want.
Was one of six little games in Piatnik's Texas Series in 1989.

name: Rocky Hill
description: Dice rolling game from the 1989 "Texas Series" published by Piatnik. Cards are placed on the table and form the "game board" Players move by combining the results of three dice in any way they see fit. In this way, they have to reach the exact number displayed on the next card of the route. You have to move to the 12th card and back in order to win the game.

name: Sherbie vs The Silverfish
description:
A light-hearted game of insecticide and stress for three to five players.

In the battle against vermin, you're either with Sherbie, or against her. Amass an army of silverfish and send them to torment Sherbie, or grab a paper towel and some bug spray and attempt to defeat the insectile menace. In the end, only one side can triumph.

Object: Be the player with the most silverfish in either your Sherbie stress pile or your squish pile.

name: Robot Maze Race
description:
Equipment: Each player needs a pencil and a sheet of paper marked as follows:


Two 10x10 grids of squares, each grid should have rows labeled with A at the top through J at the bottom. Columns should be labeled with 1 at the left to 10 at the right. These grids will be referred to as your secret grid (the maze your opponent is trying to navigate) and your open grid (where you are trying to navigate the maze made by your opponent). You should not show your paper to your opponent at any time in the game.
Space to write down your robot's program each turn.
Space to mark your robot's health.


Robot Maze Race is a maze-solving game. Each player tries to program their robot to maneuver through a disorganized warehouse without bumping into too may crates or walls on the way.

An entry into the About.com: 2005 Deduction Game Design Competition.

name: Por'rika
description:
Por'rika(c) (Sacred Waters) is an old Schelati(c) game. The Schelati are a species of amphibians that have, since the beginning of recorded history, laid their eggs in the Sacred Waters. These Sacred Waters, however, happened to be located in the prime hunting territory for the Ser'ra(c), large birds of prey that were the Schelati's only natural enemy. The game is based on this conflict.

The object of the copper side is to get both Egg-Carriers into the Scared Water spaces. The object of the silver side is to stop that from happening.

An entry into the About.com: 2002 Unequal Forces Game Design Competition.

name: Pipelayer
description:
Pipelayer is a game played with two grids of dots that are slightly offset from one another. The long dimension should be one longer than the short dimension.

The players take turns moving by connecting two dots. A player can only connect dots that are adjacent horizontally or vertically and also only dots of his own color. No move may draw across another move. To win a player must make a continuous connection from one side of the board to the other in the long direction for his color of dots.

An animated example is available on the game's website.

name: Package War!
description:
Equipment: Package War! requires a minimum of 16 six-sided dice, and pencil and paper for noting points scored. 26 six-sided dice are recommended.

Package War! is a two player game where each player takes on the role of a package shipping mogul determined to dominate the industry and crush the competition. In this cut-throat game, each shipping magnate tries to foil the competition by crushing their packages and stacking their own packages as high as they can. Be the first to dominate the package shipping industry!

An entry into the About.com: 2004 Shared Pieces Game Design Competition.

name: Zest
description:
This is a gin-rummy-type word card game, whose object is to be the first to clear your hand.

The deck has 54 cards, two of each letter and two wild cards. Players are dealt 9 cards each for 2, 3 or 4 players, 8 each for 5, and 7 each for 6. In a turn, a player draws one card from the draw or discard pile, lays down a word or adds to an existing word, and discards one.

The first player to go out gets one point per card in everyone else's hands; if the draw pile runs out the hand ends and the player with fewest cards wins the points. The game is won at 25 points. If a players spells "zest" without wild cards, he gets 25 points and wins immediately.

name: Witt
description:
This word card game has the uncommon feature that each card has two letters on it -- either one can be used to make a word. (They are in opposite corners, but in each corner you see one letter, its value, and the letter in the opposite corner.) Of the 105 cards, 8 of them have a are wild cards in one corner, and four are wild on both ends.

Each player is dealt 8 cards, and the top card of the draw pile is used to start the discard pile. In a turn, a player makes a word starting with either letter of the top discard, and using cards from his hand for the rest. The letters' values -- ranging from 2 to 20 -- are added for the word's score, which is added to the player's total. The word is then discarded, the player fills out their hand back to 8 from the draw pile, and the next player takes a turn, using the new top discard to start a word.

Players pass if they cannot make a word from their hand. The game ends when every player passes in turn, typically after the draw pile is exhausted. The lower value of each card in hand is subtracted from the players' scores, and the highest total wins. Optional rules allow bonus points for long words.

name: Spellbound
description:
This word card game has 108 cards, most with a letter and value (1-9), except for two wild cards with value zero.

Each player is dealt 10 cards. In their turn, a player may: form a new word from their hand; add from their hand to either end of a word already on the table; discard any number of their cards to the bottom of the draw pile; or pass. If they played or added to a word, they score all points in the word, then draw back up to 10. If a wild card is on the table, and they have a card for the letter it stands for, they may swap it for the wild card, at the start of their turn.

Play ends when the draw pile is exhausted and one player exhausts his hand or everyone passes in turn. The values of the cards in hand are subtracted from the scores, and the highest wins.
publishers: Exclusive Playing Card Company, Golden Rule Educational Products, Inc.

name: Starship Shootouts
description:
A tactical science fiction ship combat game played on a hex map. Fleets are created by allocating build points and designing ships. Different races have unique weapons and other characteristics.

The entire game comes in a 3" x 5" ziplock bag. The rule book is 2.5" x 3.5" and has 30 pages. A folded hex map (8" x 9") with tiny 1/4" hexes is included and has ship templates for all 6 races on the opposite side. Includes two d6 dice, each 0.50cm on a side.

Originally costing $1, this may be the smallest wargame ever produced!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Starships and Solar Systems
description:
A campaign game supplement for Starship Shootouts played on a hex map. Exploration discovers worlds which are then developed to produce build points which are used to build ships and bases. Rules for designing bases and new ship types (fighters and carriers) are included. Combat is resolved using Starship Shootouts with additional rules for attacking worlds.

The entire game comes in a 3" x 5" ziplock bag. The rule book is 2.5" x 3.5" and has 30 pages. A folded hex star map (5" x 8") with tiny 1/4" hexes is included and has templates for game counters on the opposite side.

Originally costing 50 cents, this may be the smallest game supplement ever produced!
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Starpower: Tactical Ship Combat in the 29th Century
description:
Subtitled: Tactical Ship Combat in the 29th Century, Starpower is the first game in the "Four Empires Series". It is a tactical science fiction miniatures game played on a large surface. It uses pre-written orders for each turn. There are minimal special abilities for the four "empires".

The game ships in a ziplock bag including a 32-page rulebook with advanced and optional rules, information on the four empires, and fleet compositions. Also included are reproducible ship miniatures and status sheets, an order sheet, a boarding template, tables, and counters for boarding parties and small craft.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 70 m鱈n炭tur
description: A game based on the tv show 70 mínútur (70 minutes). Players move along the 70 spaces on the track and have to answer questions, do silly things (called challenges) or drink the Disgusting Drink (the ingredients being various substances blended as the game progresses).

name: Fast Action Hockey
description:
Fast Action Hockey (DMC Games) is an exciting statistical simulation board game that lets you replay the NHL championships--or the entire 2000-2001 season--solitaire, or in head-to-head competition with a friend. Over 650 individually rated players representing all 30 teams are yours to command.

Fast Action Hockey plays quickly because it focuses on the "fun stuff"--shooting and scoring--while eliminating time-consuming elements that add little or nothing to the excitement such as face-offs, puck passing, penalties, line changes, time-clock tracking, etc. What makes FAH even better is the ease and quickness of play. You won’t have to spend an hour or two playing a single game. Instead, once you are familiar with the play sequence and the charts, you can play a game in 20 minutes or less, and easily replay the entire Stanley Cup finals in one evening!

Basic Sequence of Play

There are three phases to FAH:

1) Select 18 players and 1 goaltender from each team and list them on the score sheet.

2) Determine the number of shots each player will take during the game and write down in the "SOG" column of the scoresheet. To do this, check for the player’s shots grade ("Sh" on the roster sheet), roll all 3 dice and consult the "Player Shots" chart.

3) Resolve the shots for each player (i.e., determine the outcome of each player’s shots on goal.) and assign assists (the number of assists for each goal is indicated on the goal scoring chart).

Fast Action Hockey will produce lifelike statistical performances over the course of an entire replay season when playing schedules similar to the actual.

(Game was marketed on a limited scale in 2001 only, and sold primarily through Ebay).

name: The Haunted Musicians
description:
You are composers, haunted by music that you didn't write, and also doesn't exist. As such, all of you are in an asylum. To regain your sanity, you have to complete three of the compositions haunting you. Unfortunately, there are only so much paper and ink available at a time. Also, the asylum tries to keep as many of its patients in group therapy at a time as it can.

Players invest their tempo(represented by metronomes) to obtain the materials, time, and inspiration needed to complete the pieces haunting them. There are currently two card decks, one for 3-4 players and one for 5-6.

name: The Silver Dollar City Game
description: This is a roll and move for 2-6 players, based on the amusement park in Branson, MO. There are two ways to play, Basic & Advanced. In the Basic game players travel around the park and the winner is the first person to land on the finish space by exact roll. In the Advanced game players travel around the board gathering as much money as possible. Once all players have traveled the board, the winner is the one with the most money.

name: Al Pha Bet
description:
This game's deck has 60 cards, in 5 colored suits: black is all vowels, while red, blue, yellow and green have one 'E' and the rest consonants. In most of the games, black is considered wild, belonging to any color. There four games described.
